text: In the open central area, he saw both the small carriage and the supply wagon that Ravenhurr used for traveling and carry supplies back and forth to the keep.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked at it and smiled.
Name: Book 9

text: With the carriage horses and wagon he could strip a lot of useful items out of the keep.
Name: Book 9

text: He went next door to the smiths and started gathering up tools, and loading them up into the smiths travel trunk.
Name: Book 9

text: The nicest tools were in a cabinet, and with a grunt (it was heavy even for him) he picked it up and loaded it into the cart, along with some other useful implements.
Name: Book 9

text: He would need to carry as much food as possible as well.
Name: Book 9

text: He quickly went back into the main keep and wrapped up the mattress from Captain Poirs bunk and started carrying barrels of flour and other foodstuffs to his pile next to the front entrance.
Name: Book 9

text: The drudge stared at him with a strange look but did not question his actions.
Name: Book 9

text: He then realized that he should go up and check out the laboratory for anything else of value, and check out the dungeon to make sure all the prisoners had been freed.
Name: Book 9

text: He had brought a proper crow bar from his visit to the smiths and made short work of the laboratory door.
Name: Book 9

text: The room had several large circles in the floor and tables and shelves along the side.
Name: Book 9

text: The shelves held bones and bowls of strange fluids and other items whose uses he could not imagine.
Name: Book 9

text: Anything that felt foul he threw into the fireplace, after getting a good flame going.
Name: Book 9

text: Several books and strange containers ended up in the fire, though he did find two books that felt of magic that he kept.
Name: Book 9

text: He also found a small statue of a strange green mechanical frog that had that magic tingle to it.
Name: Book 9

text: He could not imagine its use; it appeared a simple toy, but he put it in his pile to take.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a heavy oak cabinet in the corner which he forced open.
Name: Book 9

text: Inside were large pottery containers, which he had seen before.
Name: Book 9

text: They held some of the magic powders used to make the circles that were so important to many of the most powerful of the Immortalists spells.
Name: Book 9

text: He checked the powders for magic and several came off very strong so he added them to the pile.
Name: Book 9

text: Two came off with the foulest feel yet, even worse than the books in the studio.
Name: Book 9

text: He could not burn them but knocked them into the middle of the room and then added a couple of the other non-magic powder containers.
Name: Book 9

text: In his final action before he left, he used the crow bar to shatter all the bottles, and made sure to mix the powders together.
Name: Book 9

text: He hopes that would make them impossible to use.
Name: Book 9

text: After moving what he wanted to take with him to his pile at the entrance, he headed down the stairs to the dungeon.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not want to go down there.
Name: Book 9

text: Some of his worst memories were from his time down in the dungeon.
Name: Book 9

text: Too many terrible deeds had occurred there, not that he had done many of them himself, but he had not been able to stop them.
Name: Book 9

text: He could have tried to stop the terrible things that had happened, but he had simply chosen to survive instead.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew the depth of his lack of true courage from his years of failure to act before now.
Name: Book 9

text: He went through the guardroom and was happy to see that Captain Poir had followed orders; there was no sign of the eight or so prisoners, including his rescued AElfin maiden.
Name: Book 9

text: He stared at the problem in the largest cell.
Name: Book 9

text: There, sprawled on the floor, were the two female Dire Cats that had been used to trap the Celestial lion.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas swore that as soon as he looked at the cats, they were already looking at him straight in the eye.
Name: Book 9

text: The large green eyes demanded something of him even as the animals lay in apparent complete relaxation, sprawled on the stone floor.
Name: Book 9

text: He had to let them out, but how was he going to do that.
Name: Book 9

text: If he simply opened the door, they might tear him apart.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought the cats may also attack the guard at the front gate on their way out.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked around and realized that the other side of the hall had a door that opened in the same direction as the door leading to the cage.
Name: Book 9

text: He opened it up and thought that if he opened the Dire Cats door, he could block them from this direction, while keeping himself safe behind the two doors.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew the guards at the gate would be incredibly curious about what he had been doing, but they would not actually do anything to challenge the man they thought was the Sorcerer Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: He also knew that he would have to get them out of the way of the Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: At least that way he could also claim the black yew recurve bows.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas walked back up the stairs and he thought that it would be a good idea to feed the beasts first, but he did not have time to grab a couple of chickens in the coop next to the kitchen.
Name: Book 9

text: The sooner he was away from the keep the better.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas walked up to the watchtower gates he once again wore the sorcerers robe that Captain Poir had fetched for him, but this time he wore it outside of his armor.
Name: Book 9

text: He climbed the inner stairs until he stepped into the watchtower room at the top.
Name: Book 9

text: He played it bold, walked up to the staring guard and signaled him to turn around.
Name: Book 9

text: Then Rodregas proceeded to gag and bind him.
Name: Book 9

text: The confused guard did not even struggle.
Name: Book 9

text: Next, Rodregas went to the front gate and repeated his actions with the lone guard at the gate; he then picked him up and took him to sit with his friend at the top of the gate.
Name: Book 9

text: He made sure both were securely tied up and blindfolded and took off their weapon harnesses and kept them; their two short swords were nicer than the ones that he had taken from the armory.
Name: Book 9

text: Both men also had purses with them that jingled with their bonus money in a promising way.
Name: Book 9

text: He then headed back to the dungeon, stopping at the chicken coop to let out the chickens.
Name: Book 9

text: They quickly spread all over the yard.
Name: Book 9

text: It would be better for the town folk who lived so close to the fort if the Dire Cats were not starving when they left.
Name: Book 9

text: On his way into the dungeon, he left all the doors propped open so the way out would be clear, and he made sure that all the other doors were closed.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily, the kitchen drudge had locked herself in the kitchen quarters.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then went back to the dungeon level and opened the opposite door and then the Dire Cats prison door and watched.
Name: Book 9

text: He had expected them to either bolt for it or stay in the safety of their room.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead they both casually got up and walked out, as if they were guests in a fancy inn, with all the time in the world.
Name: Book 9

text: As they walked out the door both cats gave him a casual glance as he held the two doors firmly closed together bracing for the weight if they threw themselves at the doors, but they just walked by and headed up the stairs.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted to follow, but Rodregas held himself back patiently waiting until it was safe.
Name: Book 9

text: They might look like lions, but he knew they were smarter than any beast, and they could be setting him up.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally after waiting what seemed like forever, but was probably only about twenty minutes, Rodregas slowly made his way back up through the keep.
Name: Book 9

text: When he poked his head out the entrance there was no sign of Dire Cats or chickens, but he did note a few stray feathers in the courtyard.
Name: Book 9

text: Other than a few alarmed sounds from the chicken coop, it was surprisingly quiet.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt a feeling of relief at the idea that the lions had eaten.
Name: Book 9

text: Still, he double-checked the keep and the courtyard very carefully before bringing out the cart and the horses and loading up all his booty.
Name: Book 9

text: The cart groaned with the load.
Name: Book 9

text: After a last check for Dire Cats in front of the keep he headed out and away from both Raven Keep and Raven Town and away from his old life.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 4 A FRESH START OR AN OLD PROBLEM.
Name: Book 9

text: Raven Keep, unlike many fortifications, was not located on a high spot.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact, it was perched half way down a gentle valley.
Name: Book 9

text: Farther down the valley, only a few minutes ride away was Raven Town.
Name: Book 9

text: Even the kindest of folk would admit the town was not much more than an inn, a stable, the homes of the people that supported the local farming community, and of course, Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: Many of the keep employees and their family members lived in Raven Town.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily for Rodregas, there was a turn off almost immediately that let him circle around the edge of town and then start heading out of the valley.
Name: Book 9

text: He went north toward the town of Cruet.
Name: Book 9

text: As dusk was falling there was little traffic.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily this part of the road was well cleared and open and the horses were fresh so he made headway even as it became dark.
Name: Book 9

text: He pushed hard until he reached the fork that headed west up into the hills.
Name: Book 9

text: It was seldom traveled by anyone except fur trappers.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas pushed on through the night and into the sunrise of the next day until even the horse that had been Korins ride, which he had tied to the back of the wagon, seemed to be tired and ready for rest.
Name: Book 9

text: He stopped and let the animals take a break next to a small creek.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not sure what would happen when the relief guards went to the tower and found the other guards tied up, apparently by Ravenhurr himself.
Name: Book 9

text: His assistant had been killed in the Masters own room.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas reasoned they would find the keep partially pillaged as well.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew Captain Poir would probably do one of two things: either come after him immediately or head to the Celestial Path Guild Hall in the capital.
Name: Book 9

text: If Captain Poir headed immediately for the Guild Hall to report the strange happening, it would give him more time to find a place to lie low.
Name: Book 9

text: However, it would be better for him if Poir went looking for Rodregas himself instead, and spread his men all over trying to find him.
Name: Book 9

text: There were only about twenty Ravenhurr guardsmen.
Name: Book 9

text: If they were sent in every possible direction, especially in pairs, there was a good chance that he would come across no more than two of them at a time.
Name: Book 9

text: If they were still confused about whether he was or was not Ravenhurr, he would have an excellent chance of overcoming them.
Name: Book 9

text: On the other hand, if the forces of the guild came after him.
Name: Book 9

text: The guardsmen of the Immortalist guild were known as the Immortal Guards and their reputation as the premier fighters of the realm was seldom questioned.
Name: Book 9

text: If they found out what had happened at Raven Keep there was not much chance for Rodregas survival.
Name: Book 9

text: After a simple meal, a good rub down for the horses and a few hours of rest, Rodregas got the wagon back on the road.
Name: Book 9

text: If he could keep up this pace, up he could be well hidden before any forces could find him.
Name: Book 9

text: At the end of the second day, before he had come to his last turn off, he realized that he would have to get some sleep.
Name: Book 9

text: He was feeling exhausted.
Name: Book 9

text: His body might be surprisingly strong and quick but apparently it still needed to sleep on a regular basis.
Name: Book 9

text: As soon as the horses were fed, rubbed down, hobbled and left to graze, Rodregas unrolled Captain Poirs mattress and collapsed into it with a welcome sigh.
Name: Book 9

text: Sleep came to him almost instantly.
Name: Book 9

text: In Rodregas life he had experienced several very unpleasant ways of waking up, but this was the worst: a searing hot pain stabbed into his stomach.
Name: Book 9

text: He reared up from his mat, but he felt hands holding him down onto the mattress.
Name: Book 9

text: It was dark, but he could see in the dim light of the moon that someone was shoving a knife into his belly.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew that in the next couple of seconds, his actions would decide his fate.
Name: Book 9

text: He was bleeding, so he would be losing strength as well.
Name: Book 9

text: Whoever his assailants were, they had him trapped.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas violently kicked out with one leg, but his stabbing attacker avoided the blow.
Name: Book 9

text: He did let up on the knife for a second though.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead of following up, Rodregas used the momentum of his kick to swing his body sideways.
Name: Book 9

text: Skilled, close up fighting was all about leverage.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead of resisting the attackers strength Rodregas pushed down on the earth with his hands and lifted his body up and to the side, curling the leg he had kicked out underneath.
Name: Book 9

text: He planted his foot under his body.
Name: Book 9

text: His attackers seemed confused, grabbing him and trying to counter his change of position.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas only had one leg under him, but he pushed off with it with all his strength and thrust himself up.
Name: Book 9

text: It should have failed with all the men holding him down, but he now had celestial strength, and even with the knife wound he was strong.
Name: Book 9

text: His attackers backed off, confused by the fact that he had gone from being their prisoner to suddenly rising.
Name: Book 9

text: The person pinning Rodregas left arm got too far away.
Name: Book 9

text: This gave Rodregas the leverage he needed to pull the arm free.
Name: Book 9

text: He punched his assailant hard in the face.
Name: Book 9

text: The attacker flew back and Rodregas jumped sideways to get more space.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas rested his right hand on the knife blade still sticking out of his stomach.
Name: Book 9

text: He was relieved to feel that it was not too deep.
Name: Book 9

text: He had not taken off his armor.
Name: Book 9

text: Although the knife had pierced the leather weave, the tip penetrated less than an inch.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas gritted his teeth and pulled the knife free.
Name: Book 9

text: From the feel of its balance, it was not a real fighting weapon, but only a simple utility knife.
Name: Book 9

text: Rather than try to use the unfamiliar weapon that was slick with his blood, he threw it into the dark.
Name: Book 9

text: Quickly Rodregas remembered he was in a fight for his life.
Name: Book 9

text: He backed up from his confused opponents and gave himself more space.
Name: Book 9

text: It was the middle of the night and there was only a sliver of moon, but he could still make out the forms of his attackers; there were four of them.
Name: Book 9

text: No, a fifth stood away from the others and watched.
Name: Book 9

text: The one who had stabbed him had the most aggressive posture: he looked tall and strong; Rodregas knew he had to take him out quickly so he moved in hard.
Name: Book 9

text: None of the attackers seemed to be wearing armor nor did they have any weapons, other than the largest man, who held what looked to be a garden rake.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas charged, bulling his way into the lead attacker and knocking him down.
Name: Book 9

text: The assailant fell, being surprised by Rodregas actions.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas grabbed him by the hair with his left hand and hit him full in the nose with his right fist.
Name: Book 9

text: Two others closed in with a group tackle.
Name: Book 9

text: The one on the right came in too close, and Rodregas gave him a good hard jab with his elbow in the stomach.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas heard his attackers entire breath exit at his blow and he followed him to the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas followed up with a roundhouse kick and laid a good blow into the kidney area of the other man.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas realized that his attackers were clearly not trained fighters.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt himself relax as he realized that they posed no real danger to him now that he was on his feet and aware.
Name: Book 9

text: Just as Rodregas relaxed from the heart pounding life or death moment that had awoken him, the man holding the rake stepped forward.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas realized that he was even taller and bigger than the first one.
Name: Book 9

text: The attacker swung the rake right at him with all his weight behind it.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was too close to dodge, and the rake hit his wounded gut straight on with the full brunt of his attackers weight.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas swooned in pain as his fresh wound took the blunt of the blow.
Name: Book 9

text: He had started to feel like he was faster and stronger than everyone else, and had not been expected the power of the blow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas went flying back down to the ground moaning.
Name: Book 9

text: He rolled with it and came back up.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought about the attacker and realized that here was one that would be a challenge.
Name: Book 9

text: Judging by the distance his attacker kept and how he was clearly keeping his center of gravity low and balanced, Rodregas knew this opponent was a challenge.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not just bigger and stronger; clearly he knew how to fight.
Name: Book 9

text: A good fighter, of course, knows you do not let an opponent recover.
Name: Book 9

text: His attacker came in hard and fast.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas never saw the blow to his face, but luckily it was not a direct hit as Rodregas was already moving in close.
Name: Book 9

text: Before the attacker could deliver another blow he was inside his opponents swing.
Name: Book 9

text: Getting close is not always the best strategy on a powerful larger opponent.
Name: Book 9

text: His attackers large hand reached for his face.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas turned into his weight and tried to use his momentum to drive the large body off balance.
Name: Book 9

text: But the attacker was built like a bull: broad and full of muscle.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas push against him had little effect.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Something felt odd about this last attacker; his body felt wrong, not human.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought, maybe an Orqui.
Name: Book 9

text: That would explain the muscular build, but that did not seem totally right either.
Name: Book 9

text: Sometimes there is a mutual agreement during a fight, especially when both are not sure who has the advantage.
Name: Book 9

text: The two of them started circling, and Rodregas tried to keep an eye out for the other men, but they seemed a little disoriented in the dark and appeared to be keeping their distance.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought he saw other movement as well, farther out, but it was more animal-like.
Name: Book 9

text: He was surprised any wild animals would be this close to the noise of a fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas waited for an opening, but it was hard to know exactly what was going on in the dark.
Name: Book 9

text: He was bleeding from his belly wound, and decided that he could not wait.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas decided to pull his short swords from the harness on his side and, at the same time, rush in on the big guy.
Name: Book 9

text: The large attacker was big and powerful, but his rake had shattered and Rodregas had his short swords on his harness.
Name: Book 9

text: His attacker appeared to not have a back up weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Then a voice rang out, Stop, STOP, it is not him.
Name: Book 9

text: It is not the Sorcerer Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a womans voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Then a much deeper voice, one that seemed half growl, responded, She is right.
Name: Book 9

text: This is no sorcerer we fight.
Name: Book 9

text: The voice was from his present combatant, the only one who had proven to be dangerous to him.
Name: Book 9

text: She is right, Rodregas said, I am not Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: We dont know that, challenged another voice from the dark.
Name: Book 9

text: As he stepped forward he recognized the shape of the large aggressive man that Rodregas had first thought was the leader.
Name: Book 9

text: If he is not Gerald, then he must be Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a silent response to that statement, but finally one of the other men lit a torch and held it up.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas quickly realized that in front of him were five of the eight prisoners who had been held in the dungeon.
Name: Book 9

text: How did you track me here.
Name: Book 9

text: The one with the torch waved it over toward the lone female of the group, the half AElfin maiden from the tower.
Name: Book 9

text: I am afraid you are not much of a woodsman, not that it is easy to hide wagon tracks, she stated, her voice hinting disapproval at his skill.
Name: Book 9

text: Still, it was far too easy, even though my people do not count me as one of their better trackers.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought of asking her if she was referring to her AElf or her Nymph heritage as her people, but decided it was best not to ask.
Name: Book 9

text: He had to admit she had a very nice soft voice to go along with that killer body and exotic look.
Name: Book 9

text: There were three human men, all large and well built, the AElf maiden, and whatever the large man was.
Name: Book 9

text: While the guy that he had tagged as the leader was nearly as tall and well built as Rodregas new body, the other two men were also very impressive.
Name: Book 9

text: They were all men that Ravenhurr had been testing for use as replacement bodies.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas present body had won as the most gifted human male that Ravenhurr could find.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas now remembered that the very large male was something else: half Orqui and half Infernal Daemon, one of those known as the Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: The Hellborn was actually a good head taller than even Rodregas, and even more broad and muscular.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact, his chest was so broad that it looked almost deformed, and something bulged in the middle of both of his shoulders, though the cloak he wore blocked the details of the strange bulge.
Name: Book 9

text: His face was blunt, except for incredibly sharp cheekbones, and his skin had a reddish brown hue.
Name: Book 9

text: His head was crowned with a pair of horns like a goats.
Name: Book 9

text: The horns were curled into his black bushy hair which was long, very thick, and very wild.
Name: Book 9

text: It was sticking out in weird ways from his head.
Name: Book 9

text: All the guards had been confused as to why Ravenhurr had kept him, as it was against the Guild rules to use any of the Hellborn in the ceremony.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalist was trying to become Celestial not a member of the Infernal realms.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a very stringent rule that everyone knew not to break, not that any of the guards was going to mention it to the Guild.
Name: Book 9

text: Who are you.
Name: Book 9

text: asked the man that Rodregas had tagged as the leader.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not sure who I am, Rodregas responded.
Name: Book 9

text: And I think I will keep any answers that I figure out to myself for now.
Name: Book 9

text: You are not Gerald though are you.
Name: Book 9

text: asked the AElf maiden.
Name: Book 9

text: Not to ask a dumb question, Rodregas asked in a curious tone but who is Gerald.
Name: Book 9

text: Silence followed his query but finally he got an answer.
Name: Book 9

text: He is the man that you appear to be, whose body you now have, responded the maiden.
Name: Book 9

text: And what are you five named.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a pause at his question.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew this was an important moment because once people say who they are they are much less likely to do violence.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not understand the reason, but he knew that to be true.
Name: Book 9

text: I am Imeralda, said the AElf maiden.
Name: Book 9

text: Then came the Hellborn, My name is Doivanaomeraldioan, but humans usually call me Doivan, he stated in a slow careful way in a very deep, deep voice.
Name: Book 9

text: The leader, after a pause, said, I am Audrian of family Corin.
Name: Book 9

text: The other two men identified themselves as Brit and Geor.
Name: Book 9

text: Geor, the one with the torch, was blond and like the other men, unusually good looking and well built.
Name: Book 9

text: Brit said little and was of dark hair and light skin.
Name: Book 9

text: Offhand, Rodregas thought he looked to have come from the northern Kingdoms.
Name: Book 9

text: Gerald was a friend of ours, we went through a lot together in the Raven Keep dungeon, spoke Audrian.
Name: Book 9

text: If you are neither him nor Ravenhurr, who are you.
Name: Book 9

text: Only another Immortalist sorcerer should have been able to steal a body from Ravenhurr, Audrian finished.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a good question and one Rodregas was asking himself.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted to spill the story, but he did not really trust these men.
Name: Book 9

text: He had spent hard years on the road and knew not to trust people that you have just met.
Name: Book 9

text: You especially do not trust people who try to kill you while you sleep.
Name: Book 9

text: And as long as people thought he might be Ravenhurr, maybe a little crazy from a spell gone wrong or something, the less likely the Guild of the Celestial Path would send the Immortal Guards against him.
Name: Book 9

text: So Rodregas said, Lets just say I am trying to figure out who I am.
Name: Book 9

text: You can call me, he thought for a minute, making it obvious he was making up a fake name.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not want to use his real name.
Name: Book 9

text: He thought to himself, Who do I want to be.
Name: Book 9

text: If Im going to try to fight against the Immortalists, then some sort of name fit for a Celestial Paladin, or maybe one fit for an Infernal adversary was needed, he thought with a smile.
Name: Book 9

text: The only way he could have survived the ceremony would have been divine intervention, so he said the first thing that came to mind, You can call me Sir Paladin, that will work for now, he said it with a smile and a slight snicker at his own joke.
Name: Book 9

text: Just what kind of Paladin would you be.
Name: Book 9

text: Why, it should be obvious to you more than anyone, Rodregas said with a slight bow to the beautiful half AElf.
Name: Book 9

text: The kind of heroic Paladin that rescues beautiful maidens in distress and frees innocent prisoners from the dungeons of evil sorcerers.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could not help but smile at his own line.
Name: Book 9

text: He had always found that a good joke was like a good insult; the best always had enough truth in them to sting.
Name: Book 9

text: Geor smiled, but the others seemed not to have appreciated his little joke.
Name: Book 9

text: The AElf maiden just looked at Rodregas quietly and thoughtfully.
Name: Book 9

text: The Hellborn Orqui smiled, but with a look that said he did it because the other men smiled.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had a feeling that Doivan lacked much of a sense of humor.
Name: Book 9

text: The other three men simply shook their heads at his idiotic statement.
Name: Book 9

text: Not that his statement did not have a hint of truth to it.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was sure everyone here had lost a loved one, at some point, to an Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: But, no Paladin of the Gods had ever come to their rescue.
Name: Book 9

text: The truth was that even if one of the gods was backing Rodregas, it was more likely to be some god who was pissed off at the Immortalists; one looking for a chosen champion for their own selfish reasons.
Name: Book 9

text: As a child Rodregas had dreamed of being such a champion, but Paladins were always chosen from the ranks of the Order of the Soaring Heavens, and while Rodregas had once served the Order as a squire he had never came close to achieving knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: All right, Sir Paladin, I have to admit I have talked to the Sorcerer Ravenhurr a few too many times, and you definitely dont seem to be him.
Name: Book 9

text: Nevertheless, we are taking your wagon and your supplies.
Name: Book 9

text: We will let you go in peace in the morning, said Audrian in that tone of voice that implied that he just expected people to follow his orders.
Name: Book 9

text: Hand over the shorts swords, Audrian continued, gesturing at the two blades that Rodregas had yet to pull.
Name: Book 9

text: We will return one in the morning.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smiled and nodded and pulled the two swords out simultaneously.
Name: Book 9

text: He was starting to think his new body was ambidextrous, equally comfortable with both hands.
Name: Book 9

text: That could prove useful, but would require some additional training to take full advantage of.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, since I was kicking your ass barehanded, even with a knife in my belly, how about this: I wont kill the bunch of you if you keep your distance and leave my camp at first light.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas tone was casual.
Name: Book 9

text: And, if you ask nicely, I will even leave you a few supplies to get to the nearest town if you promise not to tell anyone that you saw me.
Name: Book 9

text: And you will promise that in the name of the All-Father, or you will die at my hand.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not smile now, nor did they.
Name: Book 9

text: So you think you could kill all of us.
Name: Book 9

text: Put your sword down now.
Name: Book 9

text: demanded Audrian.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped forward and buried just the tip of his right-handed short sword into Audrians chest, hitting the ribs but not shoving the blade through.
Name: Book 9

text: Audrian gasped in surprise and fell back.
Name: Book 9

text: Swear you will keep my secret and you live, do not and you die.
Name: Book 9

text: Audrian just stood there looking at him.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he nodded and said, In the name of the All-Father, Lord of Sky and Earth and Water, I swear that I will keep your secrets.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and relaxed slightly; few would dare break a promise to the All-Father.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas decided that Brit and Geor were like pale shadows as they quickly followed suit.
Name: Book 9

text: When he turned to the last two he saw that they were very interested in what he was saying.
Name: Book 9

text: Where do you go, Sir Paladin.
Name: Book 9

text: He showed no sense of humor at Rodregas little joke about being a Paladin; Rodregas hoped Doivan had not taken him literally.
Name: Book 9

text: As far as I can, is my main plan at the moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Clearly the Guild of the Celestial Path is going to be looking for me.
Name: Book 9

text: Lets just say I dont wish to be found anywhere right now.
Name: Book 9

text: And if they find you and they will in time, will you then become a Vengeance Daemon.
Name: Book 9

text: asked the Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas simply flourished his short swords and smiled and stated, Lets just say that it should be interesting.
Name: Book 9

text: The Hellborn nodded very thoughtfully at Rodregas reply.
Name: Book 9

text: The half AElf had followed the conversation between them with obvious interest, and quickly followed Doivans lead in swearing the oath to the All-Father.
Name: Book 9

text: But with the two of them the oath seemed different, more easily said and with no need for threats.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not sure why, but he decided it was something to think about when he had more time.
Name: Book 9

text: The rest of the night passed quickly as Rodregas did his best to bandage his stomach wound.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not think the knife had cut into anything too important; at least it was not bleeding too badly.
Name: Book 9

text: He was surprised that he was not more tired; maybe his new body handled such things better and could make do with less sleep.
Name: Book 9

text: He was usually a light sleeper and was very surprised that they had been able to get the drop on him.
Name: Book 9

text: His guess was that the AElf maiden had cast some sort of spell on him to mask their approach, and he kept a close eye on her to make sure she did not repeat the effort.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course she was also very nice to look at, so he did not need much of an excuse to enjoy the view.
Name: Book 9

text: In the morning, he slowly pulled out some of the supplies and bundled them.
Name: Book 9

text: He tried not to show how much he hurt.
Name: Book 9

text: The wound might not kill him, but every movement hurt.
Name: Book 9

text: He also handed Audrian a few of his coins.
Name: Book 9

text: It wasnt much, but it would get them started; they were lucky he was being so generous.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt he owed them, and if he had been in their place he would have tried to kill Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: Clearly the three human men were eager to get started back to the main road.
Name: Book 9

text: He noticed that the Hellborn Doivan and Imeralda seemed to be hanging back.
Name: Book 9

text: As the three men started to head down the road Doivan walked up to Rodregas and stated, I would rather travel with you.
Name: Book 9

text: That was it; he just stood there like some huge tree after that simple statement.
Name: Book 9

text: Audrian seemed as surprised as he was.
Name: Book 9

text: They both spoke at the same time, their thoughts strangely in agreement.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you crazy.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Audrian at the same time as Rodregas said, That is crazy.
Name: Book 9

text: Look, the Guild will be after me, Rodregas stated.
Name: Book 9

text: It will not be safe to travel in my company, he added.
Name: Book 9

text: I know, stated the Hellborn in a voice that was so deep it was like stones grinding.
Name: Book 9

text: But still, I would travel with you.
Name: Book 9

text: Again he made the statement and showed no interest in explaining his action.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, added Imeralda shaking her long curly hair behind her as if to clear the way for her decision, I was thinking the same thing.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not safe from the Guild anyhow.
Name: Book 9

text: My natural magical talent is very strong, and until I am better skilled in it, I am very vulnerable, she stated And frankly, while Audrian, Brit and Geor are very brave to let me travel with them, I fear that I put their lives in danger.
Name: Book 9

text: You, on the other hand, are in more danger than I am, and should be even more motivated to stay out of the sight of the Guild.
Name: Book 9

text: After saying the little speech that she had clearly been practicing in her head, she added, Joining you makes sense.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas hesitated, but she had an excellent point, and of course turning away such a beautiful young woman was a difficult thing to do.
Name: Book 9

text: She did have a point and he did have a reasonably safe place to hide that he had been heading toward.
Name: Book 9

text: So, even if he did head out on a raid of the Immortalists, she should be safe enough.
Name: Book 9

text: The human men would be of least interest to the Guild and the easiest to blend in.
Name: Book 9

text: On the other hand, while the Hellborn were feared and disliked, the Immortalists should not be interested in Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: He was also clearly a gifted warrior and between the two of them they would make a dangerous duo.
Name: Book 9

text: However, the Hellborn were feared because of their daemonic natures; they had hungers and urges and famously bad tempers.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan could be just as much of a danger as help.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had to admit though, that in the little time he had dealt with him, he kind of liked the big guy.
Name: Book 9

text: It looked like Audrian was going to argue, but Rodregas just cut him off and stated, Very well, you two may travel with me, but lets get on the road.
Name: Book 9

text: Audrian, make sure you and the other two do not forget your oaths.
Name: Book 9

text: I will expect no one to know that we head for the Northern Coast.
Name: Book 9

text: Audrian looked like he was going to say something.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought the loss of the Hellborn did not bother him, but the beautiful half AElfin maiden was another matter.
Name: Book 9

text: However, her point about how she put them in danger clearly made him hesitate.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas just headed for the wagon and got it going.
Name: Book 9

text: With a last confused look from Rodregas, Audrian and the other two headed back towards the nearest town.
Name: Book 9

text: The three talked little as they traveled.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas set a hard pace and Imeralda sat in the back of the wagon.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan weighed too much to ride in the overburdened wagon or to ride the horse, so he jogged next to the wagon.
Name: Book 9

text: He had impressive endurance.
Name: Book 9

text: Right before dark Rodregas was watching carefully and found the faint signs of the rocky trail that he remembered.
Name: Book 9

text: He turned the cart onto it, and after going down the path a bit he came across a good place to camp for the night.
Name: Book 9

text: As Doivan and Rodregas set up camp, Imeralda went back, doing her best to erase their tracks.
Name: Book 9

text: After dinner they all took turns sleeping and keeping watch.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas took the first watch and several times he thought he saw something.
Name: Book 9

text: It was not the men they had left behind, but some animal that never came close.
Name: Book 9

text: It seemed to be hanging on the edge of the camp.
Name: Book 9

text: It seemed to be watching the camp, but it was not doing anything aggressive.
Name: Book 9

text: He remembered thinking he had seen an animal during the fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Maybe we were in a wolf packs territory, and they were just making sure that we were not disturbing their young, he thought.
Name: Book 9

text: Happily, this night proved to be more restful and peaceful then the last.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 5 A PLACE OF PRIDE.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas drove the wagon with Imeralda sitting next to him; Doivan continued his impressive show of endurance by actually jogging next to the wagon and showing no trouble keeping up.
Name: Book 9

text: As the trail was more of a hunting path than a proper road and they were traveling on an upward incline, the wagon was struggling to make much time.
Name: Book 9

text: It was not until their midday stop that the three had any real conversation.
Name: Book 9

text: So, asked Imeralda, where are we going.
Name: Book 9

text: I assume it is not the Northern Kingdoms as you said to Audrian.
Name: Book 9

text: For one thing that would be stupid, and for a second you seem to be climbing ever higher into the Arida Mountains and that is hardly the best way north.
Name: Book 9

text: He hoped to make it to his hideaway by nightfall, so he decided it did not hurt to share his plan at this point.
Name: Book 9

text: Youre right; we are not going to the Northern Kingdoms.
Name: Book 9

text: A few companions and I were hiding out in the Aridas and in one of the higher hollows I found an old farmhouse.
Name: Book 9

text: It has been abandoned for a long time, but it is well made and there is water and lots of fruit trees and berry bushes that must be left over from an old orchard.
Name: Book 9

text: After a moment he added, I always thought that if I ever needed a place to hide out that it was ideal.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course it will be rough there.
Name: Book 9

text: Outside of what we bring, there will not be much.
Name: Book 9

text: But it will be a good place to rest and he said gently patting his stomach, heal up.
Name: Book 9

text: We should be there by nightfall.
Name: Book 9

text: Not bad, said Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Sounds like a place that will be hard to find, but is this not territory infested with wild Dire beast.
Name: Book 9

text: Yup, Rodregas said, another reason I think this area is usually hard to find; most people stay clear.
Name: Book 9

text: He continued after a pause to let them think of entering territory known to be the hunting range of feared predators, I never saw any sign of any Dire beast in the hollows when I was there, but, of course, they probably know of the place.
Name: Book 9

text: Still, I would rather handle a pack of Hellhounds than The Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: Neither looked pleased at his logic, but both nodded.
Name: Book 9

text: A few hours later it was starting to get dark as Rodregas recognized the spot and turned the wagon left for the final hard assent.
Name: Book 9

text: At this point there was no trail, and common sense would have argued against the path.
Name: Book 9

text: It was hard work.
Name: Book 9

text: The horses had to be hand-led around rocks and trees and pulled up.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Rodregas had to manhandle the wagon around a few corners which was easier to do than it should have been, but Celestial and Hellborn strength together made short work of it.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, as they finally started to level out into the small little valley of the hollow, the hair all over Rodregas body suddenly stood up on end and his skin shivered.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was expecting it, but was a little shocked by the strength of his reaction.
Name: Book 9

text: All those years ago he had had to struggle to feel it.
Name: Book 9

text: Now he almost swayed in the currents of the magic stream of energy.
Name: Book 9

text: The wagon halted as Doivan stopped pushing it up the incline.
Name: Book 9

text: He just stood there, his wild black unkempt hair seeming to blow in an invisible wind.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda looked equally surprised and caught up.
Name: Book 9

text: Clearly Imeralda would have the power to sense the stream of magic, but Doivan had seemed equally effected.
Name: Book 9

text: She turned to Rodregas; her eyebrows arched high in surprise and said, A ley line and powerful.
Name: Book 9

text: I knew there were several going through the Aridas, but your little abandoned farm is next to a ley line.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, Rodregas said, it is right in the middle of it, and there is even a small undercurrent suggesting that another weaker one crosses at the farm point.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas explained, I had been on the run when we found this place.
Name: Book 9

text: I had been worried that those tracking me were using magic.
Name: Book 9

text: So to keep them off my track I traveled in and out of ley lines to throw off the magic scent.
Name: Book 9

text: This one runs underground before coming out in this small valley.
Name: Book 9

text: I was trying to find the ley line again.
Name: Book 9

text: That is how I found the old farmhouse.
Name: Book 9

text: Ley lines are like rivers of magic energy that encircle the world.
Name: Book 9

text: Most major Immortalist keeps and other magic locations are located either on one, or where two of them cross.
Name: Book 9

text: Magicians love them for all the free magical power just flowing by to use.
Name: Book 9

text: But while there is plenty of power it is not easy to use.
Name: Book 9

text: The power is naturally full of disturbances and chaotic energies.
Name: Book 9

text: The horror stories of magicians having terrible accidents with spells gone crazy on ley lines were legend.
Name: Book 9

text: This is why Immortalists used circles to manage the power.
Name: Book 9

text: Raven Keep was on such a line but you could not feel it due to the powerful circles built into the tower.
Name: Book 9

text: It was probably why Raven Town was not closer.
Name: Book 9

text: Come on, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: Lets get to shelter before dark.
Name: Book 9

text: As he headed into the hidden hollow the orchard became clear.
Name: Book 9

text: He was sure that at one point it had straight rows and a pattern to it.
Name: Book 9

text: But the orchard had been wild for a very long time.
Name: Book 9

text: While there was a bunch of fruit trees and berry bushes, most were the descendants of the original orchard and it was hard to find anything that reassembled a straight row.
Name: Book 9

text: The apples trees were in fruit and they all started grabbing a few of each to eat as they went.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not much of a farmer and did not know what the different types were named, but he liked the small green ones with the yellow splotches; they were sweet with a wonderful tang.
Name: Book 9

text: You know, said Doivan, Hiding on a ley line definitely makes sense for keeping the Immortalists off our back and these apples are delicious.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stared at him as he ate.
Name: Book 9

text: Humans ate around the core, but Doivan was eating the whole apple as he talked.
Name: Book 9

text: And I love the feel of all the magic.
Name: Book 9

text: My body was meant to live in a place that has more magic than our world does, but the lines are chaotic.
Name: Book 9

text: It is hard to sleep on a wild line.
Name: Book 9

text: It is going to be hard to stay here for long.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans deep voice had the tone of making a simple observation, not conversation.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded; he had been waiting for the comment, but he had thought it would be Imeralda who brought it up.
Name: Book 9

text: True, he said, unless you have a way of smoothing it out.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas waited for a few seconds as the three approached the main farmhouse building.
Name: Book 9

text: The walls were of thick cut stone and it was built on an impressive scale for a farmhouse, though worn-looking.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Of course, there were no signs of a roof, doors or windows.
Name: Book 9

text: As they entered the yard, the feeling of the hair standing up on their bodies settled down and instead a feeling of fullness replaced it.
Name: Book 9

text: The horses had been acting up and Rodregas hoped that with the energy smoothing out, the horses would stop fighting their lines.
Name: Book 9

text: Though in truth the horses seemed to be getting more agitated.
Name: Book 9

text: As the magic smoothed out Rodregas smiled and said, The ley line would be as much of a problem as a help unless, of course, the farmhouse is made of Nymph stone.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas expected the sound of pleased surprise but instead heard alarmed in-drawn breaths from them both; he saw that they were looking to the right, where he suddenly noticed movement.
Name: Book 9

text: Two female Dire Cats stepped out of the orchard and made their way to the farmhouse.
Name: Book 9

text: They had a relaxed, bored look.
Name: Book 9

text: He thought that they gave him a casual nod, but he could not actually see any movement.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas simply knew that these were the two Dire Cats that he had freed from the Dungeon.
Name: Book 9

text: Did everyone from that dungeon follow me.
Name: Book 9

text: he whispered to himself.
Name: Book 9

text: The three stood there fighting to keep the horses from running and watched as the Dire Cats stepped through the main door for a moment, but left after only a short wait.
Name: Book 9

text: The Dire Cats then circled the main building and went over to the far edge of the main house and then simply disappeared.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, I think they just went into the cellar of the home.
Name: Book 9

text: The entrance is over there.
Name: Book 9

text: Come on, lets get the horses over to the old barn and get them set for the night before it gets too dark.
Name: Book 9

text: Are those the two Dire Cats from Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: As she spoke she shook her long auburn hair behind her, something he was starting to realize was a nervous gesture.
Name: Book 9

text: Yes, I think so, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: I freed them from the dungeon before I left, and then I thought I saw them yesterday.
Name: Book 9

text: Apparently, everyone in the dungeon is following me, he said with a chuckle.
Name: Book 9

text: You saw them.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Not exactly he said.
Name: Book 9

text: I saw movement a few times.
Name: Book 9

text: I just thought it might be them.
Name: Book 9

text: I did not know for sure, he explained.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan asked Imeralda, Did you know they were tracking us.
Name: Book 9

text: No, I had no clue.
Name: Book 9

text: she said looking embarrassed.
Name: Book 9

text: She then added, I am not really a great tracker.
Name: Book 9

text: I mean, our Paladin was easy enough to find but tracking Dire Cats through the forest, that would require true skill.
Name: Book 9

text: But you did not sense them at all.
Name: Book 9

text: asked the Hellborn again.
Name: Book 9

text: No, she shook her head.
Name: Book 9

text: Why.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked, her voice curious on his repeated questioning.
Name: Book 9

text: Because I am wondering if our Paladin has a connection to the Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: I know a Celestial lion was used in the ceremony and whoever our Paladin is I assume he now has its essence, and those two were taken as the Celestials mates.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda and Doivan looked at him, and then she slowly added, And what was one of your first actions.
Name: Book 9

text: You freed them from the dungeon.
Name: Book 9

text: Dire Cats are smarter than regular lions; they might see you as an ally or part of their herd.
Name: Book 9

text: No wait, I think with cats you call them prides.
Name: Book 9

text: But I wonder how they see Doivan and me.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Neither Doivan nor Rodregas had an answer to that question.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Rodregas said, we need to find shelter and if they meant us harm us they would not have shown themselves.
Name: Book 9

text: Lets get the horses into the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: If they have been tracking me since I let them out, they dont seem to want to do any great harm.
Name: Book 9

text: With that Rodregas got out of the wagon and started to pull the horses into the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: Their noses were flaring, and he had to pull them almost to the opening.
Name: Book 9

text: As soon as they got close they both went charging in; they sensed the barn was shelter to keep them safe from the Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: Like the farmhouse, the barn was also built of the same impressive large cut stone.
Name: Book 9

text: However, while the stone was in great shape, all other materials seemed to have fallen apart.
Name: Book 9

text: There were several small trees and bushes growing in the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: The floor was also stone, and there was not enough dirt and debris for them to grow very large.
Name: Book 9

text: They had to clear a path to get the wagon in.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda ran her hand over the stone with a surprisingly gentle caress.
Name: Book 9

text: It is Nymph stone, right.
Name: Book 9

text: She nodded and said, Yes, I am half Forest Nymph and half AElf and this is beautiful work.
Name: Book 9

text: All Nymphs have a specific attachment to nature such as forest, stone or water.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a lot of variation among the Nymphs, but they could do amazing things with their element.
Name: Book 9

text: A connection to stone is much sought after by mages.
Name: Book 9

text: The stone could not store magic like the circles but it could smooth out the high level of magic available on ley lines and make it more comfortable to use, not in the big way of the magic of circles, but for using magic in small ways.
Name: Book 9

text: And, of course, only homes made by nymphs could make living on a ley line comfortable.
Name: Book 9

text: This home truly is a find, said Doivan, and now I see why the Dire Cats showed themselves to us.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 9

text: Dire Beasts seek such places to lair, answered Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Whether their ancestry is Celestial or Infernal, they instinctively seek a place that has a higher level of magic energy.
Name: Book 9

text: But they find ley lines like this irritating as much as we do, unless there is some way to smooth out its turbulence.
Name: Book 9

text: This is especially true of pregnant females.
Name: Book 9

text: The strongest dire animals are not just those of nearest descent, but also those who come to term in high magical environments.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, he had heard bits of this but he had not really thought about it.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan stretched his hands up and up to an impressive height, and a smile spread across his face, the first one Rodregas had seen on the Hellborn face.
Name: Book 9

text: It was good to see, though it was also a little scary as his teeth were more pointed than Rodregas was used to seeing.
Name: Book 9

text: His teeth had more in common with the Dire Cats than himself or Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, I know this first hand as it is the same for us Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: We will not grow strong if we do not spend much of our childhood in a place that is rich in magic.
Name: Book 9

text: This place feels very good.
Name: Book 9

text: The last few years the only time I was in a place rich in magic, I was also a prisoner.
Name: Book 9

text: It is good not to hunger for magic and be FREE.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was, of course, curious about the Hellborns background but had been hesitant to ask.
Name: Book 9

text: You do not want to piss off one of the Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: Hellborn were not necessarily chaotic and sadistic beings, like actual daemons or Greater Daemons, at least unless they voluntarily chose to become one of Hells Chosen.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not think even one of the Immortalists would choose to mess with one of Hells Chosen.
Name: Book 9

text: Hellborn on the mortal world were welcome among the Orqui much like those of Celestial blood were among the humans and the AElves.
Name: Book 9

text: The Orqui mated with Daemons and their offspring became its races noble house, just as the blood of Celestials flowed in the noble houses of Humans and AElves.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, here in the Eastern Realms true ruler ship was not by the demi-gods of the noble houses anymore but by the Immortalists and their Guild of the Celestial Path.
Name: Book 9

text: Often those of Celestial blood, instead of being rulers, were prey to the Guild for their rituals.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas decided it was now or never if he was going to ask Doivan of his past.
Name: Book 9

text: So, he said, was your mother in a place of strong magic when she was pregnant with you.
Name: Book 9

text: He held his breath, worried that his question might be impolite.
Name: Book 9

text: But Doivans smile continued and he nodded, Yes, my mother is a princess of the Orqui clans of the Farisa across the inland sea.
Name: Book 9

text: There the Orqui are torn between following the Celestials and the Daemon Lords of the Infernal Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: My family is of the Orrghirrlida tribe that follows the Celestials.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, the Daemon Lords love to tempt all those of Celestial blood.
Name: Book 9

text: I was born a bastard from an illicit affair of such a temptation.
Name: Book 9

text: While the shape my father had taken had been fair, I came out, well lets just say my paternity was not in question.
Name: Book 9

text: This is an old game among my people, Doivan continued and while I suffered much in my own clan, they kept me in the palace and I grew to adulthood in its strong magical confines and to my full strength.
Name: Book 9

text: So, Imeralda broke in, You are of both Infernal and Celestial blood.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan seemed hesitant to answer for a moment but after a long pause said, Yes, but most choose not to see it that way.
Name: Book 9

text: You are either Hellborn or not.
Name: Book 9

text: After I grew to manhood, I decided my true place was among one of the other clans, one that follows the lordship of the Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: He spoke this very slowly each deep rumble of his tone dragged out.
Name: Book 9

text: I was wrong though, and quickly realized that those who follow the Lords of the Infernal Realms were even a worse fit for me than at home, though they did see me as royal blood and not tainted.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan added, I eventually decided to start somewhere new and took a ship across the inland sea.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan paused at this and shook his head, his hair flying wild, as he seemed to want to shake out a memory from his massive head before he continued.
Name: Book 9

text: I am afraid I did not ask enough questions.
Name: Book 9

text: I just wanted to get a fresh start.
Name: Book 9

text: I was in Guild Dealer Taigas Menagerie to be sold within a week of my arrival.
Name: Book 9

text: He finished, his smile fading at the memory.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked at him for a second and said, Two years ago.
Name: Book 9

text: But that makes no sense, Rodregas said, his voice angry though he did not know why.
Name: Book 9

text: The Guild is supposed to be trying to make their Immortalists members Celestial.
Name: Book 9

text: Why would they hold you for two years.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded but then shook his head.
Name: Book 9

text: Trust me, I would like to know that answer more then you.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans smile was now long gone and with a shrug of his huge misshaped shoulders, he changed the subject.
Name: Book 9

text: So, Imeralda, the stone here still seems strong and like new, though clearly, it has been long after the construction of this place.
Name: Book 9

text: She was looking at Doivan strangely and it seemed to take her a moment to shift gears and answer his question.
Name: Book 9

text: Yesof course construction like thisstone enchanted to absorb the powerit makes the stone stronger with that power.
Name: Book 9

text: Stones formed like this will last as long as the ley line does not move, which happens only rarely and over centuries.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: What is strange is this is not a farm designed by Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: The design of the home and barn is clearly human, yet it would be strange for a simple farmer to be able to afford to have his building built of Nymph stone and way up here in this remote place, She said.
Name: Book 9

text: Sir Paladin, Doivan asked, You said you traveled here the first time with friends.
Name: Book 9

text: Might they tell folks of this place.
Name: Book 9

text: No, Rodregas answered, they were not exactly friends, and they both died long ago.
Name: Book 9

text: Plus, they had no magic and did not even realize this place was on a ley line, and I never told them.
Name: Book 9

text: They just saw an old farm house in bad repair.
Name: Book 9

text: So, what now, Doivan asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Rodregas said, I think we should just sleep here tonight.
Name: Book 9

text: We can try the house in the morning.
Name: Book 9

text: But I dont want to disturb the Dire Cats during the night.
Name: Book 9

text: They had come to the same thought already.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, Rodregas said, here.
Name: Book 9

text: He pulled out one of the extra short swords and its harness from where he had it stashed in the wagon and handed it to Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: If you guys promise not to stab me in the night, it makes sense for you two to be armed.
Name: Book 9

text: Though, I do not think that harness is big enough to fit you without some work.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas held his last unclaimed short sword up and said, And here is one for you, Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: She picked it up, but he could tell she did not know how to handle the weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked comfortable enough, but the handle was almost too small for his large hand and it looked more like a large dagger in his hand than a sword.
Name: Book 9

text: You dont have a bow hidden in that wagon do you.
Name: Book 9

text: I have no idea how to use one of these pig stickers, but I am very good with a bow, said Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: She said it clearly expecting him not to have anything.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did, have a bow.
Name: Book 9

text: He had two very nice bows wrapped up in the wagon.
Name: Book 9

text: But, while the short swords he handed them were dangerous, they were common and easy to replace.
Name: Book 9

text: On the other hand, the Black Yew bows were rare and powerful.
Name: Book 9

text: He also thought about the chain mail that he had found in Ravenhurrs wardrobe.
Name: Book 9

text: While it was way too small to fit him it would fit Imeralda just fine.
Name: Book 9

text: But to give this woman he barely knew such fine armor and weapons was not something to do casually.
Name: Book 9

text: It made a lot of sense sitting there on the foothills of the Arida Mountains, worrying about Gobelyn and Dire Cat attacks, but they were a great gift; no one had ever given him such a gift.
Name: Book 9

text: What.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked me You are looking at me like I asked you for your first born child, she stated in a surprised voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Last night you two tried to kill me, I thought I was being very generous to share my hideout and give each of you a sword.
Name: Book 9

text: Frankly I am worried that you will both give it back to me when I am sleeping tonight.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda looked surprisingly guilty, Doivan looked.
Name: Book 9

text: well Rodregas could not guess what the expression on his blunt rough face meant.
Name: Book 9

text: Look, said Imeralda once again shaking her long hair behind her, I feel terrible about that.
Name: Book 9

text: I told Audrian that I was not sure you were really Ravenhurr and that the spell did not go as planned.
Name: Book 9

text: By the Infernals, if the spell had gone as planned I would have burned in creation fire and my magic would be inside of your body right now.
Name: Book 9

text: She caught him with those large amazingly green eyes and said, I had a theory on what happened, but was not sure how to explain it so Audrian would understand.
Name: Book 9

text: He was adamant, and I couldnt argue with his logic, as he had said to you last night, you must be either Gerald or Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: But you arent, she continued, And well, you actually seem pretty nice, and you can handle yourself in a fight.
Name: Book 9

text: I was just joking about the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: You have been really generous.
Name: Book 9

text: I was just talking.
Name: Book 9

text: You two can both wrestle a bear barehanded and probably win.
Name: Book 9

text: Hell, Audrian stabbed you with a knife last night and while you are bleeding a bit, you are getting around pretty well considering you had a knife in you last night.
Name: Book 9

text: Now you are showing us trust by giving us weapons.
Name: Book 9

text: I am sorry, she finished.
Name: Book 9

text: From her expression she meant what she said, but Rodregas did not think she was happy to say it.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan just looked at Rodregas for a moment with a thoughtful expression; he was clearly thinking it out carefully.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not sorry for my actions last night, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: We did what we thought was right.
Name: Book 9

text: You appeared to be an Immortalist Sorcerer and I have grown to hate the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: When it became clear that you were not, I stopped trying to kill you.
Name: Book 9

text: He paused at this, and then Rodregas could tell he made a decision.
Name: Book 9

text: You have given me a sword, if a small one, and among my people that is a powerful gesture.
Name: Book 9

text: I will not lie to you, I have left my old life behind and the last few years I have learned to truly hate the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: I travel with you only because the others were going to go back to their homes, and I have no home to go back to, he seemed to finish, but then added, Last night you pointed out that the forces of the Immortalists would be after you and you would fight them.
Name: Book 9

text: And you also proved that you can fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Once again he paused.
Name: Book 9

text: He was clearly a man that liked to think before he spoke.
Name: Book 9

text: I am simply using you as bait.
Name: Book 9

text: When they come for you, I will kill them.
Name: Book 9

text: Fighting together we will kill some of their vaulted Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: As Doivan finished he gave a low growl and shook his horned head, his thick mane of wild jet black hair was almost as distinctive as Imeraldas own auburn flowing locks.
Name: Book 9

text: But with Doivan the gesture spoke of defiance and challenge like some great bull lowing his horns and getting ready to charge.
Name: Book 9

text: Until now he had seemed very thoughtful, almost careful in the words he spoke, but when he spoke of killing and shook his head in defiance his mouth widened.
Name: Book 9

text: To say he grinned would not be accurate; he showed his teeth.
Name: Book 9

text: There was something very dangerous about this Hellborn, something that reminded you that this creature was the spawn of Greater Daemons.
Name: Book 9

text: While he might not have chosen the side of the Infernal hells, there was a very dark and dangerous side to him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could almost smell the fire and brimstone.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas met Doivans smile with a smile of his own.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached out and grabbed Doivans forearm and gripped it in the handshake of warriors and said, You have spoken to me honestly.
Name: Book 9

text: I will honor that with my own honesty.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont know exactly how I ended up in this body, but I do know that I killed Ravenhurr, and I killed his bastard assistant, Korin.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalists are a sore on the world.
Name: Book 9

text: Their use of others bodies and power and their very way of life is abhorrent.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked Doivan in the eyes and said, The name I was born with is Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: When I decided to kill Ravenhurr, I promised the gods that if they let me survive, I would take on the duty of killing the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: It is a duty that I know will end in my death.
Name: Book 9

text: There are hundreds of Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: Some almost as powerful as gods, but it is a good death and one I have chosen.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas paused and looked at Doivans features.
Name: Book 9

text: They were brutish and rough by human standards, but his instincts said that this man was honest, and he added, If for a while you wish to share my duty and fight at my side, then we walk a path bathed in the Celestial light.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had spoken slowly and clearly so Doivan would understand the depth of what he said.
Name: Book 9

text: They stood there gripping each others forearms and then Doivan nodded and replied, Then let us walk this path together.
Name: Book 9

text: He was speaking in that deep voice; his statement had finality about it.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a good moment, one of those moments when two people realize that they are going to share the path of life and possibly death.
Name: Book 9

text: It did not last long for as they broke their grip Imeralda said, All right, you two are pretty tough and all, but dont expect me to join in this crazy crusade.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you know how many thousands  of wannabe heroes have died over the years trying to stop the Immortalists preying on the rest of us.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed to shiver for a second and then took a breath and said, I wont join you in your crusade, but I will try to help you as I can.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and said Fair enough, and then reached out to her with the same grip; the grip of one equal warrior to another.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed surprised at his gesture.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, Help as you can, not as a warrior, but as you see fit, and travel this way with us for a bit.
Name: Book 9

text: If nothing else it should prove interesting.
Name: Book 9

text: She hesitated then gripped first his arm and then Doivans and she said, Ok, lets give that a shot.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then made a gut decision.
Name: Book 9

text: He had decided to no longer live safely but to live as he wanted to live.
Name: Book 9

text: He had never been given great gifts, but that did not mean that he should not give great gifts to others.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans help would be priceless; he was clearly a powerful warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was also going to walk this path with them, and he would never get what the armor and bow were worth on the black market so.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas reached down first and opened the trunk and said, Well, if you are going to be traveling with us for a while, this wont fit either of us guys.
Name: Book 9

text: So it makes most sense for you to have it.
Name: Book 9

text: He started handing her the Mithril chain armor.
Name: Book 9

text: Her eyes grew bright at the sight of the silver chain and she went, Oh, my god, you bastard.
Name: Book 9

text: You had this in the wagon all along.
Name: Book 9

text: Do I really get to have it.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smiled and said, As long as you are sharing the journey with us.
Name: Book 9

text: She took several moments to appreciate the armor and started to try it on; Rodregas waited, enjoying her appreciation of his stolen gift.
Name: Book 9

text: Just as she started to calm down he said, Oh, and didnt you say something about wanting a bow.
Name: Book 9

text: And quietly, he handed her one of the Black Yew recurves.
Name: Book 9

text: She reached for it with a smile and as soon as she touched it she just stared at it.
Name: Book 9

text: Her expression of wonder made his old dried up heart smile.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure how to feel, like a pleased father giving out mid-winter gifts to children, or like a young lover giving flowers to a new crush.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was unsure which reaction was proper now, and which she would want him to feel.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan had watched the whole show with the thoughtful expression that he was starting to believe was his normal face to the world.
Name: Book 9

text: And do you have a full suit of Night Bronze Plate Mail for me and a magic sword or three as well.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked in his careful voice.
Name: Book 9

text: I am afraid that if we want any proper armor for ourselves we are going to have to take it off some Immortal Guards corpse.
Name: Book 9

text: But I do have one other Black Yew bow and a bigger sword that probably makes more sense for you to use than me, since I have used nothing but short swords for a very long time.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then pulled out the two-handed great sword that he had found at the keep and handed it to Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: On Doivan it was more a hand and a half sword, but as he flourished it around a bit, Rodregas could see he was pleased.
Name: Book 9

text: The steel is simple, but the balance is good.
Name: Book 9

text: I am starting to be very happy that I helped pull this wagon up the hill, he said with a deep chuckle, which sounded like distant thunder.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and said, I am afraid other than a few items to sell everything else is food and blankets for us.
Name: Book 9

text: and the horses and tools that I stripped out of the Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: I figured I would need the tools to fix this place up and make it livable.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas continued, It is dark and late.
Name: Book 9

text: Lets make camp in here.
Name: Book 9

text: In the morning we can start seeing about getting this farm in order.
Name: Book 9

text: With that they all worked together to get the barn organized and clean.
Name: Book 9

text: There was no more talking, each had plenty of their own thoughts to mull over.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was feeling pretty good at the moment, dangerously positive.
Name: Book 9

text: He had learned long ago that the better you felt, the harder came the emotional fall.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew this was all too good to last, but knowing that it would not last also made it more important that he enjoy the moment.
Name: Book 9

text: He was being hunted; but hunted because he had finally dealt out justice.
Name: Book 9

text: He had killed two monsters, two who wore faces not their own, and who he could feel no remorse for killing.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had finally escaped to his quiet place in the mountains to rest and, best of all, with two companions who seemed to be good people.
Name: Book 9

text: Clearly, Doivan had a dark side and he knew little of either of his companions.
Name: Book 9

text: But it had been a long time since he had wanted to know more about anyone that he met.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had a new strong and powerful body, and he owed a great debt of guilt for that.
Name: Book 9

text: He had even been able to free prisoners and give them a second chance at life.
Name: Book 9

text: How many times had he dreamed of that while the prisoners had pleaded with him.
Name: Book 9

text: He had turned a stone face to the prisoners; he had refused to learn their names, and had just survived by doing his duty.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas pulled out the captains mattress, he hesitated and walked over to where Imeralda was spreading a blanket and with a smile but no words he pulled up the blanket, and unrolled the mattress and laid the blanket on top.
Name: Book 9

text: She just watched him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew she was wondering about his intentions.
Name: Book 9

text: Did he want to share the mattress with her.
Name: Book 9

text: He did of course, but this was a time of new beginnings.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas would live and die like he had always meant to.
Name: Book 9

text: He walked back to the wagon, grabbed another blanket and put it down far enough away from Imeralda to show his honorable intentions.
Name: Book 9

text: But not too far in case there was trouble.
Name: Book 9

text: With a big smile he laid down and slept, like he had not slept in a very long time.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 6 LUNCH WITH THE ENEMY.
Name: Book 9

text: With an eager stride, Vandret climbed up the stairs to the rooftop solar of the Guild Dealer Taigas tower fortress.
Name: Book 9

text: He was excited by the honor to dine with the great Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: He followed a servant dressed in expensive silks of a drab brown color through the well lit passageways and stairs, all the while nervously straightening his own expensive wardrobe.
Name: Book 9

text: As they approached the top of the tower, the servant silently stepped aside and, with an open palm, waived Vandret forward.
Name: Book 9

text: The top of the stairs had a small platform where two massive Immortal Guards stood.
Name: Book 9

text: At first they showed no signs of movement, though Vandret could feel their eyes on him as they weighed his right to enter the private solar of their master.
Name: Book 9

text: In their full plate Night Bronze, the two guardsmen who stood perfectly still at full attention looked to be more statues than actual men, and something that was not beyond the magic of the man was whose door they guarded.
Name: Book 9

text: The double doors leading to the private solar were also of Night Bronze, however the door was covered in intricate wards and symbols.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: The guardsmen's armor was less decorated and held only an engraving of their sigil animals.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard on the right had an engraving on his Pauldrons, the piece of armor that protects his shoulders of the Celestial beast know as The Stag while the man on the left had an engraving of The Mastiff.
Name: Book 9

text: After a moment, that seemed to stretch longer than was polite, the Immortal Guard to the right slowly nodded and with no hand touching it; the two massive doors opened to welcome him into the sanctum.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret hurried through the open doors before the guard changed his mind.
Name: Book 9

text: He normally found the sight of the Immortal Guards reassuring; the great sigil warriors were sworn to the protection of Immortalist, like himself, but he knew these two would cut him down like a common pauper if they sensed he was a danger to their Master.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a short hallway leading from the doors with slim white columns on each side of the hallway, in between each column hung great pieces of art; paintings, sculptures and even a small wall hanging with amazing vibrant colors with a strange abstract design were all preserved in the space.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret was a man of some refinement and appreciation for art, and he wished he had dared to stop and inspect the pieces; they had to be some of the greatest art works in the Realm to be so on display where only those who had been invited to a private meeting with Taiga would see them.
Name: Book 9

text: However Vandret dared to do nothing more than glance at them as he hurried forward.
Name: Book 9

text: It would not be smart to make the Guild Dealer wait for even a moment.
Name: Book 9

text: The Guild Dealer Taiga was not such a common man that he did his work from a desk; his desires and commands came during parties and social events.
Name: Book 9
