text: However, if you were truly honored, though personal invitations to dine with him in his personal solar overlooking his city you would get told his wishes.
Name: Book 9

text: As Vandret stepped through the arch he was struck by the bare simplicity of the solar.
Name: Book 9

text: The city known as the Menagerie of Sky, Earth and Water that Taiga ruled and had created over the centuries was a lush place, full of pleasures and growing things.
Name: Book 9

text: Anything that could be found in the world was said to be found within its gleaming walls and exotic gardens.
Name: Book 9

text: However, the private place where its Master worked, was a stark contrast.
Name: Book 9

text: Its marble columns and arched ceiling spoke of simply sophistication and understated power, and much more accurately reflected the nature of its owner than the over the top shows and pleasures of the Menagerie.
Name: Book 9

text: Two small intricate waterfalls softly trickled down each side wall to the, providing a soft soothing sound.
Name: Book 9

text: The back of the room was an archway leading to the terrace, overhead the incredible crystal ceiling let in the natural daylight of the late afternoon sun and would illuminate the top of the tower under its own power during the night.
Name: Book 9

text: In the middle of the room was an enameled silver table set for two, with Taiga lounging in his throne like chair on the opposite side of Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret hurried forward and fell to his knees with his head lowered; he did not say a word until after Taiga spoke.
Name: Book 9

text: Please, my friend, there is no need for subservience here; let us enjoy a meal together.
Name: Book 9

text: If you dont mind, I have a few thoughts I would like to share with you over the food.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, my lord, said Vandret as he stood up he dared to focus on the Guild Dealer for the first time.
Name: Book 9

text: Taiga wore the form of a High Elf male that was slim and graceful, as was most of its kind.
Name: Book 9

text: His hair and eyes were a striking pale violet color, and his skin was a light nut color which made a strong contrast with his hair.
Name: Book 9

text: This was highlighted by the similarly colored silk toga he wore.
Name: Book 9

text: He wore no rings or accessories, his outfit simple, but extravagant.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret suddenly wished he had thought to dress simpler for the occasion his green and emerald outfit with its gold trim seemed garish in comparison; and his human male form that normally seemed attractive and robust seemed ungainly and drab in comparison.
Name: Book 9

text: Taigas manner continued to be friendly but inquisitive.
Name: Book 9

text: The conversation started with a polite discussion on new spells that Vandret was working on, and then moved to his thoughts on the recent political and economic tensions with the Romig Empire.
Name: Book 9

text: Wine and food appeared on the table; Vandret never saw it come, or the empty plates go.
Name: Book 9

text: The food, like everything in the tower, was of the finest quality.
Name: Book 9

text: They were fed incredible grilled silver salmon, greens from the Northern Kingdoms, and small pastries from the Korin Islands.
Name: Book 9

text: Taiga seemed in no hurry to get to any point, Immortalist had nothing, if not time.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally, Taiga brought up the point that Vandret believed had gained him the honor of joining Taiga in his solar.
Name: Book 9

text: So I understand that you are to journey to the Cathedral of the Heavens for this years open tourney.
Name: Book 9

text: Taiga asked his voice as melodic as one would expect from an elf, but just a tad deeper than one would think.
Name: Book 9

text: Yes, my lord, I leave in the morning, Vandret replied.
Name: Book 9

text: Excellent, you will have to keep your eyes open for potential talent worthy of the Immortal Guard, Taiga stated.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret nodded, that was one of his main responsibilities, but it could not be why he had been invited up to Taigas solar.
Name: Book 9

text: I would encourage you to be careful on your trip over.
Name: Book 9

text: You did hear about what happened to Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Taiga.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret almost felt his eye brows rise, of course, but what should I watch out for.
Name: Book 9

text: I heard it was just some sort of accident.
Name: Book 9

text: I was not aware that any of the Knights of the Order were implicated.
Name: Book 9

text: Taiga smiled and waved a hand in a dismissing motion.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, dont misjudge my words.
Name: Book 9

text: I did not mean to imply any misdeeds of our valiant Knights of the Soaring Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not aware of any of them doing much of anything, much less kill an Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: Than what should I keep my eye out for.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: He was becoming even more curious to the direction of the conversation.
Name: Book 9

text: You, my fine Vandret, are more in the world than most of us.
Name: Book 9

text: You are out traveling and adventuring, while most of us Immortalist just sit in our towers.
Name: Book 9

text: I have always thought that our one weakness was our isolation.
Name: Book 9

text: It is hard to know what is exactly happening when we are not out to see it.
Name: Book 9

text: For a moment, Taiga paused, looking up at the crystal roof overhead in apparent contemplation of the possible implications of their isolated natures.
Name: Book 9

text: After a moment, in which Vandret waited patiently, Taiga continued, You are one of our best, and yet you are also in the world.
Name: Book 9

text: The tournament draws the powerful and those who wish to be powerful.
Name: Book 9

text: I would simply suggest that you keep your eyes open, and keep your  mind a little more focused both on your journey and at the Cathedral, Vandrets tone almost dismissed his own comment as a simple chatter of no import.
Name: Book 9

text: Accept Vandret had been invited to have lunch with one of the most powerful people on the planet to drop the simply suggestion that he should keep his eyes open for something unusual at the Cathedral of the Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: The rest of the dinner quickly wrapped up, and Vandret soon found himself caught up in thought as he journeyed down several floors to the Great Hall that served as the gathering place for the other Immortalist in residence in the city.
Name: Book 9

text: His questing mind was rudely interrupted by a woman stepping to his side and asking him, so did you ask him.
Name: Book 9

text: Ask him what.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalist Sorcerer in the form of a tall athletic human female with spectacular long red hair and blue eyes gave Vandret a silent glare before responding.
Name: Book 9

text: Last night at the arena party you agreed to ask Vandret where Oreintvenir is, She replied in a clear clipped voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, Vandret responded, I think I said that my visit to his solar would be a perfect opportunity to ask him if he knew the location of our missing Grand Master.
Name: Book 9

text: So why did you not take advantage of the opportunity.
Name: Book 9

text: If anyone knows where Oreintvenir is; it is Taiga My lovely Gracella, you are an Immortalist of impressive power and intellect.
Name: Book 9

text: But we are Immortalist, time is on our side and Grand Master Oreintvenir has been gone for less than a year.
Name: Book 9

text: It is not unusual for one of his power to be gone for such a length of time.
Name: Book 9

text: He could be anywhere on this world or beyond it.
Name: Book 9

text: There is no need to be in such a.
Name: Book 9

text: rush to ask questions.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret doesnt play your word games with me, you know, and I know that this is not a normal disappearance.
Name: Book 9

text: Not with one of the great cosmic alignments coming in such a short time.
Name: Book 9

text: Neither of us would be surprised if Taiga had killed him and taken his place.
Name: Book 9

text: But, then he would simply have called a concave and be elected Guild Master if that was the case.
Name: Book 9

text: Youre not suggesting that Taiga is involved in some foul play against the Grand Master are you.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Vandret his tone equally outraged and surprised.
Name: Book 9

text: Gracella almost physically jumped at the suggestion and could not help herself from a quick glance around the hall before responding.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont think Taiga has any interest in becoming Guild Master, or he would be Guild Master.
Name: Book 9

text: I am just concerned about Master Oreintvenir.
Name: Book 9

text: I think the Guild Master can take care of himself just fine, for all we know he quietly ascended and is in the Celestial Heavens laughing at us now.
Name: Book 9

text: Gracella nodded, but Vandret knew her thoughts were the same as any Immortalist at the conversation of Ascension to the Celestial Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: If you succeeded people would know a new God walked the Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: If you failed the ceremony the only sign would be silence.
Name: Book 9

text: So what did he want.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret hesitated for a moment, not sure if he should respond.
Name: Book 9

text: But, Gracella was an impressive Immortalist and a rising star in the Guild.
Name: Book 9

text: She had been Oreintvenir own Adapt when she was young, and as a favored member of the Guild, her friendship could prove important some day.
Name: Book 9

text: He simply wanted me to keep an eye out when I travel to the Cathedral of the Heavens, he responded.
Name: Book 9

text: The two of them were slowly walking back to his suite through the gleaming marble corridors with their wide windows and breath taking views of the city below; they both shared polite nods to other Immortalist, mostly young Adapts who resided in the city.
Name: Book 9

text: She did not respond to his answer at first, finally she asked Does he want you to keep an eye out for Oreintvenir.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret shook his head and said.
Name: Book 9

text: He mentioned Ravenhurr as a concern.
Name: Book 9

text: But, he simply went mad.
Name: Book 9

text: That is not uncommon, she said with a voice laced with surprise.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, said Vandret, it is very rare for a Master of Ravenhurrs level to go mad.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not sure if you ever met him, but he was good, very good.
Name: Book 9

text: Then in that case we had better all keep our eyes open.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 7 A TIME TO PREPARE.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas woke up first, at dawn.
Name: Book 9

text: He stayed in his bed just thinking and reviewing all that he had gone through in the last few days; it was a lot to adjust to.
Name: Book 9

text: When the others got up they ate some of the supplies, including the last of the fresh bread.
Name: Book 9

text: They had plenty of cheese and, at the moment, an endless supply of apples.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had an idea about how he wanted to start this new day.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, Imeralda, he said getting their attention.
Name: Book 9

text: I have not told you much about my past.
Name: Book 9

text: But, as a teenager I served as a squire of the knightly Order of the Soaring Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: At their nod he added,I was never raised to knighthood, as I had neither the noble lineage nor the martial prowess.
Name: Book 9

text: My life as a squire was a good life, one I appreciated more afterwards than when I was living it.
Name: Book 9

text: Both the knights and the squires always started off the day with a prayer to the Celestial Gods.
Name: Book 9

text: I have not done this in over forty years, but I am going to start again and I would like you to join me if you would.
Name: Book 9

text: The two looked at Rodregas, they were very different people, but they both seemed unsure what to say to his request.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally, Doivan nodded at Imeralda and said to Rodregas, It has been too long since I have prayed as well, it would be good for the soul.
Name: Book 9

text: Please lead us in prayer.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda did not say anything, but she nodded and followed the two of them outside.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knelt in the grass facing the sun, the sign of the All-Father in the celestial heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached out and wove his fingers together; he pulled his thumbs down and opened his woven hands in the ancient symbol of opening oneself to the gods.
Name: Book 9

text: Dear Celestials in the heavens, we open our hearts to you and we accept our duties as your warriors here in the world.
Name: Book 9

text: Let your courage fill our hearts and your strength fill our arms.
Name: Book 9

text: May we know the guidance of your twin children, Honor and Justice.
Name: Book 9

text: He then knelt down and pulled one of the two short swords from his weapon harness; he crossed his arms and laid the blade across his own upper arms.
Name: Book 9

text: It was possible, only with great concentration to do this without dropping the sword or cutting himself.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: His instructor had taught the squires this simple prayer.
Name: Book 9

text: It guaranteed that the squires stayed focused during meditation.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Imeralda looked at him as he knelt in the grass with the sword naked on his bare arms.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas spoke carefully so as not to tip the sword and said, It is called sword meditation.
Name: Book 9

text: My instructor would start us out with the prayer and then we would meditative on our duty.
Name: Book 9

text: For how long.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Until you are sure of what your duty is, Rodregas replied, hearing the voice of his old drill Knight Captain.
Name: Book 9

text: All the instructors had been retired knights who enjoyed teaching the squires.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not think the two would join him for this but both pulled their weapons and imitated his position, Doivan with his large great sword balanced on his powerful arms, Imeralda grabbed her bow instead of a short sword, which with her lack of training was probably a good idea.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas focused inwards and resumed his meditation.
Name: Book 9

text: He was finding it wonderful to do the meditation again; Rodregas had a lot of good memories from his life as a squire, before everything had gone wrong.
Name: Book 9

text: Part of him felt uncomfortable for doing this again, like he no longer had the right.
Name: Book 9

text: But once you are raised from Page to Squire as he had been, you always got to keep the title of Squire.
Name: Book 9

text: Squires who were not raised to knighthood were much sought after; their martial training and their education, especially in law and etiquette, were a great foundation for many careers.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas knelt on the ground balancing the sword across his arms, and the sun warm on his face, he thought back to that time when he had used his Squire title to get into the officer academy in the Ramig Empire.
Name: Book 9

text: Though giving up his dream of becoming a Knight of the Soaring Heavens had been hard, Rodregas had thought that he would become a successful officer in the army.
Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately, things had gone far amiss and he had never known success.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas shook his head.
Name: Book 9

text: He was focusing on the distant past, not his duty.
Name: Book 9

text: That is what this meditation was all about, so what was his duty now.
Name: Book 9

text: Killing Immortalists was not something that he, or even the three of them together, could just start doing.
Name: Book 9

text: The problem was not just the individual Immortalist; many an angry town would have killed the local Immortalist Sorcerer after having their people taken.
Name: Book 9

text: Anyone that struck back at an individual Immortalist would face the wrath of the Guild of the Celestial Path, which included not just the god-like power of the Guild Master and his various sorcerers, but also the army of the Guild known as The Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: While not a large army, they were the most feared warriors in the world.
Name: Book 9

text: The leader of The Immortal Guards was called the Commander General, and Rodregas knew of his deeds and background though he had never met him.
Name: Book 9

text: General Rigoria had once been the Grand Marshal of the same Knightly Order that had trained Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: The Order was unique in that it trained not just in the various martial arts but also in the magical, and recruited those who had magical power, but lacked the temperament or intelligence to be a sorcerer.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead of working toward the power of sorcery, they underwent the Sigil ceremony, gaining a magical enhancement but losing the versatility of a true mage.
Name: Book 9

text: Gaining such sigils was outlawed by the guide except for their own warriors, but the Order of the Soaring Heavens was also the traditional sources for the Gods own Paladins, and even the Celestial Guild had never dared to anger the gods by interfering with their use of sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: Rigoria had been one of the greatest of the Order of the Soaring Heavens, but he had grown old and his health had failed him.
Name: Book 9

text: When tempted by the Immortalists with a new body, he had accepted.
Name: Book 9

text: Even though such action was anathema to the very teachings of the Order, he had become an officer of the Immortal Guards, and eventually their leader.
Name: Book 9

text: Several of the most powerful Knights had over the centuries, formed the officer core of The Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: These Knights traded their honor for near immortality in the Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortal Guards were all sigil warriors with one or several magical enhancements.
Name: Book 9

text: They also had the best resources of the entire Eastern Realm, the most powerful enchanted armor, the best weapons; their officers rode Dire Beasts for steeds.
Name: Book 9

text: Taking on a sigil warrior would be a huge challenge for Rodregas, or at least he thought it would be.
Name: Book 9

text: He was still unclear of how strong and fast he was.
Name: Book 9

text: His stomach hurt from his wound, but not as badly as it should.
Name: Book 9

text: Clearly, the first step in his duty was to heal up from his wound and relearn how to fight in his new body.
Name: Book 9

text: When he got up, Imeralda was already standing but Doivan remained kneeling in thought.
Name: Book 9

text: He nodded to Imeralda and she quietly followed him back into the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: About ten minutes later Doivan joined them and they started to plan how to clean up the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: There was also the matter of the house, which was a more natural place for the three of them to shelter, but Rodregas was unsure of the Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: They decided to spend the rest of the morning cleaning up the barn for the horses, and then, after lunch, Rodregas would go and see if he could figure out the intentions of the lionesses.
Name: Book 9

text: With the three of them working, they cleaned up the barn quickly.
Name: Book 9

text: While they were able to move the dirt and debris out, it was still just bare walls and stone floors.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: After a brief meal, Rodregas headed over to the main house.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas admitted to himself that he was nervous.
Name: Book 9

text: The Dire Cats where magnificent beasts.
Name: Book 9

text: He had no desire to hurt them, and less to be killed by them; but was unsure of how they could share the farm with them.
Name: Book 9

text: Like the barn, the house was made of perfect cut stone that looked almost new; everything else had gone back to nature.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas circled around to the back where the stone steps led to the cellar.
Name: Book 9

text: He was sure that originally that there had had doors covering the entrance, but of course, they were long gone.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smelled what he would find well before he came around the corner.
Name: Book 9

text: Next to the entrance was the corpse of a large bear which had recently been killed and partly eaten.
Name: Book 9

text: It had been a magnificent creature, the largest of the local black bears that he had ever seen.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas realized that it had been a Dire beast, drawn here by the safe magical energies.
Name: Book 9

text: Next to the dead bear were the two Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had gone around the corner thinking they were in the cellar, but instead found himself no more than twenty feet from them.
Name: Book 9

text: He froze; the two cats seemed to be expecting him.
Name: Book 9

text: They both watched him with steady eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: One reached out with a huge paw and dragged the dead bears body closer.
Name: Book 9

text: Did it think he was here to steal it.
Name: Book 9

text: The danger of the Dire Cats was crystal clear.
Name: Book 9

text: He had not even heard them fighting, and yet they had killed a Dire Bear while Rodregas and the others slept.
Name: Book 9

text: The good news was that they both seemed very full, and if anything, had a sleepy look to them.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas guessed that he had awakened them from a nap.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had to remind himself that he needed to develop an understanding with the lionesses.
Name: Book 9

text: Predators like them worked on a very simple alpha relationship; the strong ruled.
Name: Book 9

text: They were Dire beasts, but he was the equivalent of a Celestial Beast.
Name: Book 9

text: He was alpha; pound for pound Rodregas would be stronger and quicker than even these two beasts.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, each animal seemed to weigh almost twice as much as he did.
Name: Book 9

text: Still, Rodregas knew with sudden clarity that he needed to establish himself as the one in charge.
Name: Book 9

text: If he did not establish his leadership, the next time the Dire Cats were hungry they would try eating one of his party, or at least one of the horses.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas walked over to the bear corpse and as he approached, both cats seemed to fully wake up and took on a crouch stance.
Name: Book 9

text: He pretended to ignore them and pulled one of his short swords out, in a casual way.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas kept his focus on the bear; he knew that lionesses in prides do most of the hunting and the alpha males simply ate after the kill was done.
Name: Book 9

text: He started to cut away a large chunk of the bears haunch to take back to the barn for their dinner.
Name: Book 9

text: One of the lionesses growled and bit down on the haunch not far from him.
Name: Book 9

text: His heart stopped for a moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought she was going to take his hand for a second.
Name: Book 9

text: With his free hand he made a fist and slammed the side of her head.
Name: Book 9

text: Not with all his strength, but still a serious hit.
Name: Book 9

text: She grunted and let go, growled and stepped over the bears body.
Name: Book 9

text: He slowly reached up, and using the full strength of his body, pushed hard on her muscular chest, pushing her away from the bears haunch.
Name: Book 9

text: He then ignored her and went back to cutting the haunch loose.
Name: Book 9

text: He waited but the two lionesses seemed to have gone from aggression to napping, with him missing the transition.
Name: Book 9

text: Slowly, Rodregas got up with his bear haunch and took it back to the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: He met the surprised look of Doivan and Imeralda with a half smile, I hope you like the taste of bear.
Name: Book 9

text: As he was unsure of how old the meat was, he immediately started a fire and started to cook it.
Name: Book 9

text: As he worked on preparing the fire he explained what had happened.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you suicidal.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda in an angry voice.
Name: Book 9

text: I know you felt they were not a danger, but to walk up and take the food from two Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: That is just asking to be killed.
Name: Book 9

text: Her voice was unusually high pitched and she was shaking her head in disbelief.
Name: Book 9

text: The Dire Bear must have been living in the cellar, said Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: I bet they actually had to go in and kill it there.
Name: Book 9

text: We probably did not hear the battle because it was underground.
Name: Book 9

text: They probably dragged it out after.
Name: Book 9

text: It is said that Dire meat makes you strong.
Name: Book 9

text: Not sure if that is true though.
Name: Book 9

text: His voice, in contrast to Imeraldas, sounded completely normal.
Name: Book 9

text: Dont you care that he did something so stupid.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Doivan replied slowly, the cats are obviously connected to him due to his Celestial lion essence.
Name: Book 9

text: He freed them and now he has found a rich place for them to rear their young if they are pregnant from the mating.
Name: Book 9

text: But with beasts like that, you are either in charge or you are game.
Name: Book 9

text: I think that he probably did the right thing.
Name: Book 9

text: No way to know for sure, but they did not rip him apart, so we will say he was very brave and not very stupid.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he added, Of course, if you had asked me before hand, I would have said that taking food from a Dire Cat was a very stupid idea.
Name: Book 9

text: He finished with a smile full of sharp teeth almost a match for the lions and in a casual movement lowered his horned head in what Rodregas thought might be his equivalent of a shrug.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: The next morning they repeated the Morning Prayer and meditation ritual.
Name: Book 9

text: This time while Doivan joined in, Imeralda mostly watched.
Name: Book 9

text: Afterwards Rodregas said to both, I have been thinking that we are probably going to be here a few weeks while I finish healing up from the knife wound.
Name: Book 9

text: I want to make the most of the time.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan said, I have a feeling that you have some sort of training in mind.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and said, I have developed some bad habits the last few years; I know my technique is rusty and now my timing is all off with my new body.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not sure what your training backgrounds are, though.
Name: Book 9

text: He said, waving at Imeralda, who often of late was holding her Black Yew bow close with an intimacy that spoke more of a caress than holding a weapon, Clearly, Imeralda likes the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas continued, Even though Imeralda plans to stay out of the middle of things, learning some basic hand-to-hand and sword fighting is a good idea.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and I can spar with each other, which will help us get used to fighting against the sigil warriors of The Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: So, I think we should practice every morning until noon, then work to try to get the farm cleaned up during the rest of the day.
Name: Book 9

text: At dusk we can work again on our fighting technique.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded and said, Before we battle a group of Immortalists or The Immortal Guards, we need to get some decent armor and weapons.
Name: Book 9

text: They will have the finest equipment that the Guild sorcerers can make or buy.
Name: Book 9

text: While the two of us might be a match for most of the sigil warriors one on one, their equipment will make them hard to beat.
Name: Book 9

text: I agree that has to be something we figure out, Rodregas said, but, I am actually thinking decent horses might be more important first.
Name: Book 9

text: Horses.
Name: Book 9

text: How will that help us in battle.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas responded, Well, a true trained war horse can help directly, but what I am worried about is escaping after an attack.
Name: Book 9

text: Even if we have a successful raid against an Immortalist, we will need to be far away before a large group of The Immortal Guard can track us down.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortal Guards, or at least their officers, use Dire Steeds.
Name: Book 9

text: If we are mounted on regular horses and they come after us on Dire Steeds, well, they will track us down and outnumber us the first time we strike.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded at that.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had the impression that he had not thought of anything but the actual fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda said, Ok, that is all fine.
Name: Book 9

text: You two need to find Dire Steeds and magic armor and weapons before you fight the Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: Good luck finding that up here in the mountains.
Name: Book 9

text: What I need, and I think you two do as well; is to practice magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda smirked at their expressions.
Name: Book 9

text: She continued, Look, I am partly being selfish.
Name: Book 9

text: Once I have sufficient control, they cannot steal my magic.
Name: Book 9

text: So, while I dont disagree that it would be a good idea for me to practice some fighting skills, I also think we should all think of practicing magic.
Name: Book 9

text: She paused and said in a flat tone that highlighted her seriousness, The Immortal Guards are made of sigil warriors who have sacrificed their ability to cast magic spells for one or more permanent enhancements.
Name: Book 9

text: This makes them powerful warriors, but also limits their magic to the one or two sigil abilities.
Name: Book 9

text: We need some sort of counter to this advantage.
Name: Book 9

text: If we practice our magic every day, we should make a little progress even without any teachers or books.
Name: Book 9

text: She finished with an upturned eyebrow.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed to think that Rodregas was going to challenge her statement, and argue that they should just focus on the martial training.
Name: Book 9

text: However, Rodregas had been a squire of the Order of the Soaring Heavens, one of the few orders that required magical learning of all its members and one of the few groups that knew the secrets of Sigil Searing, the permanent inscription of sigils onto ones magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately, the secret of sigil magic was given only to those who made knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: Still, one had to learn enough magic to make the inscribing possible and that early training he had.
Name: Book 9

text: I totally agree, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: I know only what is taught a squire of our Order, but that I am happy to share.
Name: Book 9

text: Hopefully, we can learn the basics from each other.
Name: Book 9

text: I also have a few books that I took from Ravenhurrs library.
Name: Book 9

text: I was going to sell them, but if you want to look at them later and see if there are any that might be of use, you can check them out, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: Really, you have books on magic.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked with an eager tone.
Name: Book 9

text: "Can you show me now.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas hesitated; he did not want to show her the books right away.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead, he wanted to see what kind of training Doivan had.
Name: Book 9

text: But he had never been able to turn down a beautiful woman.
Name: Book 9

text: Sure, he said walking back to the barn and the wagon.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas jumped on the back, making the wagon squeal in alarm at his weight, and opened his trunk and pulled out the last blanket left in it, the one he had wrapped the books up in.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas unrolled the blanket on the back of the now mostly empty wagon showing the dozen books that he had saved from Ravenhurrs library.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda reached out for one of the closest, but then stopped as her fingers touched them, as if a spark of lightning had hit her.
Name: Book 9

text: Obviously, she could feel that same power Rodregas had.
Name: Book 9

text: She then ran her hand from one to the next until she had touched all twelve books.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, she looked up and her expression reminded Rodregas of some girl who had gotten the perfect mid winter gift that she had been dreaming of.
Name: Book 9

text: These are not books on magic, she said.
Name: Book 9

text: These are Grimoires, several of them of great power.
Name: Book 9

text: Really.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, I was a squire who learned a little magic, but I really cant say that I know the difference between a book of magic and a Grimoire.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda looked surprised and said, Oh, you guys must depend on the oral tradition.
Name: Book 9

text: That is a hard way to learn.
Name: Book 9

text: The symbols and geometric figures that form a powerful spell are often too complex to learn from just the spoken word.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas cut in and clarified, I mean, in the order we did read books on magic theory and history, but I never felt energy from them before.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda nodded, Let me explain.
Name: Book 9

text: First, you have a lot more power now, and power calls to power.
Name: Book 9

text: So, you are a lot more sensitive to the power that the books have.
Name: Book 9

text: But what separates Grimoires from other books is that they are made like the stone walls of these buildings, by Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: It is thought that the original reason was simply to have books that would not rot over a period of centuries, but the nymph-created paper and leather can hold a faint imprint of magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Each time that the sorcerers cast a spell from the book, it lightly engraved the pattern into the paige.
Name: Book 9

text: A mage can sense the previous patterns in the book.
Name: Book 9

text: The ability of such books to show the pattern of the spell means that even a mage who knows a spell by heart can cast it faster by using such a book.
Name: Book 9

text: It also means that such books are much sought after and never given up freely.
Name: Book 9

text: Grimoires are nearly never sold, unless the owner dies.
Name: Book 9

text: She paused to make sure they were both following her and then continued, While the Grimoires are a great tool for quick and accurate casting of a spell, it is even more potentially useful for someone trying to learn magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Reading a regular book with the spell written down and trying to keep all the symbols and shapes just right in your head even as you fill the complex shape with power requires years to learn.
Name: Book 9

text: But a powerful Grimoire can quickly show you the shape and help you learn new spells in weeks, instead of years.
Name: Book 9

text: Also, sorcerers, like all people, learn in different ways.
Name: Book 9

text: Some can quickly grasp a written idea where others will struggle to learn from a book.
Name: Book 9

text: Or, a magician who is also a gifted musician will understand the flow and pace of the spell much better, like a piece of music.
Name: Book 9

text: The most powerful Grimoires have had multiple users who are very different in their learning styles.
Name: Book 9

text: Books like these will allow you not to just learn the spells the best way for you, but in a much deeper, complex way.
Name: Book 9

text: Spells learned this way can be much more powerful than spells learned from either a regular book or the oral traditions.
Name: Book 9

text: How powerful and complex do you think the books we have are.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda smiled and seemed hesitant before saying, I have no idea.
Name: Book 9

text: I have touched Grimoires, but I have never been allowed to read one before.
Name: Book 9

text: Really.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas answered in surprise.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, looks like we are going to have to start using these books, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was clearly listening; his huge body very still, but he had not said anything.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you say, Doivan, are you ready to learn some magic.
Name: Book 9

text: I saw how you reacted to the ley line; you clearly have some power.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan tilted his head to me and said, Really, do you think so.
Name: Book 9

text: I do feel something now and then, but I have never been tested.
Name: Book 9

text: People see me and how strong I am, they just assume I dont have magic for some reason.
Name: Book 9

text: Wish I had that problem, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: I mean before, people always used to assume I had neither brawn nor brains.
Name: Book 9

text: With a smile he added, What do you say.
Name: Book 9

text: Shall the three of us set some time aside to teach each other what we know of magic and see what we can learn from these magic books of Ravenhurrs.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: I mean, yes, I would like to learn what you can teach me.
Name: Book 9

text: I like to learn, he said slowly but carefully.
Name: Book 9

text: The big guy was embarrassed.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he added, I am afraid my people are not big readers, and, well, they saw me as half-monster and I never learned how to read.
Name: Book 9

text: The last words he added very slowly, but then quickly added, But if you can teach me some basics from the oral techniques that Imeralda mentioned, I would like to learn some magic if I can.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked at Doivan; there was something about his expression, a yearning.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you want to learn to read.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan asked, stepping away from the other two like he was uncomfortable.
Name: Book 9

text: Just what I said, would you like to learn to read.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said in a carefully casual voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan responded, We dont have time for me to learn to read.
Name: Book 9

text: You should spend time practicing with these Grimoires.
Name: Book 9

text: It makes no sense to teach me to read when we are likely to see battle too soon for it to be helpful.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans voice, which was always deep, seemed to have gone down several octaves, such that the earth almost seemed to vibrate.
Name: Book 9

text: Somehow, while the conversation on magic Grimoires had been of interest to him, the idea of learning to read seemed to terrify him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew the feeling of wanting something so much that you are afraid to accept it when offered, for fear of failing.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Rodregas said, I think it might come in handy to have you able to read.
Name: Book 9

text: And if we survive the summer and are holed up here all winter, you might be able to start reading some of these books by then.
Name: Book 9

text: I fear that I am not a very good teacher, but I have managed to teach a few soldiers over the years who wanted to learn.
Name: Book 9

text: At their nod Rodregas added, After our noon meal, lets plan on making it book time.
Name: Book 9

text: We dont have a decent lamp to read by, so we will have to do it during the day.
Name: Book 9

text: We can start by teaching each other any basic magic we know.
Name: Book 9

text: Then I will work with you on learning to read while Imeralda starts going through these books to see if any of them have some simple stuff that we can work on.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas finished in his best sergeants voice.
Name: Book 9

text: It held a tone that let everyone simply know that a decision has been made.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda seemed glued to the books, but Doivan and Rodregas went to work on cleaning up the rest of the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: They would not be able to do much more without getting some timber.
Name: Book 9

text: They all worked or read until it was too dark and than they fell asleep quickly.
Name: Book 9

text: The next morning, after they had finished Morning Prayer, Rodregas said, Alright, are you two ready for a little fighting practice.
Name: Book 9

text: At their nod he added, It is always good to start with the basics.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought we would go over some fighting forms.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you two familiar with learning forms, also known as Kata.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: He was expecting Imeralda to shake her head but was a little surprised that Doivan did as well.
Name: Book 9

text: He clearly knew how to fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas started to explain, Forms are a series of motions that mock fighting, but also give you an opportunity to work on balance and to visualize and understand your actions and responses to different fighting situations.
Name: Book 9

text: While strength and speed are important for any kind of fighting whether it is hand-to-hand or swords fighting, good technique is all about balance and center of gravity.
Name: Book 9

text: What you want to learn is to keep your center low and your balance strong even when you are tired and exhausted.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan had his normal interested expression, but Imeralda looked unconvinced.
Name: Book 9

text: Ok, he said, time for an example.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda stand tall, Rodregas stated.
Name: Book 9

text: She put her shoulders back, which caused her firm, rounded breasts to thrust out.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas didnt think she meant the gesture to be sexual, but he hesitated at the sight of her superbly shaped body.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas ignored his own rush of hormones and pushed her high on the shoulder and she stumbled back.
Name: Book 9

text: Now, he said, lower your center of gravity.
Name: Book 9

text: Bend your legs, but keep them loose.
Name: Book 9

text: She followed his instructions, and he thought this would make her look less striking, but she went from a statuesque dancer to a crouching feline.
Name: Book 9

text: He breathed in through his nose and tried to ignore his newly youthful hormones.
Name: Book 9

text: This time when he pushed her shoulder she went back but did not stumble.
Name: Book 9

text: See, you stayed in control.
Name: Book 9

text: You stumble in a fight and you are dead.
Name: Book 9

text: With your center low you have control.
Name: Book 9

text: You are ready to dodge and to strike back as needed.
Name: Book 9

text: Plus, you have leverage.
Name: Book 9

text: If you develop good foot work and keep them moving and you keep your center of gravity low, you can win against stronger but less-disciplined fighters.
Name: Book 9

text: They both nodded, for the moment convinced.
Name: Book 9

text: Now watch and try to learn this basic form.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped into position; his knees deeply bent, his hands loose but raised just below his shoulders.
Name: Book 9

text: He stepped forward and raised his left arm in a sweeping block and then he took another step and struck out in a swift blow to an imagined attacker with his right hand.
Name: Book 9

text: While he followed a set form in his mind, he also saw his invisible attacker and he struck like he was really there, his blow stopping only when they met the invisible attackers form.
Name: Book 9

text: After sharing a few basic blocks and strikes, he stopped and faced the other two again, and said, Now, I will repeat that and then you two can take a turn.
Name: Book 9

text: Learning to fight through mastering ones own form was new to both, and they struggled to follow his example.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan often over reached any possible opponent, while Imeraldas movements had little of real strength or violence behind them.
Name: Book 9

text: She kept dropping her hands and leaving herself open to attack.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: He restarted slowly going over the first forms footwork, even the small moves caused his stomach wound to bleed and he guessed he probably needed to wrap it tighter after he was done.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas kept repeating the most basic form until he felt they were starting to get their center of gravity down, but keeping their feet free to move and their hands up ready to block.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: He was enjoying teaching Kata, both for himself and because they were both eager students and learned quickly.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 8 THE TEST BEFORE THE TEST.
Name: Book 9

text: Over the next few weeks Rodregas, Doivan and Imeralda fell into a regular routine.
Name: Book 9

text: It quickly became clear that while Imeralda might not be a trained mage, she was far more knowledgeable than Doivan or Rodregas in magic.
Name: Book 9

text: So, while Rodregas often led the training in the morning, she led during the afternoon.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought Doivan was learning far more quickly than any of the squires that he had trained with as a teenager.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked like a daemonic nightmare, and he clearly loved to test his strength in battle, but he was an amazingly quick learner both with the forms and with the books.
Name: Book 9

text: Even though Doivan could not read, Rodregas would read him some of the Grimoires, since they were the only books they had.
Name: Book 9

text: His insights and questions were insightful, and Rodregas realized that Doivans intellect was greater than his own.
Name: Book 9

text: Two weeks into the routine the three were starting to get into the rhythm; they had moved into the old house and for not having a roof, it was pretty comfortable.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Though they had all claimed rooms of their own, they were all still sleeping in the living room, partly because of the fire they kept there and partly for the company.
Name: Book 9

text: They were surprised with visits by the two Dire Cats on a regular basis.
Name: Book 9

text: The first evening, when they were settling into the night, the two cats casually walked through the door.
Name: Book 9

text: The three of them froze while the two cats just sprawled out in casual comfort close to the fire.
Name: Book 9

text: One of the cats (Rodregas had not been able to tell the two apart yet) stretched over and started to rub her chin against Rodregas leg.
Name: Book 9

text: The power behind its head was such that it almost knocked him over.
Name: Book 9

text: He had seen small house cats make similar gestures, but it was disconcerting to have two powerful predators such as the Dire Cats being so friendly.
Name: Book 9

text: I guess this means we are part of the pride, said Imeralda, slowly reaching over and giving the other cat a tummy rub.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas held his breath, as the cat responded with its paws by stretching out, its claws popping free with the stretch.
Name: Book 9

text: They showed no signs of aggression, but just looking at the size of their claws, and then at Imeralda, made Rodregas want to jump over the Dire Cat and put his body in front of her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was fully aware of how one swipe of those claws would likely kill her.
Name: Book 9

text: Unlike the house cats that he was familiar with, Rodregas could see a kind of intelligence in their eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: He had the feeling they both knew to be careful with a fragile mortal, and they thought it was funny that he was so worried.
Name: Book 9

text: This scene repeated itself almost every night, and several times the cats also brought game they had killed into the farmyard.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas made a point of always taking a piece of the kill, as for some reason he felt this was expected as part of their adopted group.
Name: Book 9

text: Plus, it added fresh meat to their diet without the three having to go hunting.
Name: Book 9

text: After awhile he started to take the presence of the Dire Cats for granted and stopped worrying about the danger.
Name: Book 9

text: Several weeks later, came the first night where neither the cats nor Doivan were in the room.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was out messing with the well, Imeralda was reading one of the magic Grimoires by the fireplace.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was supposed to be reading as well, but had lost his focus on the complex diagram and was just looking at Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: She was so beautiful, slim yet curvy.
Name: Book 9

text: Some of those curves were smooth muscle and some were pure female.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed to have brought together two of the most attractive parts of the AElves and the Nymphs: the slim athletic body of the AElf with the full curves of a Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: Her skin had a smooth, light golden brown color that often shined with sweat during their practices and looked so soft that it was hard not to reach out and touch it.
Name: Book 9

text: Did you need something.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had not realized that she had noticed him watching her.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a tease to her voice and expression that said she knew what he was thinking and that she did not mind.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was an experienced man but he was not sure if he had ever seen a woman as beautiful as her, much less thought that he ever had a chance with such a woman.
Name: Book 9

text: He had to smile, amused by his own reaction, as he felt his heartbeat speed up and a rush of heat.
Name: Book 9

text: He had not felt such hormonal surges in a long time.
Name: Book 9

text: He made a decision in his head.
Name: Book 9

text: He had carefully been a gentleman now for several weeks and had not tried anything with the beautiful half AElf, but her teasing expression left him an opening.
Name: Book 9

text: He decided to take advantage of it.
Name: Book 9

text: He spoke very slowly and carefully, letting her know that he knew what he was saying.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, I was looking at you, you are amazingly beautiful.
Name: Book 9

text: Your incredible eyes and hair, you are breathtaking.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked at her, his eyes going slowly over her entire body as he spoke.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he shifted his gaze toward Imeraldas large green eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: As their eyes held he slid over to her, running the back of his hand across her cheek.
Name: Book 9

text: You are so beautiful, your skin so soft, Rodregas said.
Name: Book 9

text: You are the complete woman; beautiful, intelligent, brave.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached down and placed his finger below her chin and raised it up to be equal in height to his.
Name: Book 9

text: I have wanted you since I first saw you, and with that straight forward statement, he reached down, and holding her face steady with his single finger, he slowly, softly kissed her.
Name: Book 9

text: For a moment she tried to pull away, but he kept the pressure of his finger steady and firm so she could feel his desire.
Name: Book 9

text: He made his lips eager but light, not too forceful.
Name: Book 9

text: He was strong and he let her feel his strength, but he also gave her plenty of leverage so that if she truly wanted to pull away she could.
Name: Book 9

text: He was making his desire clear, but the decision was hers.
Name: Book 9

text: He cared for her too much, and was so determined to walk the path of righteousness and he was determined to be very careful.
Name: Book 9

text: A younger man would have been in a hurry.
Name: Book 9

text: But Rodregas was lost in the softness of her lips, the look of her eyes, and the beauty of her spirit.
Name: Book 9

text: He wished he could make this moment last forever.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas believed that most women did not know if they were interested until a man makes his move.
Name: Book 9

text: It is something instinctive; there is a single moment when either it clicks or it does not.
Name: Book 9

text: The moment held unmoving, the dice were rolling; and she responded to his kiss, but did not sink into his arms.
Name: Book 9

text: She was making a hard decision.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt good that she must feel something to hesitate; the moment seemed to go on forever.
Name: Book 9

text: He drank in her smell.
Name: Book 9

text: Like her it was unique, something between a honey blossom and a ripe apple.
Name: Book 9

text: Like many things in life since he left Raven Keep, he cherished the feel, the taste, and the smell.
Name: Book 9

text: Then she broke away and whispered, I am afraid.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda spoke so quietly that he could barely hear.
Name: Book 9

text: I want to, she paused and then continued her light whisper, But being a half Nymph, half AElf means it is not easy to become involved with for a human.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont want to hurt you.
Name: Book 9

text: He missed her taste as she pulled away, and he was surprised by what she said, but he also knew that he no longer wanted to live in fear.
Name: Book 9

text: Shhhhh, it is all right.
Name: Book 9

text: With me you never have to worry, you never have to be afraid.
Name: Book 9

text: He was going to tell her that he would not hurt her, but since she seemed afraid that she would be the one hurting him, he held the comment back.
Name: Book 9

text: He just pulled her close again, but instead of a soft kiss he kept himself from touching her and simply looked deep into her eyes and thought about how much he appreciated her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas let her feel how much he thought of her.
Name: Book 9

text: Only after he saw her eyes make a decision, did he slide his hands down her body and cup the small of her back and pull her into a kiss, but this time he let more of his passion and need show.
Name: Book 9

text: With his kiss her resistance evaporated and she went from hesitant to eager.
Name: Book 9

text: Her hands started pulling at his leather armor, eager to get him naked and feel his skin.
Name: Book 9

text: At her action Rodregas felt awkward.
Name: Book 9

text: This was not really his body that she wanted to touch; he was not really this young handsome man that she felt attracted to.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted to pull away, but did not let himself.
Name: Book 9

text: He had initiated the intimacy, and it would not be fair of him to pull away because of his personal doubts.
Name: Book 9

text: Easy, Rodregas said, I want to go nice and slow and enjoy every step.
Name: Book 9

text: They kissed again, this time eagerly exploring each others mouth and lips.
Name: Book 9

text: He ran his lips down the line of her chin.
Name: Book 9

text: Though he was trying to go slowly, they quickly found themselves naked.
Name: Book 9

text: He thought if he had let her, she would have jumped right on him and slid himself inside her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew that Nymphs were legendary for their enjoyment of sex, but he was a little surprised at her eagerness.
Name: Book 9

text: She ran her hands and lips across his chest, seemingly fascinated by his powerful musculature and smooth skin.
Name: Book 9

text: Once again Rodregas found himself pulling away from her touch.
Name: Book 9

text: He had never really had a woman that eager to touch him before.
Name: Book 9

text: Her eagerness to touch his body made him feel a little put off.
Name: Book 9

text: It was good to be touched, in fact, he craved it.
Name: Book 9

text: But her eagerness highlighted to him that the body she wanted to touch was not really his.
Name: Book 9

text: It was the body of Gerald, not Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: Her body was everything that he had thought it would be, both wonderfully hard and lush.
Name: Book 9

text: To say she was the most beautiful woman he had ever enjoyed touching was a ridiculous understatement.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda reached up to his neck and pulled herself up on top of his lap.
Name: Book 9

text: She wrapped her legs around him and hoisted herself up like she was climbing the trunk of a tree.
Name: Book 9

text: He had wanted to take his time and explore her with his hands and lips, but clearly she was in no mood for foreplay.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas in turn was in no mood to stop her now that his own passion was building, and there was no reason to think that they would not be repeating this experience.
Name: Book 9

text: There would be other times to explore her.
Name: Book 9

text: Now was time to give in to their most primal needs.
Name: Book 9

text: For one last moment he held her back, slowing her movements.
Name: Book 9

text: He was a little worried that she would have trouble handling his size, but she literally started bouncing on his lap and his own groans joined hers and he stopped thinking and gave himself to the pleasure of the moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Afterwards, well after several afterwards, they were curled up on her mattress.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was very happy he had salvaged the mattress from Captain Poir.
Name: Book 9

text: He had had no way to know that the mattress was going to come in so handy.
Name: Book 9

text: He lay there with Imeralda's head laying on his shoulder and her body half draped on his own and half on the mattress, he was thankful that Doivan had clearly heard what was going on.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas assumed he must have slept back in the barn.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan walking in unaware of the situation would have been very embarrassing.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had suggested to Imeralda that they should stop in case Doivan walked in, but she had shown no signs of caring and quickly took the thought away from him with her actions.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas wanted to ask her what this encounter had meant, but he knew that while such questions were natural they were never helpful.
Name: Book 9

text: Two people fresh from their first lovemaking were in no place to talk about a relationship.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had made a promise to the gods and though she was the most amazing woman in the world, still he would do his duty.
Name: Book 9

text: He tried to find the right thing to say.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked down at her with her head on his shoulder and her pile of auburn curls spread equally over both their naked bodies.
Name: Book 9

text: Her long hair covered a lot of the two of them but really hid nothing.
Name: Book 9

text: He met her large green eyes and said, You amaze me.
Name: Book 9

text: I knew you were brave and courageous, but now I know where your true magic talent is.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked at her eyes as he spoke and even when he smiled at his own words, he let her see the sincerity of what he said.
Name: Book 9

text: The main rule of flattery with women is to never lie.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a lesson taught to Rodregas by a lost love, and one that had served him well over the years.
Name: Book 9

text: Most women can always tell a lie, especially in such a moment of connection as the talk after good sex.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily, even with far more normal women there is always something good you can say; with Imeralda he could have gone on for hours.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeraldas eyes lit up in pleasure and humor at his words but, of course, he was careful to say nothing of the future, nothing of love.
Name: Book 9

text: Such talk would serve no purpose and would likely ruin the moment.
Name: Book 9

text: To his surprise she also kept such thoughts to herself.
Name: Book 9

text: The rest of the night, the two lovers spent quietly connected and at peace, but they shared few words.
Name: Book 9

text: In the morning after meditation, Doivan pulled forth two wooden staves that he had cut and said with a smile and an exaggerated wink, Apparently you are healed up from your wound now, so I think it is time to stop with these making of shadows like children and time for some more physical training.
Name: Book 9

text: As he finished speaking he tossed Rodregas one of the staves.
Name: Book 9

text: With my people we teach our children to fight using the staff.
Name: Book 9

text: It is hard to kill someone by accident with a staff, but you can still deliver pain.
Name: Book 9

text: The avoidance of pain is a great way to teach someone to be nimble and quick.
Name: Book 9

text: My war masters at the palace would say you two are too old to learn the staff, but it is the way that I know.
Name: Book 9

text: Sir Paladin, he said to Rodregas, imposing the unearned honor title.
Name: Book 9

text: I assume with your training from all your ex-knights that you know how to use the staff.
Name: Book 9

text: As Doivan spoke he looked at how Rodregas was holding the staff.
Name: Book 9

text: Fight with a staff.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas responded in surprise.
Name: Book 9

text: No, cant say that I ever have.
Name: Book 9

text: The weapons of the Knight are the sword, the mace, the lance and the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: Those are the weapons of a warrior, he stated.
Name: Book 9

text: And what do you do when facing a warrior in full plate armor.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Even chain mail can stop an arrow or the edge of a sword.
Name: Book 9

text: And while a mace is great against chain, crushing your opponent and breaking their bones, such tactics take far too long against plate armor.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not sure what to say to that question.
Name: Book 9

text: The mace or the war hammer was, of course, the weapon of choice against all well armored opponents.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was right, edged weapons were not of much use against a full set of plate armor.
Name: Book 9

text: That is why knights or others who could afford the cost wore all that metal.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had to shrug; he had no answer other than an extended fight with the mace that often did not end until one or the other was too tired and battered to defend themselves.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded at Rodregas expression of confusion, My clan is known as the greatest warriors there are against heavily armored opponents because we are masters of the halberd.
Name: Book 9

text: With a halberd we can quickly dismount an armored warrior, knock him to the ground and then, with the leverage provided by the halberd.
Name: Book 9

text: He swung his staff and acted like he was holding down a foe with his left foot.
Name: Book 9

text: He made a savage two-handed thrust downward,.
Name: Book 9

text: we can pierce his armor and win the battle quickly.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure what this halberd weapon was; Rodregas assumed it was some sort of spear from the way Doivan was holding the staff.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not see how a spear could do what Doivan was suggesting, but since Doivan had been up for learning the Kata, he would be willing to learn how to fight with a long piece of wood.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan then stepped forward and started swinging the staff with such mastery as to make it beautiful.
Name: Book 9

text: The staff was but a blur as it whirled in one hand and then the other, behind his back, over his shoulder.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a dance.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had seen a few sword masters fight; and it was like this.
Name: Book 9

text: The staff moved faster and with more control that one could follow.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan finished the exhibition with the staff swinging over his shoulder and with a savage swing downward, ending with perfect control where it would have connected with a fallen opponent.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas almost pointed out that he was doing Kata, practicing against an opponent only seen in your mind, but decided that this was the time for him to learn and Doivan to teach.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had long ago learned that it was hard to learn if you were talking.
Name: Book 9

text: Over the next hour Rodregas began to regret his decision to learn.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was clearly a master with the staff which Rodregas could not help but be impressed by.
Name: Book 9

text: In the Eastern Realms, and every other kingdom that he knew of, the staff was a peasant weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: As many lords only allowed swords to be for their soldiers and nobility.
Name: Book 9

text: Farmers and crafts people were not allowed to own edged weapons of war.
Name: Book 9

text: Though Rodregas had known such rules to be broken by non-noble families, it was done discretely, usually for keeping a family heirloom.
Name: Book 9

text: During the fairs that most rural areas had fighting contests were common, but they were always matches of wrestling or bare knuckle fighting.
Name: Book 9

text: The only weapons allowed the local workers were the staff and sometimes the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had always regarded the staff as a primitive weapon which no true warrior would bother with, but to watch Doivan with it was breathtaking.
Name: Book 9

text: The staff whirled around him a blur, and the length of the weapon made full use of his height and size.
Name: Book 9

text: But he also had complete control of the weapon as he highlighted that morning by whizzing past Rodregas clumsy blocks and bruising every part of his body until even the smallest movement hurt.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was used to being better trained than others, but with the staff he was starting from scratch; even holding it properly was new to him.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan showed him to keep one hand at the center of the staff and one hand between the center and the end.
Name: Book 9

text: One always gripped the staff in thirds.
Name: Book 9

text: When it was held horizontally in front, the right palm faced away from the body and the left hand faced the body, enabling the staff to rotate.
Name: Book 9

text: The power for generated strikes was held by the backhand pulling the staff, while the front hand was used for guidance.
Name: Book 9

text: When striking the wrist is twisted, the same as when one turned the hand over when punching.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas eyes were quickly opened to the weapon and it was fun to learn something so new, but he was much worse for the lesson.
Name: Book 9

text: After lunch he limped over to the great oak which they sat under most days for their magical training and reading.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was off in the trees taking care of natures business.
Name: Book 9

text: As the two settled down he broached the subject on his mind.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, are you mad at me.
Name: Book 9

text: Is this something to do with me and Imeralda getting together last night.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan asked clearly surprised.
Name: Book 9

text: No, I cant say it is a good idea.
Name: Book 9

text: Mixing more than casually with Nymphs always leads to problems, but it is not my problem.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact, he said with a careful glance around him.
Name: Book 9

text: I would have jumped at the chance myself.
Name: Book 9

text: I am probably too ugly by both AElf and Nymph standards for her to be interested.
Name: Book 9

text: Then again, you know Nymphs; they are naturally polyamorous and very sexual.
Name: Book 9

text: It is a shock that she was not already sexually involved with one or both of us already.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan added, Maybe her AElf blood means she does not have as strong a sex drive as most Nymphs since AElven marriage bonds are always monogamous.
Name: Book 9

text: By the Celestial gods she is half AElf and half Nymph, who knows what to expect.
Name: Book 9

text: Humans and Orqui are both in the middle of their two extremes and becoming emotionally involved with either always ends with heartbreak.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans deep voice was just stating a fact, if an unpleasant one.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, he agreed but he was not the young man he looked.
Name: Book 9

text: I do understand that, and I expect nothing from her.
Name: Book 9

text: He smiled and said, But I do plan to enjoy what we do have for as long as it lasts.
Name: Book 9

text: And when she takes other lovers.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas responded with the only answer he had, I will do my best to handle it and not get jealous, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew it would be hard, but he was a hard man and he would have to manage.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded, then glanced over to see Imeralda walking over with several of the Grimoires and he added, I was not angry, in fact, by my peoples standards I was being very easy on you since you are human and cant handle pain like an Orqui.
Name: Book 9

text: Without pain, you will not reach your potential for quickness and reflexes.
Name: Book 9

text: On the practice field such quickness means fewer bruises.
Name: Book 9

text: On the battle field such reflexes means life and death.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, his words held the ring of truth, but he was not looking forward to days of practices and days full of bruises.
Name: Book 9

text: The pattern of their days changed.
Name: Book 9

text: Now after prayer and meditation came first the practice of the Kata, and then the staff and then finally the books.
Name: Book 9

text: The true change came in the evening, the nights were full of such pleasure and joy such as Rodregas had seldom known in his life.
Name: Book 9

text: The rest of summer passed as the most joyful that he had known, as the three started to the Kata and the staff.
Name: Book 9

text: After the staff they moved to the bow where Imeralda became the master.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: To use the magical Black Yew bows required learning a spell to merging with the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: The spell was unlike anything Rodregas had learned.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda said it was seldom taught to non-nymphs, though Ravenhurr had known the spell and taught a few of the guards with a touch of the talent.
Name: Book 9

text: Using the bows was a matter of sending your innate power into the wood and singing with it.
Name: Book 9

text: Not singing out loud, but making the power vibrate and move in a rhythm that matched the wood.
Name: Book 9

text: When that magical rhythm was reached, the bow suddenly became almost fluid and moved nearly of its own volition.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: The arrows flew with incredible force and accuracy.
Name: Book 9

text: The only problem was that the three could not practice freely as the arrows sometimes shattered on impact, as they flew with such force.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan quickly mastered the spell and the use of the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas, on the other hand, struggled to learn the artistry of the spell.
Name: Book 9

text: One afternoon, a few days after Doivan had mastered the spell, Rodregas stood there with the bow trying hard to both find the rhythm of the spell and shoot the weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda stood next to him, her hand lightly touching the bow as she tried to figure out why he was still struggling with the mastery of the weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas reached down into himself, to that place that held his magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Though Rodregas had never had much power, he had always enjoyed using his itch (as he had always called it) to do small things.
Name: Book 9

text: Using his magic now was a very different experience.
Name: Book 9

text: Whereas before it had been calming, requiring him to call forth his little bit of power, now he held a whirling tornado of energy.
Name: Book 9

text: It was not a matter of having enough; it was a matter of having almost too much power that overwhelmed the simple spell.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas breathed in, trying to keep his mind empty but for the shape and vibration of the magic, as he fed a small amount into the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: For a second he had it.
Name: Book 9

text: The bow responded and Rodregas was able to pull the bow back, but the moment was quickly gone.
Name: Book 9

text: The bow bounced back into its regular shape and his arrow shot up and floundered in the air before falling to earth.
Name: Book 9

text: Where both Imeralda and Doivan had nailed the dead tree in the exact center, his arrow was closer to the barn then the target.
Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately, the barn was in the opposite direction.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas heard a few unkind chuckles from the other two at his shot.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont understand it, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: Why do I have so much trouble controlling my magical power now.
Name: Book 9

text: I know I have a lot more power, but you both have lots of power as well, yet I cant seem to control it.
Name: Book 9

text: The frustration in his own voice was clear.
Name: Book 9

text: Could you feel anything.
Name: Book 9

text: Your power is strong and untamed, in flavor more like Doivans power than a nymphs or AElfs, but Doivan can master the spell.
Name: Book 9

text: I think the problem is that for all of your life your power was weak but easy to control.
Name: Book 9

text: A mage born of power learns to control it at an early age.
Name: Book 9

text: You never had to learn any control; your power was so weak that you always struggled simply to have enough power to do anything with it.
Name: Book 9

text: Ok, I never learned proper control; the spells I learned as a squire were small weak things.
Name: Book 9

text: But, can I learn control now.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, she responded.
Name: Book 9

text: But it will probably be harder and slower than if you were learning earlier in life.
Name: Book 9

text: It requires relearning something that is almost an instinct at this point in your life.
Name: Book 9

text: Part of the problem is that the spell to activate the magic in the bow is just very different than anything you have probably done before.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew she was speaking the truth.
Name: Book 9

text: He had never thought he was going to be some powerful mage.
Name: Book 9

text: The fact that Doivan had so easily learned the spell just reminded him of how many times in his life he had failed to have the ability to succeed in things that he really wanted.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas new body was very gifted, but it was still mortal and some things he would just not be able to do as well as others.
Name: Book 9

text: In some ways this was reassuring, a connection to his past.
Name: Book 9

text: Can I ask you a question.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smiled and said, of course, what.
Name: Book 9

text: Have you thought of trying to become a sigil warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: You are a very powerful magician now.
Name: Book 9

text: You could probably take one or even two of the greater sigils and still have more power than you had before, and as a warrior the enhancement from the sigil would make you an even more powerful fighter.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, I have thought about it.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact, I am sure given the opportunity that I would take on one of the greater or several of the lesser sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: I am a warrior first, not a mage.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, leaving a little magic left over would be great if I can, but you never really know until after the searing.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas paused and then added, The problem is that only two groups in the Eastern Realms have the knowledge to do the searing.
Name: Book 9

text: The first, of course, is the Guild of the Celestial Path.
Name: Book 9

text: I think we all agree they are not sharing it with me soon, Rodregas continued with a smile.
Name: Book 9

text: And the second is the Knightly Order of the Soaring Heavens, who are reported to have the greatest collection, and they only let their knights be seared.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont think they are going to be sharing anytime soon either.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda looked at Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: She knew that the Order of the Soaring Heavens was the order that Rodregas had belonged to as a squire, but his taking on of anothers body was anathema to the teaching of the order.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was an Immortalist in fact, if not a member of the Guild, and he was pretty sure most of the knights would kill him if they found out his story.
Name: Book 9

text: But dont some wizards have the secrets for some of the lesser sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan, joining the conversation.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought a lot of them used ones that help wizards not to grow old.
Name: Book 9

text: That is true, said Imeralda with a shrug.
Name: Book 9

text: A healing sigil is why wizards live so long.
Name: Book 9

text: It is considered by most to be the moral choice instead of the Immortalists answer for long life.
Name: Book 9

text: What about you Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda says that you are almost as powerful as me as a magician.
Name: Book 9

text: If we found a way, would you like to take on some of the power of the sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had expected an immediate response, but instead his question was followed by a long pause before Doivan answered.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had learned that Doivan thought before speaking.
Name: Book 9

text: I am not sure.
Name: Book 9

text: I like learning magic, though I am just beginning.
Name: Book 9

text: I would think that I would take on a minor sigil or two.
Name: Book 9

text: I am a great warrior, but I like to learn new things and I would like to have sufficient magic to be able to learn spells.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans response would have surprised him before, but he had learned much of the thoughtful Hellborn in their time together.
Name: Book 9

text: When one looked at him and how powerfully built he was, it was incredible to imagine what he could do on the battlefield with a greater sigil added to his power.
Name: Book 9

text: He would be a true daemon on the battlefield.
Name: Book 9

text: But while Doivan loved his strength, he also loved his intelligence.
Name: Book 9

text: In comparison, Rodregas was less interested in exploring learning as he was about what he could do as a warrior and carrying out his duty.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Rodregas said, I dont think we are going to have any options for sigils for now.
Name: Book 9

text: Let us continue to learn what we can of battle and of magic.
Name: Book 9

text: If we are lucky we can worry about more if we survive our first strike at the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: The next morning, during his meditation, Rodregas realized that it was time for action.
Name: Book 9

text: He realized that if they continued simply to hide out in the farmhouse, winter would come and travel would be much more difficult.
Name: Book 9
