text: As he knelt on the ground examining the new color of the trees, he knew that it was now time to strike.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 9 INTO THE FIRES.
Name: Book 9

text: Six days later the three of them found themselves ready to cross the Old Princess Road.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda had been scouting ahead and she signaled for the two men to stay back in the trees.
Name: Book 9

text: As a half Forest Nymph she seemed to be able to disappear into the forest.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas quickly learned how she had been able to track him from Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: While she claimed that other Forest Nymphs had far better skills, Rodregas had never seen anyone to match her abilities.
Name: Book 9

text: They had taken the three horses back up the trail where any sounds they made would not be heard from the road.
Name: Book 9

text: Then Doivan and Rodregas had found some cover that still gave a good view of the road.
Name: Book 9

text: They sat on the ground and waited until Imeralda signaled that something was coming.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas neither heard nor saw any activity and his physical senses were far more accurate than when he had been a young man.
Name: Book 9

text: His guess was that her connection with the forest had somehow warned her that something was coming.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Rodregas looked at each other as they squatted down in the shrubs.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan had one of the Black Yew bows out, with arrows at hand, if needed.
Name: Book 9

text: It would not be surprising if a patrol of the Immortal Guard would be on the road.
Name: Book 9

text: The road was the main route from the port city of Chrisana Stone to the Menagerie of Sky, Earth and Water; the slave city run by the Immortalist Taiga.
Name: Book 9

text: Most likely what Imeralda sensed was simply a trade caravan running a regular route from Chrisana Stone to any of several of the Eastern Realms cities.
Name: Book 9

text: If it was a light scouting patrol of just two or three guards that was coming; it would be the best case scenario for them to take on some Immortalist Guards and gain better weapons, armor and horses.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, if it was a slave caravan then they would simply sit and watch, as it would be suicide to do anything against a full patrol.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas heard a rustle in the brush and glanced over to make sure it was just a squirrel or the like.
Name: Book 9

text: He started to jump up as a humanoid shape appeared out of the trees, until he saw that it was just Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed to be paying less attention now to stealth as she was to speed.
Name: Book 9

text: From Imeraldas expression Rodregas knew it was something more dangerous than a trade caravan coming down the road.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda squatted down next to them and whispered, A slave caravan is coming; its small but they have a score of guards.
Name: Book 9

text: We need to back up before they get here.
Name: Book 9

text: We have good cover here, he whispered back, lets check them out as they pass.
Name: Book 9

text: They are probably going to stop at Stallions Perch.
Name: Book 9

text: After much debate between the three of them Stallions Perch was their destination, a small keep that was known to breed Dire horses for the Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: We cant, responded Imeralda with a whisper.
Name: Book 9

text: They are traveling with a patrol of Immortal guards.
Name: Book 9

text: I think there are only four, but scout patrols often have a warrior with a minor sigil of enhanced senses.
Name: Book 9

text: He might spot us.
Name: Book 9

text: As she spoke Rodregas noticed that Imeralda had a strange expression on her face, she was scared, but also seemed sad.
Name: Book 9

text: What kind of slaves do they have.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas asked in a gentle voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Her body jerked more directly toward him, surprise covering her sad expression for a second.
Name: Book 9

text: Mixed, of course, human, AElfin.
Name: Book 9

text: But, Rodregas, they have Forest and Earth Nymphs and several are children.
Name: Book 9

text: I was raised among AElfin, but these are my people.
Name: Book 9

text: I wish we could do something.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded his understanding and said, I wish we could, but the three of us against a score, the chances of our success is far smaller than the chances of our death.
Name: Book 9

text: He stated in the matter of fact sergeant voice that he knew people would follow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stood up and started to turn, but while Doivan stood he faced the road and he said, I have been on this road before, though I did not know then that it was called The Princess Road.
Name: Book 9

text: To me it was a road of sorrow.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was using that flat voice that he used when stating facts.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas, you said our odds are bad, but how long shall we wait for the odds to be good.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans voice dropped the flat tone and started to sound like rocks groaning deep in the earth, as if a great earthquake was coming, You believe that a god of the Celestials is behind your survival and that this god wants to see us fight the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: I spent two years of my life in the Menagerie, I swore to myself that given a chance I would see no others be enslaved by the Lord Taiga.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan continued speaking with the same tone as if the earth shook, I know these caravans.
Name: Book 9

text: The guards will be mostly badly trained human scum armed in leather and with weapons of simple steel.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalist scouts are another matter.
Name: Book 9

text: They will be highly trained but still the lowest of the Immortal Guards, mostly with just one or two of the lesser sigils such as strength or one that gives him enhanced senses.
Name: Book 9

text: Against the three of us, a Forest Nymph with a powerful Black Yew bow and a Hellborn Prince of the Orqui and a warrior empowered with a Celestial Lion, are the odds truly that bad.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stood still, surprised by Doivans words.
Name: Book 9

text: In truth he did not know how good or bad their odds were.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew they were not good, but his mind did not spin with the odds.
Name: Book 9

text: He simply focused on the rightness of Doivans words.
Name: Book 9

text: Trying to attack an armed keep probably had far worse odds, and for what.
Name: Book 9

text: So that they could steal horses; so that they could better their odds to escape a future fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Here, if they succeeded, the three would not be stealing horses, they would be freeing people from slavery.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked into Doivans eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt humbled at the mans bravery, at his passion, at his strength.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew there was no such thing as a hero,  simply people that sometimes choose to do the right thing when it was a hard choice.
Name: Book 9

text: There was no question for Doivan, he simply stood quiet and ready.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew what the right thing was, and he therefore took the right action.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not Doivans equal in spirit, but he knew that though he would likely die that he could not turn away from the Hellborns example.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then turned to Imeralda, her eyes told a different story.
Name: Book 9

text: She both wanted to run fast and far and she wanted to try to free the Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: Simply stated, she was scared.
Name: Book 9

text: She was young, barely more than a girl, and not a trained warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: She was also much more fragile than either Doivan or Rodregas; a blow that would only stun the two of them would shatter her.
Name: Book 9

text: Her incredible magic power would do her little good in a stand up battle.
Name: Book 9

text: For all of that she gave a nod; she was willing to follow his lead.
Name: Book 9

text: If he wanted to attack, she would follow them.
Name: Book 9

text: How could someone so young and inexperienced be so brave.
Name: Book 9

text: How could he not honor such bravery.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked into Imeraldas eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: She had been watching him.
Name: Book 9

text: There was no need for words, no argument.
Name: Book 9

text: The decision was made, they only need direction.
Name: Book 9

text: Any hope for success laid in playing to their strength.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, Doivan, you stay here and use the bow.
Name: Book 9

text: You start from the middle of the caravan as soon as you feel comfortable, and focus on the slavers.
Name: Book 9

text: If you get a free shot at an Immortal Guard, take it, but we need to reduce the numbers against us.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda, you need to stay away from the close-in fighting.
Name: Book 9

text: Get as far back as you can and still be able to see and shoot into the road.
Name: Book 9

text: You will focus on the front of the caravan and also focus on the regular slavers.
Name: Book 9

text: Dont start shooting until Doivan does, hold steady until they get close and then use your Forest Nymph skills to fade back into the trees well away from the fighting.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he said very carefully, so she would understand, Dont get yourself killed.
Name: Book 9

text: But if you can stop and turn, take a few more shots.
Name: Book 9

text: If they again turn and charge, you run and dont stop running.
Name: Book 9

text: Forget the horses; you will be much harder to track without them.
Name: Book 9

text: He was about to ask Imeralda how long until they would arrive, when Rodregas started to hear noises from up the road.
Name: Book 9

text: The party carrying the captives had arrived.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas held a finger to his lips and waved Imeralda deeper into the trees.
Name: Book 9

text: With any luck she would be safe; it was hard to catch a Forest Nymph who was trying not to be found in the trees.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan stepped partly out of the shrubs and got behind a tree to give him cover against return fire.
Name: Book 9

text: There was a good-size tree not far in front of the two of them.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas put his back to it and drew his two short swords and then did the most difficult thing he could do in this situation.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked at Doivan and not at the caravan.
Name: Book 9

text: There was no need for both of them to be peeking around the trees at the caravan, though he desperately wanted to get a good look at the caravan to establish their odds.
Name: Book 9

text: The dice had been rolled.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had been learning to trust Doivan and knew his life was now in Doivan hands.
Name: Book 9

text: If Imeralda had missed something critical and they should not attack, it was for Doivan to catch.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas watched Doivan, watched for him to raise the bow and start the fight.
Name: Book 9

text: When the guards charged in to stop the shooting, then it would be his turn to strike.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas would have to take on as many of the slavers and guards as possible.
Name: Book 9

text: It would do little good to get caught up in a one-on-one battle; the odds were too many against them.
Name: Book 9

text: He had to use his new strength and speed and go after multiple targets.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas focused on his breathing, he needed his body ready.
Name: Book 9

text: He rested his body against the tree, trying not to tense up, and breathed deep and slow.
Name: Book 9

text: Quicker than he thought, Doivans black bow came up and he started to shoot.
Name: Book 9

text: The Black Yew bows were an incredible advantage, they had been the pride of Raven Keep and were among the most dangerous and rare weapons that the Nymphs used to protect themselves.
Name: Book 9

text: Those bows had primarily been ornamental trophies for Ravenhurr; Rodregas thought that they symbolized a previous victory.
Name: Book 9

text: Only a few of the guards would have had the power to use them and Ravenhurr kept guards with even small power away from the keep.
Name: Book 9

text: Against the leather armor of the slavers there would be no defense, even if they had shields; the arrows would likely blast through anything they had.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, against the Immortalist guards it was a different matter; their armor would stop the arrows.
Name: Book 9

text: And, of course, their weapons would be equally effective against his armor, going through it like butter and into his flesh if he was not fast enough.
Name: Book 9

text: Depending on their sigils, they were likely to be either faster or stronger or both.
Name: Book 9

text: But Rodregas short swords would not cut their armor.
Name: Book 9

text: It put them at an extreme disadvantage.
Name: Book 9

text: As the arrows flew over his head, he became aware of the other disadvantage of bows.
Name: Book 9

text: They were dealing with a limited supply of arrows; once the arrows where all shot, they lost their main advantage.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas heard the noise of the first soldier to rush from the road; he went low and swung hard.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas hit knee high and the man trying to run by went flying head first into the dirt.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew from the feel of the blow that his sword had hit armor and bounced off.
Name: Book 9

text: It was an Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan shot another arrow almost straight down into the back of the neck of the downed guard.
Name: Book 9

text: The man thrashed once and then laid still.
Name: Book 9

text: The second body flew by in a blur.
Name: Book 9

text: With such swiftness, Rodregas reasoned, he must have a sigil of speed.
Name: Book 9

text: He headed right for Doivan and was behind Rodregas before he could do anything.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan must have seen him coming from his position and he dropped his bow and pulled his great sword.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard must have been thinking Forest Nymph due to the nature of the archery attack from the forest because he was unprepared for the strength of the blow.
Name: Book 9

text: Like the one Rodregas had hit, the sword failed to cut armor.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard, with the speed of his sigil, blocked it.
Name: Book 9

text: But he blocked it sword to sword instead of using the momentum and speed to simply guide the sword away from his body.
Name: Book 9

text: The resulting blow had an unpleasant sound and cut right through Doivans sword.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately for the guard, Doivan stepped forward as he swung and jammed the lower half of the sword into his opponents chest.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard flew into the bushes with a sickening crunching sound.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas next heard the sound of another of the enemy and spun into the sound using all his speed and strength, hoping to take a guard with either advantage.
Name: Book 9

text: His target proved to be a slaver.
Name: Book 9

text: He had a ragged beard and held a small battle axe.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas sword blow was too fast for the guard to block and had the strength to stun a guard wearing regulation armor.
Name: Book 9

text: His sword cleaved the guard in half, and a gout of blood and gore splattered him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas pulled his sword free and spun away from the mess.
Name: Book 9

text: As he came to rest the sound of arrows was quiet, part of his mind knew that Imeralda was backing deeper into the forest.
Name: Book 9

text: As he cleared the mess he had made of the last slaver, Rodregas came face to face with an Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: Behind him were two more slavers.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortal Guard wore the classic half plate of regulation Immortal Guard armor: A full suit of Mithril chain covered with a breastplate and leg guards and vambraces for the forearms.
Name: Book 9

text: His head was covered with a half helm.
Name: Book 9

text: His Mithril was shining in the sun.
Name: Book 9

text: His breast plate was solid dark Night Bronze.
Name: Book 9

text: The middle of his breastplate had the symbol of the Immortalists, an eagle soaring up into the clouds.
Name: Book 9

text: In his left hand was the regulation one handed long sword of the guard.
Name: Book 9

text: In his right he held a small round shield.
Name: Book 9

text: The shield did not give much coverage against bows and arrows, but was light and great for blocking hand-to-hand attacks.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas swung his short swords in slow circular motions and slowly backed up.
Name: Book 9

text: The two slavers behind the guard apparently had been impressed with the violence so far and stayed in the safety behind the guard instead of separating to each side of him.
Name: Book 9

text: One of the slavers was human, the other a small Orqui or maybe a half breed.
Name: Book 9

text: The human held a long sword, the Orqui a mace.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas tried to think of a trick, but nothing came to mind.
Name: Book 9

text: I have to strike quickly before the odds get even worse.
Name: Book 9

text: When nothing tricky comes to mind, work on the basics, Rodregas thought.
Name: Book 9

text: He stepped in closer and attacked, swinging one sword in a slashing forward swing and following up with a backhanded half slash that flowed into a half block.
Name: Book 9

text: Neither was meant to do anything but feel this opponent out.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard swung to try to meet his sword with his own instead of going after him.
Name: Book 9

text: His sword lacked the shine of the true silver of Mithril.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead it had the cast of blue steel, an enchanted steel / Mithril alloy.
Name: Book 9

text: It was as strong as Mithril, but had more weight to it and held a better edge.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas backed up, not wanting to see the results of his sword matched against a blue steel sword, as it would likely result in his short sword becoming shorter.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then stepped forward, he had to be careful though, he was a good foot taller than his opponent.
Name: Book 9

text: The guards long sword gave him better reach.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas swung at him and retreated.
Name: Book 9

text: The two shared several blows.
Name: Book 9

text: The third time that he retreated after taking a blow, the guard went for the kill.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard extended his whole body out in a lunge, thrusting his long sword out to its full length.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard saw Rodregas braided leather armor and steel sword and thrust with the point.
Name: Book 9

text: The lunge was perfect, the guard went for dead center, and even though Rodregas had been waiting for a similar move, the thrust almost caught him off guard.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard had only one problem, one that he could not have anticipated.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had been taking easy swings, not revealing his true speed.
Name: Book 9

text: Once the guard committed, Rodregas brought both of his swords down and met the lunging blade.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could not meet his sword edge to edge, but it was thrusting out and he caught it and pushed it down and to the left.
Name: Book 9

text: At the same time he moved his body to the side and in close.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then dropped his right sword as he kept his left engaged, pushing the blue steel sword away.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas moved in and thrust out with his open hand with a speed the guard simply could not match nor have expected.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had the guards throat in his grasp before his opponent knew what was happening.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard was not a big man and with his celestial strength Rodregas simply picked him up and squeezed.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt the guards neck give under his grip.
Name: Book 9

text: Before the slavers could react, Rodregas went from lifting him up to driving him down into the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: Adrenaline was surging and suddenly Rodregas had a bloody mess in his hand.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard was very dead.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas let go of the broken neck and stood quickly, trying to clear himself of the gore.
Name: Book 9

text: Both slavers looked shocked at what had happened and Rodregas moved quickly to take advantage of their surprise.
Name: Book 9

text: He went to the right and slammed his remaining sword into the Orqui.
Name: Book 9

text: The slaver grunted with pain and surprise at his quick change of targets.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas short sword caught him in the shoulder.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard half fell and half stumbled away to safety.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas turned to the final slaver and saw fear in his eyes.
Name: Book 9

text: Then Rodregas looked around and saw that he was no longer facing just one remaining opponent, but now faced four including another Immortal Guard and three more slavers.
Name: Book 9

text: He had hoped they could pick off enough with the Black Yew bows to keep odds like this against them.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas glanced to the ground hoping to see the previous guards blue steel long sword.
Name: Book 9

text: It would do a lot to give him at least a chance against these odds, but it was nowhere to be seen.
Name: Book 9

text: The dead guards small shield, though, was near his feet.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas quickly grabbed it as he made some room and switched his short sword to his right and the shield to his left.
Name: Book 9

text: This time they spread out and started to circle.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas took a chance before they got too close and glanced over at Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: In one of those weird moments that happen in battle, he saw the path between them was open.
Name: Book 9

text: He was also backing up, surrounded by three more foes.
Name: Book 9

text: At least they are all slavers.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas scooted back and said, Back to back.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan gave a grunt of acknowledgement, and they faced in opposite directions.
Name: Book 9

text: They were quickly surrounded.
Name: Book 9

text: Another final Immortal Guard stepped into the circle, increasing the odds against them.
Name: Book 9

text: Both had long swords and small shields and were dressed in the Mithril and Night Bronze half plate of the regular guard.
Name: Book 9

text: The four slavers had mismatched armor; two had short swords and there was one each with an axe and a mace.
Name: Book 9

text: The men circled them, but did not seem eager to move in.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: During the pause Doivan spoke in a low growl, All this, and can you believe there is not a decent sized Immortal Guard in the lot.
Name: Book 9

text: When we finish with them I will never fit in that armor.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smiled at the disgust in the Hellborns tone and the confidence that it implied.
Name: Book 9

text: True, Rodregas replied, but it is pretty.
Name: Book 9

text: And I would love to be facing them with one of those blue steel swords.
Name: Book 9

text: Now dont go lowering your standards, blue steel and night bronze.
Name: Book 9

text: Good enough for the common soldier, but I fancy something a little more distinctive.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was about to ask him what he had in mind when they found out why they had been waiting; two more slavers came up with drawn bows.
Name: Book 9

text: They were going to take them from a safe distance.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and he needed no words; they both knew only instant action gave them a chance.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas would like to have tried to take on one of the Immortal Guards, but he had already noticed that the slaver with the mace was a little too close and a little too far away from his nearest companion.
Name: Book 9

text: He was a skinny man with dirty hair and seemed to be having trouble holding his heavy weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped in close and the slaver swung the mace with surprising force, but he met it with the shield and knocked it aside.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas moved with simply too much speed to be blocked.
Name: Book 9

text: He slid the short sword into the slavers stomach and gutted him in a quick and vicious move.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan immediately launched himself at the next slaver, and followed suit, slamming his opponents sword away and gutting him before he had a chance to move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then went for the nearest Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: Once again he followed up with the same move, stepping forward and slamming his shield forward to either knock his opponents weapon or knock the guard himself down.
Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately, when Rodregas hit this guard he matched his every move for move.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard responded, slamming shield against shield.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had gotten too comfortable with his opponents not being able to match his strength.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortal Guard had already launched himself forward and Rodregas own speed worked against him.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas short sword hit nothing but air, he felt the sharp agony of the guards blade piercing his thigh.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas used his speed to throw himself back.
Name: Book 9

text: But as he did, he felt another sharp cut hit his upper arm.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: The other men were moving in now that he was off balance.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas twisted as he fell and grabbed one of the slavers and brought him down.
Name: Book 9

text: With a quick stab into his groin, Rodregas took the slaver out of commission.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas rolled off his squirming body and threw himself up to a standing position.
Name: Book 9

text: He almost immediately went down again as his wounded thigh buckled under him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas saw the Immortal Guard who had stabbed him, a stocky man with large arms.
Name: Book 9

text: He was coming in carefully, shield up, sword in position.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas made up his mind not to underestimate him despite being severely wounded.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas struggled back up and spread his feet wide for balance and locked his legs straight to try to keep them from buckling under him.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt cold and knew he was losing blood fast.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew that this was probably it.
Name: Book 9

text: They had gambled and lost, there were just too many of them.
Name: Book 9

text: But he did not want to die without taking out the Immortal Guards first.
Name: Book 9

text: If he killed the slavers and the guards, there was a good chance that the slaves could escape.
Name: Book 9

text: If Rodregas and his group died without taking the slavers and guards out, then they would have died in vain.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas hoped Imeralda would get away.
Name: Book 9

text: His shoulder jerked to the left, and he guessed that he had been hit by an arrow.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas threw himself toward the last guard.
Name: Book 9

text: He blocked the sword blow with his borrowed shield but did not have the angle to avoid a direct impact.
Name: Book 9

text: The sword sliced through the shield and Rodregas jerked his arm back fearing that he would lose it.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas managed to get in close and, abandoning his useless short sword, grabbed his opponents shield and pulled him in.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard tried to shrug him off, his bearded face looked afraid.
Name: Book 9

text: His eyes, a light blue, stared at Rodregas with revulsion.
Name: Book 9

text: He was probably wondering how Rodregas could be strong enough to take on an Immortal Guard.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew from the guards fear that he had him, he was not thinking clearly.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas growled at him, letting him feel his anger and rage at taking slaves to be used by the Immortalists.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had seen what would happen to them.
Name: Book 9

text: He had suffered for years with a subtle kind of inner rot at letting the evil continue.
Name: Book 9

text: In all the ways that mattered Rodregas knew he was no better than this man, he had spent most of his life as a slaver.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had no moral grounds on which to kill these men, but inside of him there was no mercy.
Name: Book 9

text: He had crossed a line and could no longer live with the evil.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas let go of the guards shield.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not have the angle to grab his opponents throat.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead he had to grab the mans lower face which was exposed by the half helm, and then he squeezed.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt the guards face give way to his rage and unnatural strength.
Name: Book 9

text: For a moment the guard struggled to escape his hold, but Rodregas pulled him closer with one hand and with the other ripped his opponents face away.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt a stab in his back as he took either an arrow or a sword.
Name: Book 9

text: He was groggy with pain, and both weak and filled with rage.
Name: Book 9

text: The guard in his hands was thrashing and spasming in unspeakable pain.
Name: Book 9

text: As the guard collapsed to the ground, Rodregas fell with him.
Name: Book 9

text: He tried to once more roll to the side, struggling away from a potential final stroke.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas face was covered in gore and blood.
Name: Book 9

text: It was hard for him to see.
Name: Book 9

text: He struggled back up, but fell, then Rodregas felt a presence to his right.
Name: Book 9

text: It was too small to be Doivan and Rodregas staggered over reaching for him, determined to take one final slaver with him.
Name: Book 9

text: His wounded leg buckled again, and Rodregas tried to reach for the ground to slow his fall, but something was wrong with his arm and it did not move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: For a split second he saw the ground coming up to hit him in the face.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 10 THE OTHER KIND OF PAIN.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas laid there looking at blue swirls for a long time, wondering where he was.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure if he was awake; his mind seemed heavy with dreams, and shifting images.
Name: Book 9

text: It took him a long time before he remembered the battle.
Name: Book 9

text: With the memory came concern for Doivan and Imeralda, and a surge of adrenaline that gave him the energy to try to wake up.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas tried to sit up, but his body, which had been so strong since that day at Raven Keep, now only responded sluggishly.
Name: Book 9

text: He was sleepy, but had the idea that he had been sleeping a very long time.
Name: Book 9

text: Yet, his body still felt exhausted.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas must have moved enough to get some attention because a man, or to be more accurate, an adult male Nymph, moved into his sight.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was always surprised by the amount of hair coming out of the ears of an adult Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: He was glad that was one trait that Imeralda did not seem to have.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew the thought to be a silly one even as it crossed his mind.
Name: Book 9

text: It was quickly replaced with concern.
Name: Book 9

text: For a second he thought that he was tied down, but Rodregas could see enough to determine that his restraints were tightly tucked bed sheets.
Name: Book 9

text: He must be very weak.
Name: Book 9

text: Easy there young man, said the old Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymph slowly helped him up and held a bowl to his mouth.
Name: Book 9

text: My name is Durien and I am healer, please slowly drink this.
Name: Book 9

text: Rinse your mouth out with it as your mouth is probably very dry after all this time.
Name: Book 9

text: The drink tasted like tea or maybe a light broth.
Name: Book 9

text: As soon as Rodregas started to drink it, he realized he was starving.
Name: Book 9

text: I need more, Rodregas croaked as he finished the bowl.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymph, an older man who unlike any Nymph Rodregas was familiar with, had his hair pulled back in a pony tail, nodded but said, Slowly, too much right away is not good for you.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and cleared his throat; which was dry and felt like it had pebbles in it.
Name: Book 9

text: While the bed was normal enough, the walls of the room were strange and seemed to be made of woven branches and some sort of hide or dark canvas pulled between tree branches to form an oval shape.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Imeralda, do they live.
Name: Book 9

text: he got the words out, though it hurt his throat to speak.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, yes, Imeralda is fine, the Nymph healer responded.
Name: Book 9

text: She was not hurt at all.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was injured pretty badly, but not as badly as you are.
Name: Book 9

text: You both should be dead from your wounds several times over.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought at first you both had a sigil of healing, that would be the only way for you two to be alive, but Imeralda says that you are both of the blood.
Name: Book 9

text: You are a lucky man, even with your blood, to be alive.
Name: Book 9

text: May I speak to them.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas asked as he looked around the room or tent.
Name: Book 9

text: He was amazed that somehow they had found a safe place to recover from the battle.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, but lets get something just a bit more hardy in you and maybe we can move you around a bit.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Your body has sat still too long.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, you will take a nap.
Name: Book 9

text: When you awake I will get you Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan is doing better than you, but I dont think he is up to doing any visiting yet.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded in relief at his words and soon enough he was once again sleeping.
Name: Book 9

text: The next day, sometime around midmorning judging from the light coming in through the opening that seemed to function like a window, Imeralda entered along with a young handsome Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: He was tall with green hair and with a confident bearing to his presence.
Name: Book 9

text: He greeted Rodregas with a very bright smile.
Name: Book 9

text: I see that you are looking much better, said the unknown Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda gave the young Nymph a big hug, one that looked far more intimate than Rodregas was comfortable with and she said, Rodregas, we are so lucky that I was able to get Jordaan to come.
Name: Book 9

text: Durien was working so hard trying to heal you, but your body is so hard to work with.
Name: Book 9

text: He says that the same innate magical ability that makes your body so strong also requires a lot of power to heal.
Name: Book 9

text: Normally Durien can heal even a very seriously wounded person, but he could barely keep you and Doivan alive.
Name: Book 9

text: I had to leave and run to Fariste to get Jordaan to come.
Name: Book 9

text: She was smiling like the sun as she spoke.
Name: Book 9

text: He was so good to come and just leave at the last moment, she added.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought she was going to start hugging the Nymph again, but she caught herself and came over to him and gave him a careful hug and started fussing with his pillows.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas wanted to pull her closer and inhale her scent.
Name: Book 9

text: He had thought that he was going to die, an experience that Rodregas of late knew too often.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted to pull Imeralda down into the bed and celebrate being alive.
Name: Book 9

text: His body was probably too weak to do more than cuddle, but Imeralda seemed to be acting very friendly with the healer.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not sure if something had changed between them while he was healing.
Name: Book 9

text: The possibility that he had lost what they had just started to explore together made Rodregas heart heavy.
Name: Book 9

text: So, I have been wanting to ask you a question, said Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: Are the two of you related.
Name: Book 9

text: That is, you and Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was caught off guard at the ridiculous question.
Name: Book 9

text: Not to mention the obvious, Rodregas said, but Doivan is an Orqui Hellborn from across the Sea and I am.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas paused in confusion, what exactly was he now.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached for the closest comparison and said, I have some Celestial blood, but I am human.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, Jordaan said, well that is strange, you do know that you are also part Hellborn, right.
Name: Book 9

text: Hellborns are very rare in this part of the world and your bodies feel so similar that I thought you might be related through a well a distant relation.
Name: Book 9

text: His heart stopped at his words and he asked in a rush, You are saying I am Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: That is impossible.
Name: Book 9

text: Can we wait one moment.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda raising her hand.
Name: Book 9

text: I think we need to bring Doivan in to be part of this conversation.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas just nodded, stunned at the news.
Name: Book 9

text: As Imeralda left the room to get Doivan, Jordaan stepped closer and slowly moved his hand from Rodregas feet to his head, his eyes half closed.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas wondered what he could sense.
Name: Book 9

text: You are a Nymph of the flesh.
Name: Book 9

text: Contrary to his early good mood, the Nymph froze at those words.
Name: Book 9

text: With a hesitant smile the green haired Nymph said, We actually prefer the term Nymph of Life.
Name: Book 9

text: Truly, life is as powerful an element as any.
Name: Book 9

text: Sorry, Rodregas said, realizing he had accidentally insulted the healer, I have never spent much time with Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas tone was quieter.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymph seemed young and smart and gifted.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas knew he did not have to like him.
Name: Book 9

text: But clearly from Imeraldas introduction, this Nymph was well known and powerful among his people, and he had saved both Rodregas and Doivans lives.
Name: Book 9

text: There was an awkward moment until Doivan appeared at the door.
Name: Book 9

text: He walked with the help of a tall walking stick.
Name: Book 9

text: His arm and side were both covered in bandages.
Name: Book 9

text: Durien followed him in with a heavy stool, which Doivan quickly sat down on.
Name: Book 9

text: The old healer immediately left the room.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas, you look much better than last I saw you.
Name: Book 9

text: But what is so important that it takes me away from a very important nap.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans body looked worse for the wear, but his eyes showed his natural curiosity and intelligence.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not think he actually minded coming over to his room.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas smiled and thought that given the way Doivan talked about pain when training them with the staff, that he must be immune to mere pain anyhow.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda repeated Jordaans question.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan asked Rodregas if you two were related as being Hellborn is very rare in the Eastern Realms.
Name: Book 9

text: And Doivans surprised expression Imeralda added, While I cannot sense the feel and make up of a body like I can a tree, I do know the feel of magic, and I had thought a few times that I sensed the feel of Brimstone and Fire not just with Doivan, but with both of you.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could feel his eyes widen as Imeralda confirmed what Jordaan had felt.
Name: Book 9

text: He had been thinking while Doivan was being fetched and he had a question for his friend.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, you were swept up quickly after you entered the Eastern Realms; you clearly have a strong physical essence and strong magical power.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalists should not be interested in either.
Name: Book 9

text: Which did they show interest in.
Name: Book 9

text: Both really, I did not understand why they wanted me.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought if you were Hellborn you were safe from the Immortalists, Doivan replied, They would cut me to see how fast I would heal and do tests where they were clearly testing my physical side.
Name: Book 9

text: They also seemed just as excited about my magical power, which I was surprised by.
Name: Book 9

text: It was the first time I was aware that I had strong magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan paused then added, They seem to think I was a great catch, and I think Taiga wanted a lot of money for me.
Name: Book 9

text: The thing is, the Beast Master Taiga kept me in a distant cell.
Name: Book 9

text: Though he had me for two years, he only showed me to others for sale a handful of times.
Name: Book 9

text: You are suggesting that Taiga, and in turn Ravenhurr, were breaking The One Law.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: His voice, for the first time, seemed totally serious and very professional.
Name: Book 9

text: The three companions shared a blank look.
Name: Book 9

text: The two men turned to Imeralda who simply asked the question, Jordaan, you know I have had little magical training.
Name: Book 9

text: I have been more of a prized blood mare than a wizard and these other two are warriors.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont think any of us know what The One Law is.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan looked surprised, but then nodded.
Name: Book 9

text: It is a law set forth by both the Celestials and the Infernals.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you know the source of Magic.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked her.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda nodded, Sure, there are four sources of magic: mortal, Celestial, Infernal and elemental.
Name: Book 9

text: It is one of the reasons I am prized for my potential with more than one power.
Name: Book 9

text: My AElven ancestry is strong with mortal magic, but my Nymph side is strong in elemental magic.
Name: Book 9

text: If an Immortalist takes my power, he or she could become stronger in both.
Name: Book 9

text: Mostly correct, Jordaan said.
Name: Book 9

text: It is actually a topic of much debate among magicians.
Name: Book 9

text: I go along with the belief that there is no such thing as mortal magic.
Name: Book 9

text: While we dont have time now to go over all the proof, the general thought is that mortals are truly just animals and dont produce magic.
Name: Book 9

text: It is only our connection to other realms that provides us power.
Name: Book 9

text: Mana is the raw energy of magic no matter what its source.
Name: Book 9

text: You can use mana from any source to cast spells.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked around at the three of them to make sure they understood.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt like he was back in a classroom, as he had been as a child in the Cathedral of the Knights.
Name: Book 9

text: In truth all three were very interested, as magic was something that was very much affecting their lives at the moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas noticed that while Imeraldas expression was one of simple enjoyment at refining her knowledge with an expert, Doivans seemed almost made of rock.
Name: Book 9

text: It seemed as if he feared that if he moved, his inclusion in the discussion would be challenged.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan, apparently satisfied with their attention, continued Our ability to manipulate the sources of mana seems to be a relationship of our blood connection to a realm.
Name: Book 9

text: Mortals, to a greater or lesser extent; have an ability to tap into the mana that has overflowed into our realm from the Celestial, Infernal and Elemental Realms.
Name: Book 9

text: I, for one, believe that if our connections to these realms were cut, Jordaan made a motion like knife cutting a loaf of bread, that in a few years there would not be enough magic for us to use.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily, I can think of no way for such a thing to happen.
Name: Book 9

text: But a mortals ability to use mana that has spilled into the mortal world is very limited.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalists have overcome this limitation by incorporating certain peoples direct connection to these realms.
Name: Book 9

text: So, Jordaan continued, if a mortal can add a Celestials ability to directly tap the Celestial power, he becomes far stronger.
Name: Book 9

text: If the magic user can also tap into the Elemental powers, he again becomes far more powerful.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, the end goal of the Immortalists is to become a god.
Name: Book 9

text: There are limitations; if an Immortalist were to incorporate a celestial ants connection to the Celestial, he would gain in power.
Name: Book 9

text: But if he were to try to incorporate a thousand ants, he would only gain the same connection as that single ant.
Name: Book 9

text: So instead he might try a butterfly to gain the power of its greater life essence.
Name: Book 9

text: At this point Jordaan paused and he went from an expression of lecturing to one of fearfulness.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas almost expected him to look around for an assassin.
Name: Book 9

text: When next he spoke, his words were quiet and drawn out.
Name: Book 9

text: The Gods and Infernals have been at war from the beginning of time.
Name: Book 9

text: They are opposites of the eternal balance of creation and destruction.
Name: Book 9

text: But when mortals started to combine the various powers, the two eternal enemies agreed on one thing and this became The One Law.
Name: Book 9

text: Mortals can work to become Gods through growing in Celestial Power, and they can even tap into the elemental powers.
Name: Book 9

text: They also can become Infernals if they so wish, though I know of few who have tried.
Name: Book 9

text: The chaotic and destructive nature of the infernal does not lead to the necessary discipline that is required to be an Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: A mortal must choose only one path; Celestial or Infernal.
Name: Book 9

text: That is The One Law.
Name: Book 9

text: Why.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan, his deep voice sounding both menacing and curious.
Name: Book 9

text: Nobody knows for sure, said Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: The Gods and Infernals do not explain their actions, but most believe that if someone had the full potential to tap into all three he would be stronger than either the Gods or the Greater Daemons.
Name: Book 9

text: He would have the potential to rule all the realms and break the great balance.
Name: Book 9

text: This is something that not even the Infernals want, he added.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas spoke, So if Ravenhurr, who was a friend of Taiga, was part of a group of Immortalists who are breaking The One Law then he might have already added Hellborn power to his own.
Name: Book 9

text: And when I took on Ravenhurrs power, I also added the Infernal power, which is natural for a Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: It could also be a reason that the gods answered my prayers and helped me succeed against Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: So the Gods might not be against all Immortalists, but just the ones who are tapping into the Infernal power.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: All Immortalists deserve to die for their crimes, Rodregas answered.
Name: Book 9

text: His angry response did not surprise the others.
Name: Book 9

text: Agreed, said Doivan, raising his hand in a calming gesture, but it might be helpful to understand what the gods will support us doing.
Name: Book 9

text: True, Rodregas added.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, do you remember the names of the other Immortalists who were interested in purchasing you for their rituals.
Name: Book 9

text: I heard no names, Doivan answered, but I heard one of them referred to as The Ambassador.
Name: Book 9

text: They treated him with great respect.
Name: Book 9

text: I understood he was a very important person.
Name: Book 9

text: I wonder if that is Ambassador Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: He is a powerful Immortalist and said to be very close to Taiga.
Name: Book 9

text: Some claim he is one of the few people that Taiga both respects and trusts.
Name: Book 9

text: Ambassador Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: He visited Ravenhurr about five years ago.
Name: Book 9

text: Ravenhurr seemed eager to have him visit, which was unusual for him.
Name: Book 9

text: Ravenhurr was usually very solitary.
Name: Book 9

text: What else do you remember about their conversation or about Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda of Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: Nothing, I was a guard who did my duty and kept my nose out of things.
Name: Book 9

text: I know little of most Immortalists other than what is common knowledge.
Name: Book 9

text: The four talked a bit more and then split up.
Name: Book 9

text: To Rodregas discomfort, Jordaan and Imeralda left together.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan trailed the others and then stepped back toward Rodregas room.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas sagged against the bed, the wound of losing Imeralda hurting more than those of his flesh.
Name: Book 9

text: You said you knew she was a Nymph, stated Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted sympathy, but he knew that the straight talking Doivan was not likely to give him any.
Name: Book 9

text: It is just that, well I was hoping for some more time.
Name: Book 9

text: If you can accept her for who she is, then your time is not over, said Doivan, his voice rumbling less than usual.
Name: Book 9

text: None of us is simple, continued the Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: The two of us have become friends, even though I am a Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: In me flows the blood of the Daemons of the Infernal.
Name: Book 9

text: He paused and then his voice cracked, showing a trace of a deep emotion for the first time Yet, you treat me like a man.
Name: Book 9

text: You must do the same for Imeralda, for you two to be lovers you must learn to share her with others.
Name: Book 9

text: She has a lot of love to give.
Name: Book 9

text: Do not be so selfish as to want it all to yourself.
Name: Book 9

text: With that he gave a punch to Rodregas side, causing Rodregas to grunt in pain, and Doivan followed the other two out the door.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas laid in the bed, his mind whirling with thoughts.
Name: Book 9

text: At first he thought about the implications of what Jordaan had shared.
Name: Book 9

text: But, then his mind went back again and again over his and Imeraldas time during the last few weeks and then back to Doivans words.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew his friend spoke the truth, but he was not so sure about his ability to do what he needed to keep his relationship with the beautiful AElven Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 11 THE NATURE OF BONDS.
Name: Book 9

text: The next few days Rodregas and Doivan recovered quickly under the powerful healing magic of Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: This is not to say Rodregas did not spend most of his time dreaming that the handsome young Nymph would head back to his own estates.
Name: Book 9

text: They were staying in a small village that seemed to be mostly a forest with small rooms built into it.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could not figure out any set pattern to the place or its boundaries.
Name: Book 9

text: There might have been a dozen or even hundreds of Nymphs living there.
Name: Book 9

text: Though all the Nymphs were friendly, he was still eager to leave.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan was doing one of his mystic checks, running his hand a foot above Rodregas reclining body.
Name: Book 9

text: Occasionally, his hand seemed to be moving in the air like a baker making bread.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Rodregas finally said, I feel fine now and I thank you for your healing, but I think I am ready to leave.
Name: Book 9

text: His face held his usual expression of good cheer.
Name: Book 9

text: Your body heals fast and is a fascinating medium to work with.
Name: Book 9

text: A cloud went over his smile when he added, Your body and spirit were not in very good alignment and your connection to the world was terribly fractured.
Name: Book 9

text: Truly, it has been more effort to fix your spiritual wounds than your physical ones.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaans smile returned when he added, While true healing takes a lifetime of both inner and outer work, you are physically healthy enough to be on your way.
Name: Book 9

text: And while I enjoy the challenge of working on your enhanced body, your presence too long among us will bring danger down to us.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, but asked, And Doivan, is he healthy enough to travel and fight if needed.
Name: Book 9

text: He needs to let go of some of his anger and learn to focus on his inner self, but his physical wounds are healed.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure of all that Jordaan was saying.
Name: Book 9

text: But he understood that they were healthy enough to go.
Name: Book 9

text: So he then asked the question that he really wanted to ask, Do you know if Imeralda is coming with us, or if she staying with you.
Name: Book 9

text: He should have asked her that himself during the last few days.
Name: Book 9

text: But he was afraid to ask the beautiful young woman.
Name: Book 9

text: He was afraid of what the answer might be.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you truly understand Imeraldas dual nature.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: She is a half Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: What does that have to do with her going or staying.
Name: Book 9

text: Nothing, but it does if you love her.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan said with his big smile.
Name: Book 9

text: His expression showed nothing but his normal cheer.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead of answering the Nymphs question Rodregas asked him one instead.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you love her.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, I would not travel this distance for anyone else.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda is an amazing young woman beautiful, intelligent, charming and potentially a very powerful magician.
Name: Book 9

text: I cherish every moment with her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas heart sank at the news.
Name: Book 9

text: Life with the powerful healer would be a far better one than one with his lost crusade.
Name: Book 9

text: Since you would ask me such a personal question, I have one for you.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan responded, You are clearly struggling with what it means that Imeralda is a half Nymph, but have you thought about what is means that she is a half AElf.
Name: Book 9

text: AElf maidens, when they mate with an AElf man, form a spiritual and magical bond.
Name: Book 9

text: It is a bond that lasts all their lives and connects them on multiple levels as no other race is connected.
Name: Book 9

text: That is why the AElves take so long to choose a life mate and almost never choose one outside of their race.
Name: Book 9

text: They mate for life; not out of choice, but because that is required of their nature.
Name: Book 9

text: After Jordaan finished speaking he stood silently as Rodregas sat up in bed and thought on the healers words.
Name: Book 9

text: She is not as free with her body as most Nymphs, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: No, she is not.
Name: Book 9

text: She only lies with men who she truly feels a great respect for, Jordaan answered.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had known that fact, but had not really thought about it.
Name: Book 9

text: So what you are saying is that Imeralda forms a life bond like a AElf.
Name: Book 9

text: But while a normal AElf has only one she can form multiple bonds, and she has a bond with you and a bond with me.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Yes, I know of few other cases like this.
Name: Book 9

text: She will always know where you are.
Name: Book 9

text: And my guess is if you are open to the bond, you will be able to know where she is.
Name: Book 9

text: But, there are also deeper implications.
Name: Book 9

text: The mating bond is one of the great sources of power for the AElf peoples, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not understand fully what Jordaan meant but he suddenly added, Then, if Imeralda is bonded to me, she will always try to keep her connection with me.
Name: Book 9

text: He asked a question, but he thought he already knew the answer.
Name: Book 9

text: She will love others, but she is bonded to you for all time, until one of you dies.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas sat quietly, stunned by the news.
Name: Book 9

text: No more words passed between the two until Jordaan was about to leave.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you know where the weapons are from the Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: We are going to need them if we are going to do better during our next encounter.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was getting his mind back to business; the news that he would never truly be separated from Imeralda revived his spirit.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, we took the weapons as salvage.
Name: Book 9

text: It has helped to pay for your healing and equipping of the people you rescued.
Name: Book 9

text: As their rescuers you were, of course, responsible for getting them properly outfitted and on their way back to their homes.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas sat shocked for a moment and then he just exploded.
Name: Book 9

text: You cant do that.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you have any idea how much we need that gear.
Name: Book 9

text: We bled for it.
Name: Book 9

text: We put our lives at risk to rescue Imeraldas people, and all we ask for in return is the Infernal gear.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas breathed deep trying to calm himself, but it was no use.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped out of his room which, unlike a normal room in a human house opened directly outside.
Name: Book 9

text: He ducked under a branch and bolted through the two trees and through a bush and to the door to Doivans room.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was standing up, his walking stick up ready to fight at Rodregas bellow.
Name: Book 9

text: What alarms you.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: He seemed to be listening for attack.
Name: Book 9

text: These bastards are trying to take our armor and swords.
Name: Book 9

text: We nearly died because it was the right thing to do to rescue the Nymphs, especially with the children being part of the caravan.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas added in a growl, There were probably Dire steeds as well.
Name: Book 9

text: By the Infernal Daemons, I might be as strong as a Celestial Lion, but we are going to get chopped to little pieces until we have decent armor and weapons.
Name: Book 9

text: But why would they keep the armor.
Name: Book 9

text: growled Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: These people do not seem to be warriors.
Name: Book 9

text: What good would it do them.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan tossed his wild black mane of hair and his eyes lighted with rage.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas suddenly realized that he better not feed the Hellborns rage.
Name: Book 9

text: Those with Infernal blood were known for their berserker rages.
Name: Book 9

text: They seldom survived the rampages, but were nearly unstoppable when they fell into one.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas breathed deeply, trying to lower his own anger and frustration.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan stepped outside the room Rodregas had been staying in and into the small clearing that was the center of the Nymph Dwello, the tent like structure that they used for houses.
Name: Book 9

text: Gentleman, please, said Jordaan.
Name: Book 9

text: You must have understood that this village took a great risk in taking you, and those you rescued, in.
Name: Book 9

text: The only way Imeralda was able to get their support was to offer the bounty of the Immortal Guards equipment.
Name: Book 9

text: As if called from Jordaans words, Imeralda landed in the clearing, seemingly leaping from one of the nearby trees.
Name: Book 9

text: She looked a bit out of breath, like she had sprinted at a run to the Dwello.
Name: Book 9

text: She took a quick look at Doivan and Rodregas and paled.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivans eyes were literally glowing red and he was tossing his horned head with his wild black hair flying.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda had not seen him in such a mood before, not even during the battle with the slave caravan.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda thought that Rodregas was only marginally better.
Name: Book 9

text: The muscles of his neck and shoulders were bunched up and she could feel his anger through her bond with him.
Name: Book 9

text: But he was also breathing deeply and through the bond she knew he was trying to control himself.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda saw that Rodregas was also watching Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: She thought he also recognized the danger of a Hellborn rage.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda reached out to Rodregas first to try to get him to calm down and help manage Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda focused on their bond and looked him in the eyes and said, Rodregas getting angry will not change things, lets sit down and talk to the village elders.
Name: Book 9

text: They are thankful for what we have done.
Name: Book 9

text: They need payment for their risk, but they understand we have needs.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and seemed to be calming down until Jordaan spoke, No, you made your agreement.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda you have said that the equipment of the Immortal Guard was ours.
Name: Book 9

text: While our warriors are not as renown as some of the other races, we have several who are worthy of such armor and such gear is critical for our own survival.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda could see both mens renewed rage at Jordaans words.
Name: Book 9

text: She knew she should calm them down, but her first thought was how stupid men could be, men of all races.
Name: Book 9

text: Sure it would have been great for them to get their better quality armor, but they were only alive because of her.
Name: Book 9

text: She was the one who had to come back and shoot the final guards.
Name: Book 9

text: She was the one who had to come back.
Name: Book 9

text: She shot the final guards with the Black Yew bows.
Name: Book 9

text: She was no warrior but had gone back with only a few arrows and rescued them.
Name: Book 9

text: She had patched them up, rounded up the rescued slaves and sought a refuge.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you insane.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked them in a voice that was as cold as her anger.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda, her voice dripping scorn, added, It was only because one of the slaves had family at the local village that we were able to find this refuge.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, no matter how valiant the efforts of healer Durien, he barely kept you two from deaths door.
Name: Book 9

text: So what did I do.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked them.
Name: Book 9

text: I nearly ran myself to exhaustion fetching Jordaan to heal you.
Name: Book 9

text: I was using my own relationship to rescue you, who I have known less than a season.
Name: Book 9

text: And now that all this effort has been done you are going to get mad mad at the only reason you two are alive to complain at all.
Name: Book 9

text: Well to the Infernal with you.
Name: Book 9

text: With that Imeralda turned and jumped back into the trees.
Name: Book 9

text: The half Nymphs anger, though not meant to cool the warriors, had that effect as both men stood in shock at Imeraldas normally calm demeanor.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan wilted like a flower without water in the sun; he literally sat down on the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas simply sagged as the truth behind the half AElfs words sank in.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan simply stood watching the scene, without his normal expression of cheer.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally Rodregas turned to Jordaan and said, Imeralda is right and I apologize for our anger.
Name: Book 9

text: My life and the life of my friend are well worth the price and we are in your debt.
Name: Book 9

text: At Rodregas words Jordaan simply nodded and then stepped into the trees, disappearing as the Nymphs had a habit of doing when in nature.
Name: Book 9

text: I had better go apologize to Imeralda, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: You should wait a while and let her rage cool first, suggested Doivan slowly.
Name: Book 9

text: He spoke as one who was very familiar with rage.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas realized that Doivan was probably right so he sat back and tried to think of the right words to speak when the timing was better.
Name: Book 9

text: Unfortunately when Rodregas did speak to Imeralda his explanations and apology were not well received.
Name: Book 9

text: She listened but seemed to have little sympathy.
Name: Book 9

text: He decided that the only thing left to do was plan to get together what gear they could and head back out.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 12 TO WALK AN OLD PATH.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was surprised to find a pile of equipment outside his door the next morning, and Imeralda sorting through the pile.
Name: Book 9

text: It appeared to be mostly their equipment plus miscellaneous pieces of slaver gear.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan stood watching, clearly not sure what to make of it.
Name: Book 9

text: When Rodregas tried to apologize Imeralda ignored him and instead said, We traded the Immortal Guard equipment for safe harbor here at the village for healing.
Name: Book 9

text: But, of course, there were also regular slaver guards and I claimed their equipment and any money that was in their personal money pouches.
Name: Book 9

text: Your armor got pretty chopped up, she continued, and Doivan did not have any armor to start with.
Name: Book 9

text: I have been trading excess gear and coins to repair armor and to refit some of the other armor to fit Doivan and yourself.
Name: Book 9

text: We still had our three horses, but none of them were too great to begin with; the two were good for pulling carriages, the other was too old.
Name: Book 9

text: True, Rodregas said nodding his agreement.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan knows horse flesh, she went on, and we were able to trade the three old horses for one of the Immortal Guards horses.
Name: Book 9

text: I will be honest, he is a big ugly brute and not war trained and his Dire blood is marginal.
Name: Book 9

text: But Jordaan thinks he can actually handle Doivans weight.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymphs were not that interested in keeping him because for a Dire steed he is slow.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan said, A steed that can handle me.
Name: Book 9

text: That would make a nice change of pace.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda continued, He along with the two best of the slavers horses that I claimed.
Name: Book 9

text: That means we now have three decent riding horses.
Name: Book 9

text: Not the Dire war mounts that I know you want, but an upgrade on what we had.
Name: Book 9

text: The local armorer was also able to piece together some steel chain that was decent quality and a good leather harness for Doivan and he was able to repair your armor.
Name: Book 9

text: You now also have some chain that should fit over your leather armor.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda added, I was able to recover only about a score of the arrows, but I have been working with some of the wood nymphs and the armorer and we now have a full set of arrows again.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, at her motion towards his armor, picked up the pile of chain mail and tried it over his head.
Name: Book 9

text: The opening on top actually fit over his huge head.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan guessed that it had been the chain of the large overweight slaver that he had killed.
Name: Book 9

text: While the equipment was all of average quality, Rodregas was smiling because clearly there were three sets of everything plus a pack horse for equipment.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was clearly planning on joining them.
Name: Book 9

text: While that is what his heart hoped for he was not sure if it was the smartest move.
Name: Book 9

text: When they were working on the tack for the horses, he went ahead and asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda, I want to make sure you want to continue with us.
Name: Book 9

text: I mean I love to travel with you, but while Doivan and I are warriors, when you joined us it was only as a travel companion.
Name: Book 9

text: If you want to stay with the village or stay with Jordaan I will understand.
Name: Book 9

text: You know that by now they will be hunting us, if not because of Ravenhurrs death, than because of the missing Immortal Guards.
Name: Book 9

text: You know that I probably killed more slavers with the Black Yew bow than either you or Doivan right.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda with a snort.
Name: Book 9

text: Your abilities are not of question, Rodregas responded.
Name: Book 9

text: Your abilities as a Forest Nymph and as an archer make you a very deadly woman.
Name: Book 9

text: As you gain control over your magical powers you will only become more dangerous.
Name: Book 9

text: The question is whether you want to fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda nodded and she hesitated.
Name: Book 9

text: I will be honest, she said.
Name: Book 9

text: I am a little torn, I have never been as afraid as during and after the battle.
Name: Book 9

text: I have truly come to care for both of you.
Name: Book 9

text: I have met few men of such character and willingness to take on the Guild of the Celestial Path and all their power.
Name: Book 9

text: She continued, I want to be with you.
Name: Book 9

text: I want to share this journey, but I am not a warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: And the two of you were so close to dying on me, and next time I might not be able to save you and you might die, she paused.
Name: Book 9

text: I could handle dying, but I am not sure I could handle having you die in my arms.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda, said Doivan, we must all walk our own paths.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas and I have made a choice, we will fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Whether the Gods are on our side or not, we will fight.
Name: Book 9

text: You need to find your own path; you are talented and young and have the world at your feet.
Name: Book 9

text: We cherish the time that you joined us.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, Doivans words had captured his own thoughts.
Name: Book 9

text: He was no boy to put his own needs over another.
Name: Book 9

text: I agree, I cherish the time we have had together, but you must walk your own path.
Name: Book 9

text: The Grimoires and Mithril chain and bow are yours to keep, my gifts to you.
Name: Book 9

text: Your gifts to me are far greater.
Name: Book 9

text: So where do you go now.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: You cant look for slavers on the road; they will be reinforced after the one caravan goes missing.
Name: Book 9

text: His thoughts had traveled in a similar direction.
Name: Book 9

text: I have been thinking about what you said about it making sense for me to get a greater sigil.
Name: Book 9

text: I have more magic than I need.
Name: Book 9

text: There is only one other group besides the Guild that has is allowed to give sigils, the Knights of the Soaring Heavens; from who the Gods choose their champions.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda and Doivan had both become quite intrigued by what Rodregas was hinting at.
Name: Book 9

text: He continued, I was a squire in the Knighthood who was never raised.
Name: Book 9

text: As you probably know most squires are not raised, only those of the most noble blood and those of greatest talent in both magic and the arts of a warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: I had thought that I would make a career in the army, he paused after admitting that.
Name: Book 9

text: His time as a squire was like magic to him, and his time in the army had been a living nightmare.
Name: Book 9

text: Once a year directly after the new group of knights is raised, a great competition is held; a five days open tournament.
Name: Book 9

text: Any previous squire is eligible to compete.
Name: Book 9

text: The winner of this competition is raised to knighthood, Rodregas added.
Name: Book 9

text: You mean to enter the tournament for the right to knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: The tournament is held twenty days after the autumn equinox at the Great Cathedral of Oravue.
Name: Book 9

text: I believe that to be in about ten days and it is about a seven day ride from here, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: You would challenge for knighthood, said Imeralda quietly.
Name: Book 9

text: That is not a bad idea, while the Guild will be on the hunt for you, they would not expect you to be in such an event, and you will be surrounded by other warriors.
Name: Book 9

text: They would have no room to suspect you.
Name: Book 9

text: There are a few problems.
Name: Book 9

text: I would need to show proof that I was a squire, which I have, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: As he spoke he reached into his pouch and pulled out his old Squire patch.
Name: Book 9

text: He showed them the old beaten cloth, the one memento that he had taken with him from his old life.
Name: Book 9

text: The only problem would be if someone asked too many questions about when and where he had trained.
Name: Book 9

text: It might not work, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: but I think it worth the effort to try.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded but said, It is a worthy goal, but what of me.
Name: Book 9

text: The knighthood is mostly a human thing; Hellborn especially will not be welcome to attend the event.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded but said, If you are ok with calling yourself and acting as my sworn man,  you could enter the Cathedral and stay with me.
Name: Book 9

text: They wont be happy about it, but they cannot challenge who I bring with me.
Name: Book 9

text: I would love to figure out a way to smuggle you into the room of the sigils, not likely but something we can check out, Rodregas added.
Name: Book 9

text: And what about Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you mean.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: If I am your sworn man could you also bring me into the Cathedral.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, Yes, I have known some Orqui and AElves who have joined the knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: I cannot think of any Hellborn or Nymphs staying there during my time.
Name: Book 9

text: But that is more of a matter of the rareness of Hellborn, and Nymphs have never shown interest in joining the knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: While I am still hesitant to say that your cause is mine, I do wish to keep traveling with you two.
Name: Book 9

text: I have always heard stories of the knights and would enjoy visiting the Cathedral.
Name: Book 9

text: It is supposed to be a place of great magic and many myths and stories.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, he could not help smiling.
Name: Book 9

text: He enjoyed the company of the two of them.
Name: Book 9

text: It would be good to continue to travel together.
Name: Book 9

text: The next day Imeralda arranged to send a group of fellow Forest Nymphs back to the farm to put a roof on the old farmhouse.
Name: Book 9

text: It was probably not worth the cost of some of their excess equipment and limited gold, but the three of them all had good memories of the farm and liked the idea putting a roof back on the structure.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymphs with their connection with nature were the only humanoids unlikely to be attacked by the Dire Cats.
Name: Book 9

text: The biggest surprise came when Jordaan came to say goodbye.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had his stuff all spread out in the room he had been using, organizing what would go where.
Name: Book 9

text: The trunk had been left in the barn back at the farm, but its contents were now in his saddlebag.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had signaled Jordaan to wait a moment as he rolled his gear up.
Name: Book 9

text: He was wrapping some of the Grimoires that they were not reading and the small mechanical toy frog that he had picked up in Ravenhurrs laboratory when Jordaan made a funny sound and stepped forward.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan seemed to be staring at the package and Rodregas wondered if he had recognized one of the Grimoires.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan pointed at the newly wrapped package and said, Excuse me, but can I see that.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and curiously handled the half wrapped pack over to the Nymph wondering what had captured his attention.
Name: Book 9

text: The Nymph slowly laid the package on the bed and unwrapped it.
Name: Book 9

text: His hand passed over the contents in a motion similar to what he had done while working on Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: To Rodregas surprise he stopped at the small toy frog.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan glanced over to him as if asking for permission and Rodregas nodded his ok.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan reached down and carefully picked up the small frog and cupped it in his hands.
Name: Book 9

text: His eyes were closed in concentration.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked up at Rodregas with a confused expression and asked, Do you know what this is.
Name: Book 9

text: Not really, I found it in Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: It felt of magic so I took it.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought it might be worth something.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan smiled and laughed as he said, Worth something indeed.
Name: Book 9

text: This is a minor Sigil of Healing.
Name: Book 9

text: It was Rodregas who gasped this time and said, Infernals.
Name: Book 9

text: We had a Sigil of Healing all this time.
Name: Book 9

text: If we had inscribed this sigil back at the farm we would never have needed your help.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan nodded at the truth of Rodregas words and the two of them quickly gathered the others.
Name: Book 9

text: All agreed that no matter what might happen with the greater sigils that all should gain the minor Sigil of Healing.
Name: Book 9

text: Its benefits to warriors and mages alike were well known.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan agreed to do the inscribing and show the others the technique.
Name: Book 9

text: In return Imeralda would inscribe Jordaan who was also eager for the sigil.
Name: Book 9

text: Jordaan had his hand out with the palm facing up.
Name: Book 9

text: At Jordaans direction Rodregas put his own, palm up, on top of it.
Name: Book 9

text: The frog went on top and Jordaans other hand went on top of the frog.
Name: Book 9
