text: It was generally understood that you did not try to claim the shield until the last opponent was down.
Name: Book 9

text: But, of course, the winner was simply the first to take the shield to the hall.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas jumped up and ran, his arms pumping.
Name: Book 9

text: He was almost as surprised as the armored squire with how fast he caught him and knocked him to the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: This squire, though, thrust the shield at him and collapsed to the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked around the arena to make sure no one was left to fight and then headed into the great hall, carrying the shield of the tournament champion.
Name: Book 9

text: As he walked the hallway into the main hearing chamber, knights stood along the walls.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas passed they all mumbled the same words to him, Welcome to the Order my brother.
Name: Book 9

text: Several reached out and shook his hand or showed other signs of welcome.
Name: Book 9

text: Others, though, looked at him strangely, clearly put off by the way he had won the melee.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt a little unsteady, not sure what to make of both the welcome and the uncomfortable looks.
Name: Book 9

text: As he passed through the doors in the main hearing chamber, the Grand Marshal stood at the far end waiting.
Name: Book 9

text: In the chamber were both knights and squires.
Name: Book 9

text: Many smiled; he thought a few looked like the ones in the hall, not sure what to think of this new knight.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not surprised that when he started to kneel in front of the Grand Marshal, for Vandret to step forward and speak.
Name: Book 9

text: Grand Marshal, you are not really thinking of knighting this fiend, are you.
Name: Book 9

text: He killed a fellow squire out there.
Name: Book 9

text: And he consorts with Nymphs and Infernals, not people of the Celestial Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: You do the Order a disservice to make him a Knight of the Soaring Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandrets voice was slow and reasonable sounding and he spoke not so much to the Grand Marshal as to the audience.
Name: Book 9

text: I but follow the rules of the Order as they have stood for unknown centuries, Ambassador.
Name: Book 9

text: While there are many things that go into raising a squire to knighthood, the tournament is the exception.
Name: Book 9

text: The rules are simple; win and you win knighthood.
Name: Book 9

text: While undue bloodshed can disqualify you, a single death during the tournament is not unusual.
Name: Book 9

text: While the Grand Marshal spoke, he did not look at the audience.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked at Vandret and he did not look happy at the interruption.
Name: Book 9

text: But clearly he already has a greater sigil; no man can fight like that who does not have one.
Name: Book 9

text: He is an impostor.
Name: Book 9

text: He steals this knighthood from more deserving squires, Vandret said.
Name: Book 9

text: At this Rodregas saw many people nodding, but he remained silent.
Name: Book 9

text: It was not his turn to answer any question other than from the Grand Marshal.
Name: Book 9

text: The Marshal Faurrenida voice made his displeasure and his dislike of arguing with a non-knight clear as he said, While a knight has the full right to enter both the Lesser and Greater Sigil Chambers and take and sigil as his level of magic might allow, it is not a sigil he earns today.
Name: Book 9

text: Now, the discussion is over.
Name: Book 9

text: growled Marshal Faurrenida.
Name: Book 9

text: To forestall any further argument, the Grand Marshal stepped forward quickly and drew his sword.
Name: Book 9

text: The sword gleamed of the highest quality blue steel and red fire seemed to run its length.
Name: Book 9

text: Marshal Faurrenida laid the sword on Rodregas right shoulder and said, Squire, you come to us this day.
Name: Book 9

text: Think well and be sure on your decision to swear these oaths.
Name: Book 9

text: Faurrenida paused for a second and then slowly added.
Name: Book 9

text: Will you swear to uphold the Rules of Chivalry, to serve the Order of the Soaring Heavens with honor, and to serve as the Champion of the Celestials on this World if called to be a Paladin.
Name: Book 9

text: My Lord Grand Marshal, I so swear in the name of the Celestial Gods.
Name: Book 9

text: Strangely, instead of being excited, he felt tired.
Name: Book 9

text: In some ways he was adding another burden and it was heavy.
Name: Book 9

text: Arise, Sir Rodregas, Knight of the Soaring Heavens and be made welcome in the Cathedral of the Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: Applause filled the room, though it was muted.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked for Doivan and Imeralda and he was sad to see that they had not been there to share his moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret at least had left.
Name: Book 9

text: The next few hours went by quickly.
Name: Book 9

text: He was introduced to many people.
Name: Book 9

text: It was late as the other knights went to find sleep when both Doivan and Imeralda suddenly both appeared.
Name: Book 9

text: He could see from their body language that they were ready to do more than congratulate him.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 15 DARK SHADOWS.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan led the three deeper into the great cathedral and said, Sir Rodregas, congratulations are in order for becoming a Knight of the Soaring Heavens, but I fear Vandret is getting suspicious.
Name: Book 9

text: You now have the right to enter the Chamber that holds the greater sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: I think you need to go there now.
Name: Book 9

text: Can I bring you two into the Chamber as my advisors.
Name: Book 9

text: That does seem to be allowed, said Imeralda, Traditionally that is more about fathers with sons, not half bloods and Hellborns, but I think we might have a bigger problem.
Name: Book 9

text: She stopped speaking mid sentence, and Rodregas curiously looked back at her, but she was staring ahead.
Name: Book 9

text: A figure stood there tall and graceful.
Name: Book 9

text: He had appeared out of nowhere, as if by magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Ah, I see the three of you are all together and far away from the others, how convenient for me.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret casually reached out toward the side wall and they could vaguely hear him mumble a few words.
Name: Book 9

text: A second later the sound of doors slamming and bolts and locks sliding closed echoed from every direction.
Name: Book 9

text: I hope you dont mind, but I dont think I want to be interrupted.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas reached for his sword, but found he did not have one.
Name: Book 9

text: He froze for but a second, unsure of what to do.
Name: Book 9

text: Then Vandret spit on the ground and spoke a guttural sound.
Name: Book 9

text: Suddenly Rodregas and the others feet were stuck to the ground, and no matter how hard they pulled their feet would not move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: You know there is a reason that the Immortalist Sorcerers rule this land.
Name: Book 9

text: I have a few questions for you though before I leave your dried up husks behind for the rats.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas growled to himself and pulled the only weapon he had, a small dagger, out and threw it hard straight at Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: A second dagger flew almost in the same heart beat from Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: The sorcerer simply waved in the air and both daggers flew to the side and clattered off the wall.
Name: Book 9

text: The sorcerer smiled, standing tall, and Rodregas had to admit he seemed very relaxed and in control.
Name: Book 9

text: His expensive black and gold robes were perfectly cut, his dark hair was slicked back.
Name: Book 9

text: He might be wearing the body of a twenty year old, but he showed all the self confidence of a man who counted his age in decades if not centuries.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandrets voice reflected the articulation and grace of a man who had all the time in the world to enjoy the finer things in life.
Name: Book 9

text: So let us dispense with the silly games and lies.
Name: Book 9

text: Let me be clear about something.
Name: Book 9

text: You killed Nordien who was a friend of mine.
Name: Book 9

text: You all die this day.
Name: Book 9

text: There is no need for you to use deceptions or exaggerations.
Name: Book 9

text: You die today either way, so speak the truth and it will be a less interesting death.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was furious at himself to be this close to gaining a greater sigil and having achieved knighthood, and then to be caught in a hallway this close to the chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: That, of course, was life.
Name: Book 9

text: There were no simple victories.
Name: Book 9

text: What do you want to know.
Name: Book 9

text: An Immortalist sorcerer died recently and then this summer someone ambushed a caravan with fresh stock for the Menagerie.
Name: Book 9

text: I believe these two events are connected, and I even think you might be the connection, Vandret said.
Name: Book 9

text: His words gaining an edge of anger at the end.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas glanced at the other two.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan met his inquiring look, but did not respond.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was huddled behind Doivans great bulk.
Name: Book 9

text: For a moment Rodregas thought she was hiding from fear of the great sorcerer.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he saw she was actually reading one of the Grimoires that she must have had with her.
Name: Book 9

text: Her fingers were making patterns in the air.
Name: Book 9

text: She was too busy to look up at Rodregas, but he almost smiled.
Name: Book 9

text: He had no idea what she was trying to do, but at least they had something to try.
Name: Book 9

text: He needed to keep Vandret busy to give Imeralda time to do whatever magic she was going to cast.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas turned to Vandret and said, Well, since you are killing us today, how about we make things interesting for both sides.
Name: Book 9

text: I will answer a question of yours every time that you answer one of mine.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret expression darkened and he almost hissed his outrage, You would bargain with me, with your life held by a string.
Name: Book 9

text: For some strange reason that Rodregas was sure reflected a very deep character flaw, he felt his face break out in a very large toothy grin as he said, And I have what to lose.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret stared at him for several long minutes before he shrugged and said, Very well, ask me your question, but then you will answer mine or you die.
Name: Book 9

text: He had no lack of questions, but was not sure which to ask first.
Name: Book 9

text: He decided going small first would cause a less violent reaction.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, How did you find us down here.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandrets expression at the question was like he had asked why is the sky blue.
Name: Book 9

text: He nearly sneered his answer, Through magic, of course, a simple tracking spell.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret did not go small, Are you three responsible for the death of the Immortalist Sorcerer Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: Yes and no, responded Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: He almost left it at that, but decided to continue, I killed Ravenhurr during the Ceremony of Ascension.
Name: Book 9

text: I threw him into his own consuming flames.
Name: Book 9

text: The other two I did not meet until afterwards.
Name: Book 9

text: At Rodregas response Vandret stared at him, You killed an Immortalist Sorcerer by yourself in his tower.
Name: Book 9

text: You truly claim that.
Name: Book 9

text: He did chuckle a bit as he said, First, you want me to admit that I killed an Immortalist Sorcerer, and when I do, you dont believe me.
Name: Book 9

text: An old soldier like me just cant win.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret was too smart not to pick up his hint, An old soldier.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked very quietly.
Name: Book 9

text: My turn to ask a question, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: How did you connect the three of us to these crimes.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret shrugged and smiled and said, To be honest, I did not really think you were the ones.
Name: Book 9

text: I simply did not like you, and the way you hung out with non-Celestials.
Name: Book 9

text: Now, it is my turn to ask a question.
Name: Book 9

text: Actually, interrupted Rodregas, you already asked me about being an old soldier.
Name: Book 9

text: Let me answer that first.
Name: Book 9

text: I was a sergeant in Ravenhurrs guard and I am afraid I have become what I learned to hate more than anything, an Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas paused and took a deep breath.
Name: Book 9

text: What he said next was hard even for himself to say, In truth, I am an old man who had his time on this world and did not do much with it.
Name: Book 9

text: But now I have stolen the body of a very promising young man.
Name: Book 9

text: I will die feeling guilty for what I have done, but I plan to take a few of you with me.
Name: Book 9

text: Now, it is my turn for a question, he said.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas hoped that Imeralda would do whatever she was going to do soon; the conversation was escalating and he did not think they had much time before things got deadly.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas asked, Why did the Immortalist Taiga capture my friend Doivan and keep him in his Menagerie of Earth, Sky and Fire for two years before selling him to Ravenhurr.
Name: Book 9

text: He is a Hellborn and should have been of no interest to those trying to become Celestial Gods.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret became very still at this question, for a long moment he neither moved nor spoke.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas wondered briefly if he even breathed or if the powerful sorcerer had moved beyond such mortal needs.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally Vandret said, I cannot say what was in the minds of others.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret started to raise his hand and Rodregas spoke quickly trying to keep him engaged, So, are you saying there are not Immortalists led by Taiga who are breaking The One Law set by both the Gods in the Celestial Realm and the Daemon Lordsin the Infernal to keep balance.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret went pale at Rodregas words and then he stood up very tall.
Name: Book 9

text: For the first time true anger was in his words, You do not know what you are getting in the middle of.
Name: Book 9

text: You are barely more than a squire and yet you would get in a battle of beings so much greater than you.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalist went from anger to laughter, but his laughter did not last long.
Name: Book 9

text: His laughter was like all things Immortalist, beautiful but cold.
Name: Book 9

text: When it ended he said simply, Time for the three of you to die.
Name: Book 9

text: What Rodregas did next he knew was meaningless, but he hoped it would give Imeralda a last chance to act.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached inside where he used to find his itch, except his former little magical power was now a raging volcano.
Name: Book 9

text: He had learned from Imeralda a new spell to make light; he waved his hands,  mumbled the incantation, and then threw all his power, and sent it straight at Vandret in a stream of energy that felt like a river of lava flowing from his hands.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact there was not so much as a flicker of light.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas lacked the discipline to channel the power.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandrets senses were acute on things arcane and he felt the coming flood of power as if it was a real physical thing.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret spread his hands and made a frantic move that sent a corona of power around him.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course no focused magic came near him, and what did occur startled even Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was literally flying through the air and she had her dagger drawn.
Name: Book 9

text: She did not land smoothly, colliding into Vandrets lower body, but she instantly straightened and thrust her dagger into Vandrets stomach.
Name: Book 9

text: The dagger did not sink far; a few inches.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas expected Vandret to get his hands up and fend her off, but he seemed to be in shock.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda pulled the dagger out and then viscously stuck it back in the sorcerer, her body moved with the stroke, clearly using every ounce of strength she had.
Name: Book 9

text: Still the blade only stuck in a few inches, but Vandret screamed and fell to the floor and started to drag himself away.
Name: Book 9

text: As soon as the surprisingly high pitch of Vandret scream sounded, both Doivans and Rodregas feet were free.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stumbled for a moment, but was running almost, even as he caught himself.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda was stepping forward with the dagger to finish Vandret, but he caught her arm and said, Wait.
Name: Book 9

text: He should be as strong as I am.
Name: Book 9

text: Let me and Doivan get in close.
Name: Book 9

text: She hesitated, but nodded and handed her dagger to him.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan pounded past the two and picked Vandret off the ground, by the front of his robes, and gave him a backhanded slap across the face.
Name: Book 9

text: It was with enough power to have snapped a normal mans neck, but Vandret looked more startled than hurt.
Name: Book 9

text: Gag him and dont let him move his fingers, said Imeralda.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: Even as Doivan nodded he slapped his open palm against Vandrets mouth and used his other hand to grab one of the sorcerers free hands.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas grabbed the other.
Name: Book 9

text: Put him on the ground and kneel on him, Rodregas said to Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: The Hellborn nodded and pushed the sorcerer down on the cold stone ground.
Name: Book 9

text: He next straddled the man with his knees, pining his shoulders.
Name: Book 9

text: I am going to ask him a few questions.
Name: Book 9

text: If either of you think he is going to cast a spell, kill him.
Name: Book 9

text: The other two nodded at Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas reached down and slid the blade under the sorcerers chin and said, One spell and you die, he then nodded to Doivan and the Hellborn lifted his hand a few inches from Vandrets mouth.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret whispered, Please, I am bleeding.
Name: Book 9

text: I need to see a healer.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stared at the sorcerer in disbelief.
Name: Book 9

text: He suffered a few minor injuries and he expected they would just go get him a healer.
Name: Book 9

text: The man killed people to steal their bodies and power.
Name: Book 9

text: How could he think they would respond to such a request.
Name: Book 9

text: Please hurry, I need a healer now, Vandret demanded.
Name: Book 9

text: We will get you a healer as soon as you finish answering our questions, said Doivan, his voice more growl than speech.
Name: Book 9

text: First tell us who among the Immortalists are trying to break The One Law and why, I cant, Vandret whimpered.
Name: Book 9

text: I mean I dont know anything about Immortalists breaking The One Law.
Name: Book 9

text: He suddenly groaned and would have doubled up if Doivan had not been sitting on his chest.
Name: Book 9

text: She was poking his two wounds with her fingers.
Name: Book 9

text: Strangely, his tone strengthened with the pain.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had been getting the idea that it had been a long time since Vandret had faced any uncomfortable physical injury, a very, very, long time.
Name: Book 9

text: But his chin came up and his body tried to straighten as he said, I am an Ambassador for the Immortalist Guild, a friend to the Guild Dealer Taiga himself.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he said a single word and from his mouth poured a huge wind, Doivan flayed around trying to hold on to Vandret, but he lost his grip and hit the ceiling hard.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas crunched the fingers he was holding and heard them snap, even as he was being pushed away.
Name: Book 9

text: With the snapping of the fingers the wind stopped.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then dropped the hand, grabbed Vandrets head and twisted.
Name: Book 9

text: He remembered that day in Raven Tower when he had snapped Korins neck and his arms bunched up, his muscles rippling with the strain.
Name: Book 9

text: Vandret was an Immortalist.
Name: Book 9

text: His neck did not snap easily, but it snapped.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not stop snapping it until he had the mans face looking into the rock below.
Name: Book 9

text: The three sat there for a minute and then stepped away to rest against the far wall to get some distance from Vandrets body.
Name: Book 9

text: After a few minutes Doivan said, Well, one more Immortalist down, thats good.
Name: Book 9

text: The other two nodded.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, We did not learn much more though.
Name: Book 9

text: We still dont really understand why they are interested in Infernal power now and willing to break The One Law.
Name: Book 9

text: You mean if that is what they are doing.
Name: Book 9

text: We really dont know for sure, other than for Ravenhurr, said Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, sounding like granite, said, I know Taiga is involved.
Name: Book 9

text: The other two nodded, but did not pursue that thought.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas then said, I agree we are just starting to figure out that there is something big going on.
Name: Book 9

text: I cant believe even the Immortalists would be crazy enough to go up against both the Celestial Gods and the Daemon Lordsof the Infernal though.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda nodded and said, What price is so high as to be even better than God hood.
Name: Book 9

text: The three sat silent for a few minutes soaking in that question.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked at Imeralda and asked, Well, we cant answer that today, but how did you break Vandrets spell.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda nodded and with a smile said, I always hoped that if I had to take on a sorcerer it would be in the Forest where I would have an edge, but no, it had to be in a hallway.
Name: Book 9

text: I knew my regular spells; he would counter without a problem.
Name: Book 9

text: So I had to work around the spell.
Name: Book 9

text: The spell was one to hold you from walking or running.
Name: Book 9

text: I actually tried to dance or hop, she said with a smile.
Name: Book 9

text: But he was too good, he had those covered.
Name: Book 9

text: But, I have been practicing a spell to float in the air, and that worked.
Name: Book 9

text: The spell was not designed to stop someone from floating in place.
Name: Book 9

text: And then I told Doivan to throw me at Vandret.
Name: Book 9

text: That was a crazy chance, as an Immortalist he could have split you in two with his bare hands, said Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: I know, she said, her voice a little shaken.
Name: Book 9

text: But we were out of options and it was the only thing I could think of.
Name: Book 9

text: Then she added with more confidence, Plus, while everyone knows a knight might learn a bit of magic, a sorcerer never learns to fight.
Name: Book 9

text: They have servants for that.
Name: Book 9

text: The three shared a smile at that.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was very glad that he had insisted that she learn the fundamentals of blade work.
Name: Book 9

text: So what now.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Now we go see if we can get some greater sigils, said Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: And have you decided to take a greater sigil even it if cost you most of your magic.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded and said, Yes, I like to learn magic, but we are on a mission, one that is very important.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalists, especially Taiga, must be stopped.
Name: Book 9

text: If we are going to do that I will be of most use as a warrior.
Name: Book 9

text: We have a powerful magic user, he said with a smile.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda smiled back at the complement and the three got back and continued their walk to the Chamber of Sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: CHAPTER 16 TO RAISE A SWORD.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was careful to walk with the confidence due of a new knight eager for his awards.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Imeralda followed two steps behind, both playing the role of faithful servants to the hilt.
Name: Book 9

text: He saw the double, engraved doors ahead of them, a pair of knights on each side of the door.
Name: Book 9

text: The doors were large enough that the three of them could have entered abreast through the threshold and the doors were solid enough, looking as if they were made out of whole trees.
Name: Book 9

text: Bound in iron, they looked like they could handle a battering ram better than even the front gates.
Name: Book 9

text: A group of knights stood tall next to the doors, but their heads tracked the presence of Rodregas and his two companions.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas vaguely remembered one as Gorin, an older man who under more prosperous times for the knighthood would now be enjoying his retirement.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas yelled boastfully, Open the doors, the Grand Marshal says that I may review the choice I must make.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas walked over and slapped the knight in the arm, laying it on heavy.
Name: Book 9

text: Luckily, his success on the field had him in a good mood.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas waved at the heavy doors as if wiggling his fingers could open them.
Name: Book 9

text: Sir Rodregas, you look good for having just completed the tournament this day, said Gorin.
Name: Book 9

text: I would not expect you to be moving around much yet.
Name: Book 9

text: He could not explain that he already had a minor sigil of healing.
Name: Book 9

text: He simply smiled and said, I am too excited to lie down and groan in pain.
Name: Book 9

text: My mind races with the possibilities.
Name: Book 9

text: Now that I am officially a knight, I want to bring my sworn men into the chamber and figure out what sigils I will choose.
Name: Book 9

text: At his words the mens faces tightened and they looked at his supposed servants.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded his understanding.
Name: Book 9

text: He also knew from his own illustrious career as a guard that the others would follow the rules.
Name: Book 9

text: They were not officers to be making judgments.
Name: Book 9

text: I know you dont like my servants being a Hellborn and a Nymph, he said keeping his voice light.
Name: Book 9

text: But they are my sworn men and I trust them; and it is my call.
Name: Book 9

text: Now open the doors.
Name: Book 9

text: At the last part he let a sergeants voice ring out and it was more order than request.
Name: Book 9

text: And like all good soldiers they immediately carried out his order.
Name: Book 9

text: The door had a strange mechanism such as Rodregas had never seen before.
Name: Book 9

text: Gorin lifted a large handle and solid squares of iron slid out of the floor and the ceiling.
Name: Book 9

text: When both the top and the bottom fully released the guard pushed the doors wide.
Name: Book 9

text: The three immediately pushed through and Rodregas said, You can close the doors.
Name: Book 9

text: I will pound on them when we are ready to leave.
Name: Book 9

text: And with a nervous nod the doors slid closed behind them.
Name: Book 9

text: As the door closed Gorin hastily added, Remember not to touch anything until the Grand Marshal is present.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded at the now closed doors and raised his torch.
Name: Book 9

text: The three gazed around the room in wonderment.
Name: Book 9

text: In response to the torch the room seemed to respond with a vague light of its own, which came from all directions.
Name: Book 9

text: The chamber was large with a tall vaulted ceiling like some temple, but no rows of seats or prayer mats did this temple hold.
Name: Book 9

text: Instead it was filled with beasts; lions and wolves and the great mythical animals of the Celestial Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: Most of these he recognized as the great totems of the Celestial Realm, each representing great power.
Name: Book 9

text: The great beasts were full-size and, but for their lack of movement, Rodregas would have thought that they must have traveled to the Celestial Realm itself.
Name: Book 9

text: Oh, my Gods, they look real.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought they would be made of stone like the frog, said Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: The beasts looked to be made of flesh and bone, except they all stood perfectly still on short stone pedestals.
Name: Book 9

text: Strangely, the room did not smell of damp stone like the rest of the cathedral, but the air smelled of the outdoors in spring.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas eyes were drawn to the powerful lion that reared up not far into the gathered animals, and just to the right of the center.
Name: Book 9

text: He walked over to it.
Name: Book 9

text: It looked like it could have been the twin for the beast that had been devoured by the blue flame on top of Raven Keep.
Name: Book 9

text: He stepped up close looking up at the beast; he was massive.
Name: Book 9

text: The beasts mouth was open, not as if he was going to roar, but simply in relaxed pose.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked like he had been caught stalking forward on the hunt.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped up and just stared at him.
Name: Book 9

text: Dont touch, barked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, he knew not to touch, but then realized that his hand was raised and had been reaching out to stroke the lions mane.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew that this was the greater sigil that he wanted to gain.
Name: Book 9

text: It was in a perfect circle.
Name: Book 9

text: He had taken in the essence of the Celestial Lion back at Raven Keep, and now Rodregas would consume his own magical power with the greater sigil of a Celestial Lion and become a perfect vessel for its power.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas forced himself to step back.
Name: Book 9

text: This was their chance for Doivan, and he would get a second chance if needed.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked over at the other two.
Name: Book 9

text: Once Rodregas had turned around from the lion, Doivan started to walk between the pedestals joining Imeralda at looking around.
Name: Book 9

text: He stood in front of the great six-legged stallion, the kind of steed the Gods themselves ride, and then walked over to the Great White Stag of the forest and then to the giant eagle that guarded the Celestial sky.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a sight to take the breath from any mortal, a score of beasts that appeared to have been taken right from the heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: How were the greater sigils created.
Name: Book 9

text: While the leaser sigils appeared to be simple sculpture empowered by magic, these truly appeared real.
Name: Book 9

text: Yet what magic could capture such powerful beasts for the use of creating sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: Had the greater sigils been gifts to mortals from the Gods themselves.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas yearned to reach out and touch to see if they felt like flesh or stone.
Name: Book 9

text: But, to do so would set his path for the rest of his life.
Name: Book 9

text: If he was truly strong enough for two as Imeralda thought, then he could be a lion and what else.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, Doivan, what do you think.
Name: Book 9

text: I am going to choose lion, but it would be great to have a pride, or maybe the Moon Wolf or the Mountain Bear.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded and walked over to the bear.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a kind of bear that Rodregas had not heard of in the mortal world, even larger than his lion.
Name: Book 9

text: The bear actually had a thick tail and its teeth seemed far larger than any bear he had heard of.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan stood there looking up at the great beast for a long moment.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he cocked his head; his nose went up as if he smelled something.
Name: Book 9

text: He stepped around the great bear and headed toward the back wall.
Name: Book 9

text: The score of statues, while separated, were clustered in the middle of the great room.
Name: Book 9

text: The four walls of the room seemed to be set back with the ceiling gently coming down in the form of great arches.
Name: Book 9

text: In one of the great arches was the door they had entered.
Name: Book 9

text: The stone around the door was the gray of the local granite.
Name: Book 9

text: The three others had black featureless stone that Rodregas did not recognize.
Name: Book 9

text: As he followed Doivan into the shadows of the distant arch Rodregas smelled what had attracted Doivan, the odor of brimstone and hellfire.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas stepped back in shock; what was that smell of the Infernal Realm doing here in the Cathedral of the Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan however, did not step back but stepped forward, reaching out to the stone.
Name: Book 9

text: When he touched it, suddenly there was a doorway.
Name: Book 9

text: It was the twin of the main entrance, except here there were no guards.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan reached for the long handle, but Rodregas quickly said, Stop.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked back at him and Rodregas could see that he was under no magical geis controlling his will, just curiosity of what the source of the Infernal smell was down here.
Name: Book 9

text: But what Doivan said to him was, Where is Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: At these words Rodregas whirled around and looked around throughout the great chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: Both of their eyes were drawn to where they heard a third door being opened.
Name: Book 9

text: As they had found a door smelling of the fires of hell, so apparently had Imeralda found a door.
Name: Book 9

text: She was opening hers.
Name: Book 9

text: They both ran to catch up with her before she got in.
Name: Book 9

text: They dared not run full out as they dodged around the greater sigils, knowing any touch would be permanent.
Name: Book 9

text: They were not in time to stop Imeralda from entering through the hidden door.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could feel Imeralda in front of him, but she and the doors seemed to disappear.
Name: Book 9

text: His eyes seemed of no use so he closed them and simply walked toward where he knew she was.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt Doivan grab onto his shoulder and follow him.
Name: Book 9

text: When he opened his eyes, he saw that they had entered another great chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: At first he thought it was the same size as the first chamber until his eyes saw the huge tree in the middle and followed it up and then up.
Name: Book 9

text: The tree soared above them so high that Rodregas thought it must be far higher than the Cathedral itself.
Name: Book 9

text: This was, of course, impossible.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas stopped beside Imeralda he tried to see the shape of the leaf to identify the type of tree, but the leaves were so high up he could only see a very general shape.
Name: Book 9

text: The shape of the trunk reminded him of a white oak, but the color was a darker gray with touches of striped brown.
Name: Book 9

text: The trunk was huge, thicker than the towers of the keep.
Name: Book 9

text: But that made no sense to Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: The chamber seemed to be the same size as the one they had entered and if one of the great towers had been in the middle there would be hardly room to fit it, and yet the trunk was not that close to them from the door and was not near any of the walls.
Name: Book 9

text: So it was either smaller around, which was impossible because of the height, or the chamber must be far smaller.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas shook his head in confusion.
Name: Book 9

text: What is that.
Name: Book 9

text: asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda smiled a soft smile, one that for a brief moment brought memories of the two of them back at the farm.
Name: Book 9

text: I, she started and then paused as if caught up in her own words, I think that is the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: At the responding look of confusion she said, The legendary source of all Nymphs.
Name: Book 9

text: While we serve the Gods like all mortals, the One Tree is our source.
Name: Book 9

text: It is to us like water is for a fish.
Name: Book 9

text: I dont know how to even explain it to one who is not of our people.
Name: Book 9

text: But I did not think it was real.
Name: Book 9

text: It is a concept of what we are as a people.
Name: Book 9

text: How can it be here off of a chamber for warriors earning the greater sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas caught her arm, holding her back.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure what to say but Doivan was.
Name: Book 9

text: Before you examine it more, can you come look at what we found.
Name: Book 9

text: And I want to see what might be behind the final wall.
Name: Book 9

text: At that comment Rodregas felt his head turn around as if to look through the Chamber walls to study the forth wall.
Name: Book 9

text: As they stepped out of the door the three of them quickly walked over to the forth wall.
Name: Book 9

text: However, they could find nothing but the black stone of the wall; no door appeared under any fingertips.
Name: Book 9

text: Well nothing here, said Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: What did you find earlier.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: It is behind that door we have not opened up yet, but it smells of the Infernal Realm, Doivan said nodding over to the other exposed door.
Name: Book 9

text: I see nothing but black stone.
Name: Book 9

text: she said.
Name: Book 9

text: You dont see that door.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and he shared a look of confusion.
Name: Book 9

text: The three walked back to the door that Doivan had found, and could clearly see.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas waited as Doivan touched the handle but stopped him before he opened it.
Name: Book 9

text: Do you see anything.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda eyes opened wide when Doivan fully opened the doors and revealed the room.
Name: Book 9

text: It was in style identical to the first room of the Celestial Beasts except instead of great beasts on pedestals, it held crouching daemons in pits.
Name: Book 9

text: The previous vague smell of brimstone and hellfire wafted fully into the room.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Rodregas stepped into the room but paused when Imeralda did not follow.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked back and she looked confused, squinting as if the room was not fully illuminated by the glowing daemons in their pits.
Name: Book 9

text: Can you not see into the room.
Name: Book 9

text: No, I can see something, shapes flicking in fire.
Name: Book 9

text: I think I smell something like rotten eggs, but I cant see well enough to go in.
Name: Book 9

text: And I dont know why, but I really dont want to go in.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Rodregas shared another look and then nodding, stepped out of the chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: The three of them stood silent for a minute.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally, Doivan spoke, Maybe you need a connection to see the doors and the room.
Name: Book 9

text: All of us worship the Celestials and we were all drawn to their sigils, especially Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: I was drawn to the door here, which makes sense.
Name: Book 9

text: This room, like the Celestial Chamber, seems to have similar beasts of the Infernal realm.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was also drawn to a lesser extent, which might indicate that we were right about Ravenhurr experimenting with Infernal power.
Name: Book 9

text: If Ravenhurr had already included its magic in his own, then Rodregas would have it now.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda though has no connection to the Infernal Realms and therefore is blind to it.
Name: Book 9

text: The three nodded slowly, caught up in the mystery of the hidden chambers.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda said, The need for a connection to sense the rooms would be true for the knights as well.
Name: Book 9

text: We know that neither Hellborn nor Nymphs are usually allowed in.
Name: Book 9

text: In that case there might actually be another room behind the forth wall that we simply dont have a connection to and therefore cannot sense.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas thought that they were heading along the right path.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda asked, Does that mean that in this room these are great sigils as well.
Name: Book 9

text: Ones that require Infernal sourced magic to work.
Name: Book 9

text: That kind of makes sense if you can have greater sigils that are the shapes of the Celestial Beasts.
Name: Book 9

text: Why not daemons of the Infernal Realm as well.
Name: Book 9

text: But what is the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: It is not a beast of a realm, it is the symbol of the Nymph people.
Name: Book 9

text: It cant be a sigil, can it.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked.
Name: Book 9

text: Neither Doivan nor Rodregas answered and the three of them stood there, each caught up in their own thoughts.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally, Doivan spoke, I am going to see what lies in this Chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: Will you be alright.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: She nodded and seemed relieved as she headed right for the doorway of the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas feared for her.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not sure what the consequences would be if she touched the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: He wanted to follow her, but he followed Doivan into the Infernal chamber instead.
Name: Book 9

text: Was it his own Infernal power calling him.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas and Doivan circled the chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas was not as familiar with the daemons of the Infernal Realms as he was the great beasts of the Celestial Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: He sat looking at a wolf with the tail of a serpent but with large beautiful white wings.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he slowly walked next to a great bull with bat wings and a head that appeared to be very human.
Name: Book 9

text: While he had been drawn to the Chamber both figures repulsed him.
Name: Book 9

text: They mocked the natural order.
Name: Book 9

text: It was  not just that they seemed to combine multiple unconnected animals, but the size and shapes were simply wrong.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked up from his examination of a strange bull daemon and looked for Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: He must have been more familiar with the powers of the various creatures.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan had walked past many of the figures until he stood at one toward the back.
Name: Book 9

text: The shape was a powerfully built dragon with wings partially spread as if getting ready to fly.
Name: Book 9

text: But unlike a real dragon this one had three heads at the end of long serpentine necks; one was that of a wolf, one was of an eagle and one was of a lion.
Name: Book 9

text: What is it.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: They are powerful fighters, but also lead packs of daemons in combat and have powerful magical abilities.
Name: Book 9

text: Most of these others are powerful and dangerous, but a Bunei is more than a simple fighter of the Infernals.
Name: Book 9

text: I am actually surprised to see theyre with the other beasts.
Name: Book 9

text: I thought them a type of Greater Daemon.
Name: Book 9

text: I think I might see what happens when I touch it, Doivan said.
Name: Book 9

text: He was not challenging him.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan was clearly asking himself the same thing.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked over at Rodregas and shrugged.
Name: Book 9

text: We both have the power of the Infernal Realm in us.
Name: Book 9

text: Is it easier for us to manage following the path of righteousness to let the power burn free or to take on the form of a greater sigil and bind the Infernal magic to a specific form.
Name: Book 9

text: I think we must choose carefully.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan said and added, For me the Bunei seems right.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan paused in that thoughtful way he had, considering all sides before taking action.
Name: Book 9

text: If it consumes my Infernal power I would gain its strengths.
Name: Book 9

text: If I am lucky, what magic ability I have left will be mortal or Celestial in nature.
Name: Book 9

text: The Bunei are creatures of magic, they are both great warriors and thinkers and magicians and are even known to sometimes help others.
Name: Book 9

text: I cannot pass this chance up.
Name: Book 9

text: I must see what will happen.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded; they both knew they would not get this chance twice.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan saw in the Bunei what Rodregas had felt in the lion in the main hall.
Name: Book 9

text: See any good Infernal sigils for me.
Name: Book 9

text: I should bind my Infernal gift as well, especially as I will never be a great magician.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had not really expected an answer, but Doivan surprised him by nodding his great head and pointing to the far back almost in a corner that strangely was the only one in shadow.
Name: Book 9

text: I think the NiBarrbari, the daemon known as the Night Panther, would add a bit of subtly to your Celestial Lion.
Name: Book 9

text: While hunters, they are also healers and not as vicious as most of the others.
Name: Book 9

text: It might also cause less confusion if you are able to gain both Infernal and Celestial great sigils to have ones that share some similarities.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded and walked toward where Doivan had pointed, having to circle around what appeared to be a bear with the front feet of a stork and the over large head of an owl.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas felt his skin crawl and he almost left the chamber, but then the cat shape behind the daemon became clear.
Name: Book 9

text: The Daemonic shape seemed to be missing the odd combinations of the others.
Name: Book 9

text: It looked like the large Panthers he had heard of that were found in the southern jungles.
Name: Book 9

text: It had no mane like the lions he knew and its fur was black.
Name: Book 9

text: In fact it was the darkest black he had ever seen.
Name: Book 9

text: This was why, at first, he had not seen the shape in the dark.
Name: Book 9

text: It seemed to soak in and blend in with the night.
Name: Book 9

text: Unlike the Celestial Lion that seemed to be caught in the action of stalking forward in the middle of the hunt, the Night Panther was sitting and seemed to have been caught in the act of simply watching the world.
Name: Book 9

text: His eyes were normal golden cat eyes, not the glowing red of most of the other creatures.
Name: Book 9

text: The only daemonic aspect to the shape was a pair of horns coming out the sides of his head, not that dissimilar to Doivans curving up and back protecting the skull.
Name: Book 9

text: Only the tips were different; while Doivans curved up, these curled down at the end.
Name: Book 9

text: While Doivan had seen a lions head on another man-like shape in the distance, and of course Doivans dragon had a lions head, he felt drawn to this shape.
Name: Book 9

text: While he was not as attracted as he had felt with the Celestial Lion, he guessed that this was as good a match as he would find among the Infernal Daemons.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas looked back toward Doivan, but could no longer see him.
Name: Book 9

text: He knew he should check on him and Imeralda, but he also knew that they had all chosen to walk this path.
Name: Book 9

text: It had ended up being a more interesting path than expected, but they all wanted to see where it went.
Name: Book 9

text: He reached up and petted the powerful black head of the creature.
Name: Book 9

text: Its ears had the only hint of non-black on the beast, a slight touch of silver.
Name: Book 9

text: The fur was not as soft as it looked and was actually rough to the touch.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas realized his hand was sinking into the skin.
Name: Book 9

text: He tried to pull back but felt himself being drawn into it.
Name: Book 9

text: He was being pulled physically into the panther.
Name: Book 9

text: He started to pull away, but then he stopped and let himself sink into the shape of the great beast.
Name: Book 9

text: Panic set in as his mouth started to sink into the creatures head.
Name: Book 9

text: He tried to hold his breath, but he was too late for such an action.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas tried to move but his arms refused to reach out and push the Daemon away.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: His arms felt wrong, like he had no arms to push.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, true panic set in and he tried to fight his way free.
Name: Book 9

text: Something was wrong, the greater sigil was not becoming part of him, he was being made part of the sigil.
Name: Book 9

text: Maybe these were not like the Celestial sigils at all but some kind of Infernal trap.
Name: Book 9

text: He choked, as instead of breathing air he felt liquid enter his mouth and pour into his lungs.
Name: Book 9

text: He was drowning in the beast.
Name: Book 9

text: He had to get out or he would die.
Name: Book 9

text: He was unable to move and unable to breath and was trying to do anything to live.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: His panic faded into anger.
Name: Book 9

text: If he was to die, he would die fighting.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas roared his defiance for the Infernals to hear.
Name: Book 9

text: He reared up and swiped his claws at any that would try to take on a powerful NiBarrbari.
Name: Book 9

text: Let any who would fight him know they took on the night itself and the night had claws.
Name: Book 9

text: He gathered his powerful hind quarters and pounced free with a roar and felt his body soar out of its confinement.
Name: Book 9

text: As he landed he realized that he could feel his arms and legs again.
Name: Book 9

text: They were human again.
Name: Book 9

text: But he knew he had been a cat, a Night Panther, for a moment.
Name: Book 9

text: He stood in shock.
Name: Book 9

text: Was this what it felt like to take on a greater sigil.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt strength and other things he was not sure how to describe.
Name: Book 9

text: He looked around the room and the dim light now seemed far brighter.
Name: Book 9

text: He started walking over toward where he had left Doivan, and this time he got to see the result of taking on a greater sigil as the dragon reared up.
Name: Book 9

text: All three heads roared and the wings started to beat and the dragon seemed to actually fly for a second.
Name: Book 9

text: For just a brief moment there were two daemon dragons.
Name: Book 9

text: Then one of them fell toward the ground only to sink into the shape of Doivan.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan staggered and Rodregas reached out and caught him to keep him from falling.
Name: Book 9

text: Apparently, being a three headed daemon dragon did not include a cat-like ability to land from a fall.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas steadied him and then Doivan shook himself and looked around, confused.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you all right.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan nodded and then said, Lets get out of the chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas nodded, as he wanted to check on Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan seemed to have his balance back.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas wondered if Doivan had lost his balance because he had been trying to fly instead of walk.
Name: Book 9

text: As they stepped out of the room of Infernal sigils and carefully closed the door behind them, Doivan still seemed unsteady and Rodregas wondered if his own experiences had prepared him more naturally for this.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had changed bodies before.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan, why dont you sit down and rest for a second.
Name: Book 9

text: I will check on Imeralda, Doivan nodded his thanks and sank down on the floor.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan seemed to need to think more than rest, but either way Rodregas made sure he was ok and then went to check on Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: He hoped she had not touched the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: As he approached where Imeralda had shown them the door he was dismayed to see only black stone.
Name: Book 9

text: Damn, he said quietly.
Name: Book 9

text: He went to the middle where the door had been and was relieved when he was able to step through the invisible but open doorway.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt nothing as he stepped through the illusion and quickly looked around the chamber for Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: But she was nowhere to be seen.
Name: Book 9

text: He ran to the base of the One Tree finding that it took longer to run from the door to the tree than he had expected.
Name: Book 9

text: He felt like he was approaching a mountain, not a tree.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas started to circle the tree, something that he quickly realized might take a while to accomplish.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he saw her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had been trying to look into the tree, thinking of his experience of being pulled into the Night Panther.
Name: Book 9

text: But then he heard a noise and looked up and saw that she was on a branch high above, looking incredibly small.
Name: Book 9

text: She seemed to be trying to reach something.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: he yelled at her.
Name: Book 9

text: But she seemed caught up or could not hear him.
Name: Book 9

text: How had she gotten up there.
Name: Book 9

text: The branches were way beyond reach.
Name: Book 9

text: Of course, she was a Forest Nymph and he had seen her move in trees like a squirrel.
Name: Book 9

text: Still she seemed very vulnerable high up there; he had to get to her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas took off his harness and boots and grabbed the ridges of the bark.
Name: Book 9

text: He had climbed walls where you stuck your toes in the crack left by old mortar worn away.
Name: Book 9

text: The bark of the tree, like the rest of the tree, was on an epic scale and actually provided good leverage for climbing.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not look at how high he had to go, but instead simply started to climb.
Name: Book 9

text: The climb took far longer than he hoped and he could not see Imeralda as he climbed.
Name: Book 9

text: He was finally getting close to the first of the branches of the tree when he heard Doivan yell.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas, what in the name of the Celestial Winds are you doing.
Name: Book 9

text: He paused in his climb, his toes caught in the bark.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas could feel the wetness of blood on his toes and he felt like he was going to slip at any moment.
Name: Book 9

text: He breathed deep and yelled, I am climbing the damn One Tree, what does it look like.
Name: Book 9

text: Now, shut up before I fall.
Name: Book 9

text: He continued his climb, finally reaching a branch.
Name: Book 9

text: The branch was on such a scale that he had to climb the branch coming up its side.
Name: Book 9

text: The bark of the branch was smoother and offered less of a grip.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally he got to the top, which was broad and actually rather cup-like against the main trunk.
Name: Book 9

text: Though he worried about Imeralda, he let himself rest for a moment to recover.
Name: Book 9

text: After a few minutes Rodregas got up and looked around for Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: He saw that she was actually far out on another impossibly think branch.
Name: Book 9

text: By the Infernals he swore to himself.
Name: Book 9

text: She was a Forest Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: He thought he should just leave her there.
Name: Book 9

text: She could do this far easier than he.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas had an urge to leap from his branch to the other like a cat.
Name: Book 9

text: Maybe he could have made it, but if he missed it was at least a hundred feet down.
Name: Book 9

text: So he climbed the bark over to the other branch and then walked on the top, which was very easy.
Name: Book 9

text: He followed Imeralda out on the branch until it started getting thin and began swaying.
Name: Book 9

text: Then he sat on the branch.
Name: Book 9

text: He did not know what to do next.
Name: Book 9

text: His body relaxed when he heard Imeraldas voice.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you trying to kill me.
Name: Book 9

text: she asked, and are you really trying to rescue a Forest Nymph from a tree.
Name: Book 9

text: The laughter that followed was pure and open and even he had to laugh with it.
Name: Book 9

text: So, he asked, what are you doing.
Name: Book 9

text: Well, I decided that if this was a greater sigil I should touch it.
Name: Book 9

text: Even though I do not want a greater sigil to consume my magic, this is the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: And well, I am a Nymph.
Name: Book 9

text: So I reached out and touched the tree and nothing happened.
Name: Book 9

text: But trees speak to me.
Name: Book 9

text: Speaking to the One Tree was wonderful; the One Tree is here and not here.
Name: Book 9

text: Somehow it can be reached from here I think is the best way to describe it.
Name: Book 9

text: But there is no sigil to be had.
Name: Book 9

text: The tree spoke to me as trees do, and it explained about the Blessing of the One Tree, that is probably why it was here like the greater sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda spoke in a conversational tone but also like she was amazed by her own story.
Name: Book 9

text: She continued, I think for a Nymph the Blessing of the One Tree is like a sigil.
Name: Book 9

text: It directs your magic and focuses it as the Tree of Life wants it, but not by binding it into a shape.
Name: Book 9

text: It heals your spirit and makes you more, well, more of a Nymph, she said, her voice was a tone of sunlight and happiness.
Name: Book 9

text: For reasons Rodregas did not understand he felt great.
Name: Book 9

text: So, why do you have to climb up a hundred feet to the end of a branch to get a blessing from a tree.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda laughed and then yelled down to Doivan, Take your boots off and your harness and your weapons and climb up on the top of one of the big roots.
Name: Book 9

text: That should work, you have to be on the One Tree and then I will show you the blessing.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked like he wanted to argue but with Rodregas nod of encouragement he followed her request, and Imeralda stepped closer and she held three golden fruits.
Name: Book 9

text: The fruits looked like giant acorns, but rounder and softer.
Name: Book 9

text: She handed Rodregas one and then waited for Doivan to follow her instructions.
Name: Book 9

text: Then, warning him to be ready, she dropped down one of the fruits which he caught with his normal grace.
Name: Book 9

text: Stay on the root, she warned him.
Name: Book 9

text: You cannot take one of the blessings off the tree; it will wither and die if you try.
Name: Book 9

text: She winked at Rodregas as she said this.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda then proceeded to eat the acorn shaped fruit; it took some work.
Name: Book 9

text: It seemed to be a bit harder than any ripe fruit Rodregas knew of, but he followed her example and found that while it was tart it was amazing.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas did not know what to call the flavor; the words that came to mind were sunlight and rain and the smell of a forest at night.
Name: Book 9

text: When Rodregas finished the fruit completely he felt more whole but was also sad that it was gone.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda seemed in great humor.
Name: Book 9

text: Come on, she said.
Name: Book 9

text: She dropped to her hands on the edge of the branch and then dropped down as if she was only feet from the ground which, strangely she was.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas saw her standing on the ground.
Name: Book 9

text: It was not that she had floated down.
Name: Book 9

text: It was as if she had she had been in a regular sized tree.
Name: Book 9

text: She smiled and waved at him to follow her.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas decided to follow her example.
Name: Book 9

text: If it did not work, between his Celestial essence and now the Night Panthers sigil, he probably would not die.
Name: Book 9

text: Sure enough he was on the ground like he had dropped a few feet and not a hundred.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan looked at them; he seemed amused and with a deep laugh of his own made a big show of jumping off the root he was standing on.
Name: Book 9

text: The few feet of his jump seemed to lack any magical qualities.
Name: Book 9

text: So, other than making the most memorable snack of my life, you say this was the equivalent of a greater sigil for the Elemental realm.
Name: Book 9

text: So, am I stronger, faster or what.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda shrugged and said, No.
Name: Book 9

text: You are more, well, I think the only way to describe it is more nymph-like.
Name: Book 9

text: There are tales of eating the blessings of the One Tree, most of the greatest Nymphs of our history all claim this.
Name: Book 9

text: A Forest Nymph simply becomes more connected to the forest, and some also claim to gain more than one elemental power.
Name: Book 9

text: There are only a few stories of those people who have been adopted as Nymphs who have earned the blessing, but I have no idea what effect it will have, she said.
Name: Book 9

text: With a shrug she added, But I do not think it will help much on the battlefield.
Name: Book 9

text: It might have little practical effect, but he knew that while a greater sigil might make him a great fighter and that while fighting was necessary, it had no real inherent value.
Name: Book 9

text: It simply made one better at fighting.
Name: Book 9

text: Somehow he knew the blessing was inherently a positive thing.
Name: Book 9

text: He remembered on hot sunny days as a kid the wonderful pleasure of lying under a tree when the city would be so hot in the summer, but in the shade of the tree it was just perfect.
Name: Book 9

text: It was a random thought, but a good one.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan interrupted his memory by asking a question.
Name: Book 9

text: So like Doivan, always thinking, Rodregas thought with a smile.
Name: Book 9

text: So first I make my infernal side more structured and then I become a part Nymph, a strange combination for a Hellborn.
Name: Book 9

text: Rodregas said, I think we both feel the importance of the blessing and I thank you for sharing it.
Name: Book 9

text: She nodded and said, I am so happy that I decided to go with you to sneak in, otherwise I would never have been able to receive the blessing of the One Tree.
Name: Book 9

text: No matter how successful we are now against the Immortalists, I have been blessed as few of my people have.
Name: Book 9

text: Imeralda looked like she wanted to talk and Rodregas hated to break the mood, but they needed to get back to business.
Name: Book 9

text: We should return to the main chamber.
Name: Book 9

text: The Grand Marshal will be coming soon for the official moment for me to take on a greater sigil, and I dont think we want them to find these chambers.
Name: Book 9

text: As Rodregas walked from the chamber of the One Tree he felt more regret than when he had left the Infernal chamber; though in all likelihood the sigil from the Night Panther would prove to be of more use on his quest.
Name: Book 9

text: The three walked as one to the Celestial Lion.
Name: Book 9

text: They looked first at the great beast and then at Rodregas.
Name: Book 9

text: Are you sure I have the magical strength to take on two greater sigils.
Name: Book 9

text: he asked Imeralda.
Name: Book 9

text: Few have such strength; taking a second greater sigil seems to consume far more power than one.
Name: Book 9

text: It is not just twice as much, but far more.
Name: Book 9

text: Only the most powerful have such magic, but you have the power of an Immortalist mage.
Name: Book 9

text: I cant promise it, but you should have such magical strength.
Name: Book 9

text: Doivan and Imeralda watched silently as he reached out to touch the Celestial Lion, his hand again drawn to its mane.
Name: Book 9

text: This time no voice spoke up to warn him away.
Name: Book 9

text: The fur of the mane was surprisingly rough to the touch, and strangely, Rodregas smelled grass.
Name: Book 9

text: His large frame stalked through the grass, eager for the hunt to begin.
Name: Book 9

text: The great Lion twitched his ears to the right.
Name: Book 9

text: He had expected his nemesis, the White Stag, but instead walked a woman.
Name: Book 9

text: Her long legs somehow managed to keep pace with him.
Name: Book 9

text: Her hair, as golden as his own fur, rained down her curved back; she wore a glowing short white shift adorned with many pouches.
Name: Book 9

text: Why do you hunt with me, Goddess.
Name: Book 9

text: The Goddess Blodeuwedd answered, I am proud of you.
Name: Book 9

text: I will be truthful, I shared my favor with you simply as a matter of convenience.
Name: Book 9

text: I hoped you might succeed.
Name: Book 9

text: I did not think you would live, much less add to your power and gather more hunters to our pride.
Name: Book 9

text: The great Lion shook his head, the ways of the winds and the speech of gods were the same, fickle and not to be truly understood.
Name: Book 9

text: Yet he sensed that somehow the words sounded fair and right in some way that he could not really explain.
Name: Book 9

text: Blodeuwedd smiled at him, a smile that answered nothing but claimed to answer everything.
Name: Book 9

text: The two continued to walk through the tall grass.
Name: Book 9

text: After a few minutes she spoke, The Gods and Daemon Lords are allowed to choose champions, but are not allowed to speak directly to any mortal.
Name: Book 9

text: For this moment you are enough in the Celestial Realm for me to ask you a question: I dont understand why you have chosen that.
Name: Book 9

text: As she spoke she raised her slim perfect arm and pointed at his shadow.
Name: Book 9

text: He lowered his great head and studied the dark shape.
Name: Book 9

text: The great lion had to admit the shadow was odd, slimmer than his great bulk, strangely dark in the day and the shadows eyes seem to glow the bright yellow color of flame.
Name: Book 9

text: He shook his great head and mane as if to free it from the strange shadow, and growled, You are a Goddess; you can see all.
Name: Book 9

text: Blodeuwedd nodded, she forgot to walk for a moment, as if in deep thought, but still she kept up with the Great Lion stalking through the grassland.
Name: Book 9

text: I can see all in our realm, and all in the mortal realm that is seen by one of our followers.
Name: Book 9

text: I cannot see into the Infernal or Elemental Realms, and I think you have entered both.
Name: Book 9

text: I do not know what this means.
Name: Book 9

text: The two continued through the grass for a few moments in silence.
Name: Book 9

text: The Great Lion did not understand the Goddess questions or concerns.
Name: Book 9

text: But he understood his own power, which in its way was as great as any gods.
Name: Book 9

text: He growled, Do you wish me to hunt, to fight.
Name: Book 9

text: Is our pride in danger.
Name: Book 9

text: Blodeuwedd nodded, Yes and yes and yes.
Name: Book 9

text: In their great quest for power, The Immortalist Taiga and his followers, such as that vermin Vandret, must all be stopped.
Name: Book 9

text: They do not understand that if they upset the balance that the final battle between Infernal and Celestial could destroy all.
Name: Book 9

text: She paused and then added in a voice that he almost thought he sensed fear in, I think the sword Caledfwlch must be found.
Name: Book 9

text: The other gods wont like it.
Name: Book 9

text: They might even oppose finding it, but it might be our only hope.
Name: Book 9

text: The great head nodded, and the Goddess stepped away and was gone, but the roar that followed could be heard across the grasslands and into the forest and to the peaks of the mountains beyond.
Name: Book 9

text: For a moment the Heavenly Realm was silent.
Name: Book 9

text: All the creatures knew the roar.
Name: Book 9

text: The great Celestial Lion was on the hunt and when he found his prey, there would be a battle to shake all the realms.
Name: Book 9

text: As the roar faded in the heavens, a new Knight Captain, a chosen Champion of a Goddess, stood in the great Cathedral of the Heavens.
Name: Book 9

text: He heard the roar because it was his.
Name: Book 9

text: The other hunters in his pride were at his side and ready.
Name: Book 9

text: It was time to start the hunt.
Name: Book 9

text: Thank you for reading The Celestial Paladin.
Name: Book 9

text: I hope you will read the next book in The Order of the Lion series The Hellborn Prince.
Name: Book 9

text: Celestial - Led by the All-Father Alld and a pantheon of gods most of who are his children, but also includes those who have ascended to the Celestial Realm.
Name: Book 9

text: The realm is also the habitat for the Celestial beast who symbolize varies aspects of the gods.
Name: Book 9

text: Infernal - Led by the High Prince Sathariel and his court of Daemon Lords in a realm of fire and chaos and constraint struggle.
Name: Book 9

text: The realm is full of minor daemons that symbolize various aspects of the Daemon Lords.
Name: Book 9

text: Elemental - The One Tree connects the power of the natural realm and exists both within the mortal realm and beside it.
Name: Book 9

text: One aspect of the Elemental realm is One Tree and another is Gaia the nurturing mother, and the four elemental dragons; EArth, Fire, Water and AIr.
Name: Book 9

text: The Guild of the Celestial Path  The organization of over a hundred Sorcerers who rule a large section of the Eastern Realms.
Name: Book 9

text: Each Immortalist Sorcerer rules their own town or City, but are a member of the Guild that protects their mutual interest.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortalist Sorcerers are united in their desire to strengthen themselves over time until they can ascend into the Celestial Realm and become gods.
Name: Book 9

text: The Immortal Guards - The standing army of the Guild of the Celestial Path.
Name: Book 9

text: They enforce the will of the guild.
Name: Book 9

text: In addition to their martial prowess and training all member are sigil warriors and use enchanted armor and weapons to increase their effectiveness.
Name: Book 9

text: The Order of the Soaring Heavens - An ancient order of Knights who live by a strict code of conduct.
Name: Book 9

text: In addition to their martial prowess and training they are all sigil warriors and use enchanted armor to increase their effectiveness.
Name: Book 9

text: The Celestial Gods pick their Paladins from their membership.
Name: Book 9

text: Sigil Warriors - Those who are born with magical talent but do not wish to be sorcerers have the opportunity inscribe a sigil on their magic talent that uses up a portion of their magical ability.
Name: Book 9

text: Lesser sigils are simple such as health, strength, quickness.
Name: Book 9

text: Greater Sigils are more complex and can mimic the powers of Celestial Beast or Infernal Daemons.
Name: Book 9

text: Dire Beast - Are common mortal animals that have breed with either a celestial beast or an infernal daemon.
Name: Book 9

text: Dire Beast who are of the Blood are direct descendent while, a regular dire beast will be several generation removed but still show signs of their ancestry.
Name: Book 9

text: Night Bronze - a heavy armor usually only worn by warriors who are either part Celestial or are Hellborn or have a Sigil of Strength due to its heavy weight.
Name: Book 9

text: The metal is highly magical and can hold powerful enchantments.
Name: Book 9

text: Though very strong it does not hold an edge well and is seldom used to produce an edged weapon.
Name: Book 9

text: Mithril - a silvery metal that is light in weight.
Name: Book 9

text: It can be beaten like copper, and polished like glass; light and yet harder than tempered steel.
Name: Book 9

text: The metal is magical in nature and can hold enchantments.
Name: Book 9

text: Blue Steel - is a steel and Mithril alloy, that holds an enhanced strength and edge.
Name: Book 9

text: The most powerful of these weapons are Kissed by Fire.
Name: Book 9

text: About the Author Gil Hough was born in Detroit, Michigan and raised on the waters of lake St.
Name: Book 9

text: Clair, spending the majority of his youth reading and boating.
Name: Book 9

text: After graduating from Grand Valley State University, where he mostly studied his love of the sport of rowing, he left for various adventures which included several years of non-violent reconciliation work in Northern Ireland through the Brethren Volunteer Service, working with refuges from Central America seeking political asylum and teaching English as a second language in Torreon, Mexico.
Name: Book 9

text: Gil eventually settled in Knoxville, Tennessee where he resides today.
Name: Book 9

text: After spending four years organizing Appalachian communities, he worked as the Tennessee Director of Renewable Programs at the Southern Alliance for Clean Energy, until he moved on to developing renewable projects with Restoration Services, Inc.
Name: Book 9

text: He is a founding member of TenneSEIA (Tennessee Solar Energy Industries Association) where he serves on the Board of Directors, advocating for the orderly and sustained development of solar energy.
Name: Book 9

text: Feel free to share your thoughts on the book by emailing him at gilhough@yahoo.
Name: Book 9

text: com or follow Gil on Twitter or to learn more about The Order of the Lion series on Facebook.
Name: Book 9

text: UNCOMMON OPPORTUNITIES An Agenda for Peace and Equitable Development.
Name: Book 9

text: The Report of The International Commission on Peace and Food.
Name: Book 9

text: PUBLISHED BY: The International Center for Peace and Development at Smashwords.
Name: Book 9

text: Copyright  2010 by The International Center for Peace and Development.
Name: Book 9

text: Without limiting the rights under copyright reserved above, no part of this publication may be reproduced, stored in or introduced into a retrieval system, or transmitted, in any form, or by any means (electronic, mechanical, photocopying, recording, or otherwise) without the prior written permission of both the copyright owner and the above publisher of this book.
Name: Book 9

text: The broad range of topics examined by the International Commission on Peace and Food demonstrates the interrelated nature of the challenges of peace and development.
Name: Book 9

text: Your collective endeavour illustrates the fact that no longer can global peace and security remain the preserve of political and military specialists.
Name: Book 9

text: Without an adequate development effort, there can be no lasting peace and security.
Name: Book 9

text: Conflicts over resources, ultra-nationalism exacerbated by the tensions of unemployment, poverty and despair at home will inevitably lead to resentment, and resentment turns only too easily into armed conflict.
Name: Book 9

text: The establishment of secure foundations for peace will be aided by development and post-conflict peace building.
Name: Book 9

text: Yet if there is a growing international consensus on the peace operations undertaken by the United Nations, there is no such consensus on its developmental work.
Name: Book 9

text: Indeed, this lack of a consensus reflects a worldwide crisis in the field of development economics.
Name: Book 9

text: As development becomes imperative, as we approach the turn of this century, we are faced with the necessity of giving new meaning to the word.
Name: Book 9

text: Reflecting on development is thus, in my opinion, the most important intellectual challenge of the coming years.
Name: Book 9

text: Already, it seems clear that macro-economic growth can no longer be deemed sufficient for development purposes.
Name: Book 9

text: Countries pursuing macro-economic growth paths have the necessary foundations for development, but that is only the first part.
Name: Book 9

text: There can be no lasting development with the exclusion of social groups from the fruits of growth.
Name: Book 9

text: Nor can there be long-term prospects for development when the environment is pillaged and the rights of future generations ignored.
Name: Book 9

text: Finally, growth which is not accompanied by the improve ment of the social fabric of society will be only a hollow shell.
Name: Book 9

text: For economic and social development to take place, it is important to promote the expansion of employment opportunities, the improvement of educational and health networks, support for the role of women in development and the pursuit of equality between the sexes.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 9

text: A hitherto ignored dimension of the development challenge is democratization: what I have chosen to call political development.
Name: Book 9

text: There have been cases where development was accompanied by an authoritarian political system.
Name: Book 9

text: But we have invariably seen that if the participation in the market place is not accompanied by political participation, development efforts are brought to naught by social and political instability.
Name: Book 9

text: Political, economic and social development must be closely related, mutually supportive, deriving sustenance from one another.
Name: Book 9

text: Once again, therefore, we see the inescapable relations governing the goals of peace, development and democratization these are the goals of the United Nations.
Name: Book 9

text: The United Nations has, over the years, devoted great time and attention to the issues before the Commission on Peace and Food.
Name: Book 9

text: In the research, analysis, debate, consensus-building and actual operational activities of the United Nations System, the issues of peace, develop ment and democratization have been at the forefront.
Name: Book 9

text: The Members of the International Commission on Peace and Food have interacted closely with the United Nations Funds, Programmes and Specialized Agencies.
Name: Book 9

text: This report brings together many of the issues which are central to the reflection on development which the United Nations is trying to encourage, leading to the World Summit on Social Development to be held in 1995.
Name: Book 9

text: Boutros Boutros-Ghali Secretary General United Nations.
Name: Book 9

text: The report of the International Commission on Peace and Food focuses on the 'uncommon opportunities' that have arisen as the world shifts into new alignments.
Name: Book 9
